Mud Breath.name: Mud Breath
Mud Breath.description: The mephit belches viscid mud onto one creature within 5 feet of it. If the target is Medium or smaller, it must succeed on a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw or be &Reference[Restrained apply=false] for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Death Burst.name: Death Burst
Death Burst.description: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a burst of sticky mud. Each Medium or smaller creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw or be &Reference[Restrained apply=false] until the end of the creature's next turn.

False Appearance.name: False Appearance
False Appearance.description: While the mephit remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary mound of mud.

Crooked Man.name: Crooked Man
Crooked Man.description:
Crooked Man

Broken Spirit of Betrayal

Habitat: Any

Treasure: None

The crooked man is an Undead embodiment of broken trust and the twisting of purpose. Those who die having betrayed what they hold sacred, embracing their treachery to their core, might return in this broken, gnarled form of snapped bones with a crooked grin. The creature’s fingers end in curling claws that hook and hold, and the duplicity in its heart bleeds out to twist allies against one another. Despite the creature’s name, anyone can become this manifestation of betrayal.

Secret. The crooked man can’t abide self-sacrifice and withers in its presence.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The crooked man makes two [[/item Crooked Claw]] attacks, and he can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Snap Limb]]. He can also use Confusion if available.

Crooked Claw.name: Crooked Claw
Crooked Claw.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &reference[grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 16) from one of two claws. Until the grapple ends, the target has the &reference[restrained apply=false] condition.

Snap Limb.name: Snap Limb
Snap Limb.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC 19, one creature the crooked man is grappling, and that has limbs that can break.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the bones (or equivalent) in one of the target’s limbs (crooked man’s choice) breaks, causing an appropriate effect below. A broken limb heals in 40 days, or when the creature regains any Hit Points from magic or Regeneration.

Success: Half damage only.

  • Broken Arm. Disadvantage on attack rolls. Can’t hold anything or manipulate objects with the limb.

  • Broken Leg. Speed halved. If the creature takes the Dash action, it must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or have the &reference[prone apply=false] condition.

  • Broken Wing. Fly Speed reduced to 0.

Confusion.name: Confusion
Confusion.description: The crooked man casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplConfusion0]{Confusion}, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17).

Blinking Teleport.name: Blinking Teleport
Blinking Teleport.description: The crooked man has the &reference[invisible apply=false] condition for 1 minute and teleports to an unoccupied space he can see within 60 feet. The condition ends immediately after the crooked man deals any damage

Aversion To Self-sacrifice.name: Aversion To Self-sacrifice
Aversion To Self-sacrifice.description: The crooked man takes [[/damage average]] damage if he can see a creature willingly take damage or gain a condition in place of someone else, or to someone else’s benefit.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The crooked man has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

HSa8booR4YOdeYi2.name: Confusion
HSa8booR4YOdeYi2.description:
This spell assaults and twists creatures' minds, spawning delusions and provoking uncontrolled action. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw when you cast this spell or be affected by it.

An affected target can't take reactions and must roll from the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.tables.RollTable.LHEts1oDaDwcehuj]{Confusion} table at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the radius of the sphere increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 4th.

The Harvest Terror.name: The Harvest Terror
The Harvest Terror.description:
The Harvest Terror

Demon of Secrets and Despair

Habitat: Grassland, Planar (Abyss)

Once a jovial soul imbued into the body of a scarecrow called Ol’ Jericho Sticks, the Harvest Terror is now a nightmarish abomination. It is a mockery of demonic flesh molded in the shape of a crow-like scarecrow. Its twisted body is made of molding wicker with four tattered, black-feathered wings sprouting from its back. An oversized corvid head with amber eyes sits upon its broad shoulders, its dark beak a jagged mess, and it wields a chipped, wicked scythe covered in old blood. Forever hungry, the Harvest Terror feeds on secrets and those that keep them.

Secret. The soul of Ol’ Jericho Sticks still exists in the dark recesses of the Harvest Terror’s mind. Singing or playing Jericho’s favorite song tips the balance of control over Jericho’s stolen body.

The Harvest Terror’s Lair

The Harvest Terror’s lair is the extraplanar corn maze known as the Fields of the Crow.

The region containing the Harvest Terror’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Amber Eyes. Within 1 mile of the lair, amber-eyed crows watch everything. Enemies of the Harvest Terror have disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks in the region.

Spilled Secrets. Within 1 mile of the lair, creatures other than the Harvest Terror have disadvantage on Charisma (Deception) checks made to keep secrets.

If the Harvest Terror dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The terror makes one [[/item Claw]] attack and one [[/item Scythe]] attack.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Scythe.name: Scythe
Scythe.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Dirge Of Secrets.name: Dirge Of Secrets
Dirge Of Secrets.description: The terror shrieks a chorus of horrific secrets. Each creature within 30 feet of the terror must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 11 ([[/r 2d10]]) psychic damage and has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls for 1 minute. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only. An affected creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The terror can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The terror regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Averting Winds.name: Averting Winds
Averting Winds.description: The terror casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ew6GA8dJy2spQmFW] (which can’t appear in a creature’s space), requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

Crow’s Swoop.name: Crow’s Swoop
Crow’s Swoop.description: The terror moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

Devour Secrets.name: Devour Secrets
Devour Secrets.description: The terror’s beak gapes and devours secrets. Each creature within 20 feet of the terror must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw (with disadvantage if the target has given up one of its secrets to the terror). On a failed save, a target takes 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) psychic damage, and its speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions

Demonic Mimicry.name: Demonic Mimicry
Demonic Mimicry.description: The terror can mimic voices and sounds it has heard. A listener can discern the mimicry for what it is with a successful DC 18 Wisdom (Insight) check.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the terror fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The terror has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Unraveling Song.name: Unraveling Song
Unraveling Song.description: As an action, a creature can play or sing Jericho Sticks’ favorite song, “Coal-Eyed Birds,” and the terror is &Reference[Charmed apply=false] until the end of the creature’s next turn. The &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition ends early if the creature damages the terror or forces it to make a saving throw.

Wind Wall.name: Wind Wall
Wind Wall.description:
A wall of strong wind rises from the ground at a point you choose within range. You can make the wall up to 50 feet long, 15 feet high, and 1 foot thick. You can shape the wall in any way you choose so long as it makes one continuous path along the ground. The wall lasts for the Duration.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Strength saving throw. A creature takes 3d8 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The strong wind keeps fog, smoke, and other gases at bay. Small or smaller flying creatures or objects can't pass through the wall. Loose, lightweight materials brought into the wall fly upward. Arrows, bolts, and other ordinary projectiles launched at targets behind the wall are deflected upward and automatically miss. (Boulders hurled by Giants or siege engines, and similar projectiles, are unaffected.) Creatures in gaseous form can't pass through it.

The Chained Reaper.name: The Chained Reaper
The Chained Reaper.description:
The Chained Reaper

Burdened Harbinger of Death

Habitat: Any

The Chained Reaper is all that remains of a once-noble orc caretaker of the departed called Yorgrim. Having been corrupted by the mists of death known as the Shroud, the Chained Reaper is a being of hatred and bitterness, striving to cremate all living things in its balefire before binding them in chains of anguish.

Secret. The Chained Reaper carries a memorial stone upon its back. If one can read aloud the names inscribed there, their purity will burn away the reaper’s fury.

The Chained Reaper’s Lair

The Chained Reaper’s lair is a mausoleum holding its own empty grave and those of its former companions.

The region containing the Chained Reaper’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Chained Vitality. A creature that isn’t a Construct or Undead that finishes a long rest within 1 mile of the lair must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have its hit point maximum reduced by 5 (to a minimum of 1 HP) until it next finishes a long rest.

Falling Shroud. Thin mist arises within 1 mile of the lair. Undead with the Incorporeal Movement trait in that area have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

If the Chained Reaper dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The reaper makes one [[/item Balefire Scythe]] attack and one [[/item Chain]] attack, and it uses either Chain Slam or Fling.

Balefire Scythe.name: Balefire Scythe
Balefire Scythe.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target begins burning.  It takes Necrotic damage instead of Fire damage while burning in this way.

Chain.name: Chain
Chain.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 20 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 15) from one of four chains.

Chain Slam.name: Chain Slam
Chain Slam.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature Grappled by the reaper.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[Stunned apply=false] condition until the start of the reaper’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Etherealness.name: Etherealness
Etherealness.description: The reaper casts the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplEtherealne]{Etherealness} spell, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability. The reaper is visible on the Material Plane while on the Border Ethereal and vice versa, but it can’t affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

Fling.name: Fling
Fling.description:
The reaper throws a Large or smaller creature Grappled by it to a space it can see within 30 feet of itself that isn’t in the air.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 17, the creature thrown and each creature in the destination space.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Success: Half damage only.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The reaper can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The reaper regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Drift.name: Drift
Drift.description: The reaper moves up to half its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

Lantern Flare.name: Lantern Flare
Lantern Flare.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature of the reaper's choice in a 20-foot Emanation originating from it.

Failure: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

OHVlJAW5yCCg3sht.name: Balefire Scythe
OHVlJAW5yCCg3sht.description: The reaper makes one [[/item Balefire Scythe]] attack. The reaper can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: The Chained Reaper’s lair is a mausoleum holding its own empty grave and those of its former companions. The region containing the Chained Reaper’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects: If the Chained Reaper dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Chained Vitality.name: Chained Vitality
Chained Vitality.description: A creature that isn’t a Construct or Undead that finishes a long rest within 1 mile of the lair must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have its hit point maximum reduced by 5 (to a minimum of 1 HP) until it next finishes a long rest.

Falling Shroud.name: Falling Shroud
Falling Shroud.description: Thin mist arises within 1 mile of the lair. Undead with the Incorporeal Movement trait in that area have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

Ancestral Shame.name: Ancestral Shame
Ancestral Shame.description: If a creature that can speak Orc within 30 feet of the reaper takes an action to read aloud the names carved in the stone on the reaper’s back, the reaper takes 20 radiant damage.

Ethereal Sight.name: Ethereal Sight
Ethereal Sight.description: The reaper can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The reaper can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the reaper fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Wrapped Chains.name: Wrapped Chains
Wrapped Chains.description: The reaper is wrapped in ghostly chains. It adds its Charisma modifier to its AC instead of Dexterity.

LdrqF10ZINeFS8Mf.name: Etherealness
LdrqF10ZINeFS8Mf.description:
You step into the border regions of the Ethereal Plane, in the area where it overlaps with your current plane. You remain in the Border Ethereal for the Duration or until you use your action to dismiss the spell. During this time, you can move in any direction. If you move up or down, every foot of Movement costs an extra foot. You can see and hear the plane you originated from, but everything there looks gray, and you can't see anything more than 60 feet away.

While on the Ethereal Plane, you can only affect and be affected by other creatures on that plane. Creatures that aren't on the Ethereal Plane can't perceive you and can't interact with you, unless a special ability or magic has given them the ability to do so.

You ignore all Objects and Effects that aren't on the Ethereal Plane, allowing you to move through objects you perceive on the plane you originated from.

When the spell ends, you immediately return to the plane you originated from in the spot you currently occupy. If you occupy the same spot as a solid object or creature when this happens, you are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space that you can occupy and take force damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved.

This spell has no effect if you cast it while you are on the Ethereal Plane or a plane that doesn't border it, such as one of the Outer Planes.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you can target up to three willing creatures (including you) for each slot level above 7th. The creatures must be within 10 feet of you when you cast the spell.

If you move up or down, every foot of movement costs an extra foot. You can perceive the plane you left, which looks gray, and you can't see anything there more than 60 feet away.

While on the Ethereal Plane, you can affect and be affected only by creatures, objects, and effects on that plane. Creatures that aren't on the Ethereal Plane can't perceive or interact with you unless a feature gives them the ability to do so.

When the spell ends, you return to the plane you left in the spot that corresponds to your space in the Border Ethereal. If you appear in an occupied space, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and take Force damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved.

This spell ends instantly if you cast it while you are on the Ethereal Plane or a plane that doesn't border it, such as one of the Outer Planes.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.You can target up to three willing creatures (including yourself) for each spell slot level above 7. The creatures must be within 10 feet of you when you cast the spell.

Deepdreck.name: Deepdreck
Deepdreck.description:
Deepdreck

Poisoned Subterranean Wretch

Habitat: Underground

Deepdrecks were miners long ago who found themselves far too deep beneath the earth, where they were cursed and corrupted by deforming powers. Now they tunnel and dig greedily, bloated with poisonous gases.

Astute observers have noted that these monsters occasionally bear a resemblance to missing loved ones who have long been thought dead.

Secret. The toxic essence of deepdrecks is disrupted by pleasant scents such as flowers, perfume, spices, or incense.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The deepdreck makes two attacks, using [[/item Claw]] or [[/item Putrid Emission]] in any combination.

Claw.name: Claw

Explosive Death.name: Explosive Death
Explosive Death.description: When the deepdreck dies, it explodes, and each creature within 15 feet of it must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 13 ([[/r 3d8]]) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Fragrance Aversion.name: Fragrance Aversion
Fragrance Aversion.description: The deepdreck has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws while within 10 feet of burning incense or a creature wearing Perfume.

Tunneler.name: Tunneler
Tunneler.description: The deepdreck can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 5-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

Crowstorm.name: Crowstorm
Crowstorm.description:
Crowstorm

Fiendish Murder

Habitat: Grassland, Planar (Lower Planes), Urban

A crowstorm is a great, swirling mass of dark feathers accompanied constant, harshly malevolent crow calls. Hundreds of fiendish birds fly in unison, their beady eyes dripping blood as they swoop down to tear at the flesh of their victims. A crowstorm’s horrific caws mingle into an eerie cacophony of pleading whispers, and it robs the gift of flight from anything that draws too close.

Secret. While they might take the form of crows or possess crow bodies, crowstorms are held at bay by drawn images or crafted effigies of crows.

Peck.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, or 7 ([[/r 1d8 + 3]]) piercing damage if the swarm has half its hit points or fewer. If the target is a creature, it has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of the swarm’s next turn.

Cacophony.name: Cacophony

On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

False Crows.name: False Crows

Swarm.description: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny crow. The swarm can’t regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

Knight.description: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Plate Armor.description: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

Heavy Crossbow.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) piercing damage.

Leadership.name: Leadership

The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is incapacitated.

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description: The knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee Attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

Brave.name: Brave

Phantom Hearse.name: Phantom Hearse
Phantom Hearse.description:
Phantom Hearse

Ghostly Coach of the Dead

Habitat: Any

Treasure: Any

Phantom hearses are ghostly carriages complete with horses and coachmen—amalgamations of tormented souls driven to claim the living and drag them to the land of the dead.

The spirit coachmen strike with phantom whips and weapons, and even fly out to harry foes at a distance, while the ghostly horses drive the hearse in a crushing charge that gathers victims and seals them into a spectral coffin that drains the warmth and vitality from flesh and bone. The tolling bell on the carriage precedes the apparition’s appearance, and its sepulchral sound has caused more than a few witnesses to drop dead on the spot.

Secret. Phantom hearses are driven to collect the living, and they can’t see a living creature that holds its breath.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The hearse makes two [[/item Ghostly Coachman]] attacks. It can replace one of the attacks with a use of [[/item Trample]], if available.

Ghostly Coachman.name: Ghostly Coachman
Ghostly Coachman.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 10 ft. or range 60 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a creature, it can’t regain Hit Points until the start of the hearse’s next turn.

Trample.name: Trample
Trample.description:
The hearse moves in a straight line up to its Speed.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 16, each creature whose space the hearse enters during this action.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it has the &reference[grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 14), and it has the &reference[restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Success: Half damage only.

Tolling Bell.name: Tolling Bell
Tolling Bell.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 16, each creature of the hearse’s choice that it can see in a 30-foot Emanation originating from the hearse.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the creature’s Speed is halved until the start of the hearse’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Entomb.name: Entomb
Entomb.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC 16, one creature &reference[grappled apply=false] by the hearse (it can have up to three creatures entombed at a time).

Failure: The target is entombed in a coffin in the hearse, and the Grappled condition ends. An entombed target has the &reference[blinded apply=false] and &reference[restrained apply=false conditions, has Total Cover against attacks and other effects outside the hearse, and at the start of each of the hearse's turns it takes [[/damage average]] damage and gains 1 &reference[exhaustion apply=false] level.

If the hearse takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside a coffin, the hearse must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or release all entombed creatures, each of which falls in a space within 5 feet of the hearse and has the &reference[prone apply=false] condition.

If the hearse dies, any entombed creature falls to the ground with the &reference[prone apply=false] condition in the hearse’s former space.

Breathless Warding.name: Breathless Warding
Breathless Warding.description: A creature holding its breath has the &reference[invisible apply=false] condition to the hearse. If the creature takes damage while holding its breath, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or let out its breath and become visible to the hearse until the start of the creature’s next turn, when it can hold its breath again.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The hearse can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes [[/damage average]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Hemonculus.name: Hemonculus
Hemonculus.description:
Hemonculus

Sanguine Servitor (Fresh blood and gem dust)

Habitat: Planar (Lower Planes)

Treasure: None

Hemonculus are servitors created by a blood magic ritual that binds a fiendish spirit into a blood-formed body. For the cost of a small sacrifice in blood (the creator’s own or otherwise), the creatures serve as spies and assist in procuring further blood for magical use.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description:
Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]] reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the hemonculus attaches to the target. While attached, the hemonculus automatically hits the target with its Claw attacks.

The hemonculus can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement.

The target or a creature within 5 feet of it can detach the hemonculus as an action.

Exsanguinate.name: Exsanguinate
Exsanguinate.description:
The hemonculus magically draws blood from nearby creatures.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 13, each creature of the hemonculus’ choice in a 15-foot Emanation originating from the hemonculus.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target can’t regain Hit Points until the start of the hemonculus’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Success or Failure: If the hemonculus is attached to a creature, the hemonculus regains Hit Points equal to the Necrotic damage taken by that target.

Blood Sense.name: Blood Sense
Blood Sense.description: The hemonculus knows the location of any Bloodied creature within 60 feet of it, unless the creature is a Construct or Undead.

Flyby.name: Flyby
Flyby.description: The hemonculus doesn’t provoke an Opportunity Attack when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The hemonculus has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Keen Hearing and Sight.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
Keen Hearing and Sight.description: The scout has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target has the Prone condition and then ends its turn.

Halt. On its turn, the target doesn't move and takes no action or Bonus Action.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can affect one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

The Jinxed Leviathan.name: The Jinxed Leviathan
The Jinxed Leviathan.description:
The Jinxed Leviathan

Curse-Wrought Swamp Monster

Habitat: Coastal, Swamp

Once a normal alligator that dwelled in a cursed swamp, the Jinxed Leviathan was warped by the strange hexes and twisted spells of nefarious magicians who sought to defeat the deathly spirit known as Snake Eye Jack. Growing to colossal proportions and infusing with the essence of misfortune itself, the Monstrosity could not be controlled and devoured its makers. Now, it lurks in the still, black water of hexed bayous, always seeking its next meal, upon which it unleashes its jinxcraft before feasting.

Secret. An idol of the fabled deal maker Snake Eye Jack that has been blessed by one of Jack’s followers can turn the Jinxed Leviathan’s own cursed power against it.

The Jinxed Leviathan’s Lair

The Jinxed Leviathan’s lair is a cursed swamp steeped in confounding magic. If encountered in its lair, the Jinxed Leviathan has a challenge rating of 24 (62,000 XP).

The region containing the Jinxed Leviathan’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Hanging Hex. Within 1 mile of the lair, when a creature other than the Jinxed Leviathan rolls a 1 or a 20 on an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, the next ability check, attack roll, or saving throw the creature makes has disadvantage, and it can’t have advantage.

Murky Waters. Within 1 mile of the lair, swamp water is cloudy and shows fleeting faces in the murk. Creatures in the water have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

If the Jinxed Leviathan dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The leviathan makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and one [[/item Tail]] attack.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. The target is &Reference[Grappled apply=false] (escape DC 20), and until the grapple ends, the target is &Reference[Restrained apply=false].

Tail.name: Tail
Tail.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and if the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false] and is pushed up to 20 feet straight away from the leviathan.

Accursed Breath.name: Accursed Breath
Accursed Breath.description: The leviathan breathes magenta light in a 120-foot-long, 10-foot-wide line. Each creature in that area must make a DC 22 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 78 ([[/r 12d12]]) necrotic damage and is cursed. The cursed target has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws, and it can’t regain hit points. The target can end the curse early if it voluntarily fails a saving throw forced by one of its enemies. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

Swallow.name: Swallow
Swallow.description: One Large or smaller creature &Reference[Grappled apply=false] by the leviathan must make a DC 25 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it is swallowed and no longer &Reference[Grappled apply=false]. A swallowed creature is &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Restrained apply=false], it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the leviathan, and it takes 24 ([[/r 7d6]]) force damage at the start of each of the leviathan’s turns. The leviathan can have up to four creatures swallowed at a time. If the leviathan takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the leviathan must succeed on a DC 25 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which falls in a space within 10 feet of the leviathan and is knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false]. If the leviathan dies, any swallowed creature is no longer &Reference[Restrained apply=false] and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The leviathan can take 3 legendary actions (4 in Lair), choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The leviathan regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Swamp Surge.name: Swamp Surge
Swamp Surge.description: The leviathan causes a swell of muddy water and grasping roots to fill the area within 20 feet of it. Each creature within that area must make a DC 20 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 21 ([[/r 6d6]]) bludgeoning damage, and its speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

Tail Sweep.name: Tail Sweep
Tail Sweep.description: The leviathan moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and makes one [[/item Tail]] attack.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: The Jinxed Leviathan’s lair is a cursed swamp steeped in confounding magic. If encountered in its lair, the Jinxed Leviathan has a challenge rating of 24 (62,000 XP). The region containing the Jinxed Leviathan’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects: If the Jinxed Leviathan dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Hanging Hex.name: Hanging Hex
Hanging Hex.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, when a creature other than the Jinxed Leviathan rolls a 1 or a 20 on an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, the next ability check, attack roll, or saving throw the creature makes has disadvantage, and it can’t have advantage.

Murky Waters.name: Murky Waters
Murky Waters.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, swamp water is cloudy and shows fleeting faces in the murk. Creatures in the water have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

Jinxed Hide.name: Jinxed Hide
Jinxed Hide.description: When a creature within 60 feet of the leviathan hits it with an attack roll or targets it with a spell, the creature must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or become cursed until the end of its next turn. The cursed creature has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws and can’t regain hit points.

Amphibious.name: Amphibious
Amphibious.description: The leviathan can breathe air and water.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the leviathan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Returned Curse.name: Returned Curse
Returned Curse.description: If the leviathan curses a creature holding an idol of Snake Eye Jack blessed by one of his devoted followers, the creature is unaffected by the curse. The leviathan then takes 20 radiant damage and has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of its next turn.

Crimson Clergy.description:
Crimson Clergy

Vampiric Zealot

Habitat: Any

Treasure: Relics

Crimson clergy are Undead cultists, often created, led, and taught by a more powerful vampire. Crimson clergy view the consumption of blood—and in its use during their rituals and when casting spells—not only as necessary but sacred. Their hunger reaches beyond the limits of their fangs and claws, calling to the blood of their victims and drawing it out in scarlet ribbons.

Secret. Crimson clergy struggle to accept how monstrous they have become. They can’t stand the sight of themselves and see their true visage in their reflection.

Crimson Blessing.description: The clergy casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8dzaICjGy6mTUaUr] using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The clergy can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

Vampire Weaknesses.description:

Disguise Self.description:
You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear heavier or lighter. You must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs as you have. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC.

Disguised.name: Disguised
Disguised.description: To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv]] check against your spell save DC.

Bayou Beast.name: Bayou Beast
Bayou Beast.description:
Bayou Beast

Spirit Hex-Bound to the Swamp

Habitat: Swamp

Bayou beasts are elemental spirits bound into great mounds of swamp plant matter through jinxcraft magic. These hulks obey their creators unfailingly, often lingering long after their death and carrying out their final orders. The hexed seals, fashioned from carved trinkets and masks, that trap the spirit in its form impart their curse on the creature’s enemies.

Secret. The jinxcraft seals can be washed away with alcohol, hindering and even destroying the bayou beast.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The elemental makes two [[/item Hexed Slam]] attacks.

While cursed, the creature subtracts [[/r 1d4]] from its attack rolls and saving throws.

The target or a creature within 5 feet of it can take an action to make a DC 16 Strength (Athletics) check, ending the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition on the target on a success

The Horned King.name: The Horned King
The Horned King.description:
The Horned King

Sin Made Manifest

Habitat: Forest, Planar (Lower Planes)

Every sinful, selfish action in the world pours a fraction of itself into the Horned King, a being composed of every mortal who has surrendered to temptation. Fortunately, under normal circumstances, the Horned King exists as an ephemeral spirit with no physical presence. During times of upheaval, when a great many mortals give in to their selfish desires or when another power—such as a deity, demon lord, or archfey—interferes, the Horned King is made manifest, and with it comes the weight of sin flooding back into the world that created it.

The Horned King’s Lair

The Horned King’s lair is the forest clearing where a twisted tree focuses the malevolent will that gave rise to the king’s physical presence.

The region containing the Horned King’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Sweet Temptation. Within 1 mile of the lair, a creature that acts on a sinful impulse to the detriment of a friendly or indifferent creature increases its hit point maximum and current hit points by 10 until it finishes a long rest. Creatures are aware of this effect. This can’t occur again for that creature until it finishes a long rest.

Tenacious Curses. Within 1 mile of the lair, saving throws against curses have disadvantage.

If the Horned King dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The Horned King makes three [[/item Cursed Strike]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Terrorizing Breath]].

Cursed Strike.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]] (against a cursed target, scores a Critical Hit on a 19 or 20 on the d20), reach 10 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage (Horned King’s choice for the bludgeoning, piercing or slashing portion). If the target is a creature, it is cursed until the end of the Horned King's next turn. While cursed, it must subtract [[/r 1d4]] from D20 Tests.

Breath Of Corruption.name: Breath Of Corruption
Breath Of Corruption.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 19, each creature in a 60-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target gains 1 &reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level that ends at the end of the target’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Terrorizing Breath.name: Terrorizing Breath

Failure: The target has the &reference[Frightened apply=false] condition. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions

Failure: The target takes [[/damage average]] damage, the Horned King regains Hit Points equal to the damage taken, and one curse of the Horned King’s choice affecting the target ends.

Temptation.name: Temptation
Temptation.description: The Horned King speaks to a creature it can see within 120 feet and offers it either Heroic Inspiration or to restore 20 of its Hit Points. If the creature accepts, it gains that benefit but is cursed for 1 minute. While cursed, the Horned King has Resistance to all damage the target deals. The Horned King can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Trample.name: Trample
Trample.description: The Horned King moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one [[/item Cursed Strike]] attack.The Horned King can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: The Horned King’s lair is the forest clearing where a twisted tree focuses the malevolent will that gave rise to the king’s physical presence. The region containing the Horned King’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects: If the Horned King dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Sweet Temptation.name: Sweet Temptation

Creatures are aware of this effect. This can’t occur again for that creature until it finishes a long rest.

Tenacious Curses.name: Tenacious Curses

Enduring Restoration.name: Enduring Restoration
Enduring Restoration.description: If the Horned King dies, its body disappears in a cloud of ash. It becomes an intangible, Invisible spirit in its home forest, and it can’t reform a new physical body for [[/r 10d10]] years.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the Horned King fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The Horned King has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
For the duration, you can read the thoughts of certain creatures. When you cast the spell and as your action on each turn until the spell ends, you can focus your mind on any one creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. If the creature you choose has an Intelligence of 3 or lower or doesn't speak any language, the creature is unaffected.

You initially learn the surface thoughts of the creature—what is most on its mind in that moment. As an action, you can either shift your attention to another creature's thoughts or attempt to probe deeper into the same creature's mind. If you probe deeper, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, you gain insight into its reasoning (if any), its emotional state, and something that looms large in its mind (such as something it worries over, loves, or hates). If it succeeds, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and unless you shift your attention to another creature's thoughts, the creature can use its action on its turn to make an Intelligence check contested by your Intelligence check; if it succeeds, the spell ends.

Questions verbally directed at the target creature naturally shape the course of its thoughts, so this spell is particularly effective as part of an interrogation.

You can also use this spell to detect the presence of thinking creatures you can't see. When you cast the spell or as your action during the duration, you can search for thoughts within 30 feet of you. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 2 feet of rock, 2 inches of any metal other than lead, or a thin sheet of lead blocks you. You can't detect a creature with an Intelligence of 3 or lower or one that doesn't speak any language.

Once you detect the presence of a creature in this way, you can read its thoughts for the rest of the duration as described above, even if you can't see it, but it must still be within range.

OfCdNKvPp2QGh1j1.name: Detect Thoughts
OfCdNKvPp2QGh1j1.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don't read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target's mind right now. If the target doesn't know any languages and isn't telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target's mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target's reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target's mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

The Jailbird.name: The Jailbird
The Jailbird.description:
Wayward Haint

Lost Soul Bound to Regret

Habitat: Any

Treasure: None

Wayward haints are restless spirits stuck between the realms of the living and the dead. Be it a curse or an unresolved conflict from their previous life, a haint can’t rest until their unfinished business is resolved.

Haints only show hints of who they were in life, taking on a more symbolic form related to the hurt or loss they can’t let go of. They tend to repeat their monotonous actions—often imitating those performed in life or reenacting their sorrow—over and over for eternity. When provoked, they can display a volatile temper and lash out with a crushing wave of the grief and indecision that binds their spirit.

Secret. Wayward haints can be trapped in empty bottles if they’re tricked or forced to pass over one.

Bottle Trap.name: Bottle Trap
Bottle Trap.description: A haint that enters the space of an upright, empty bottle must succeed on a DC 16 Charisma saving throw or be drawn into the bottle, and a cork or stopper appears to close the bottle. The trapped haint can see and hear through the bottle out to 10 feet, and any creature in that range can hear the haint. The haint is released if the bottle breaks or another creature opens it.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The haint can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. It takes [[/damage average]] damage if it ends its turn inside a solid object.

Draining Regret.name: Draining Regret
Draining Regret.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target gains 1 &reference[exhaustion apply=false] level. This can’t raise the target’s Exhaustion level above 5, and all Exhaustion levels gained from this action end when the target finishes a Short or Long Rest, or if it receives a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.F0GsG0SJzsIOacwV]{Lesser Restoration} spell or similar magic

4hGJOuAps5FC729H.name: The Chained Reaper
4hGJOuAps5FC729H.description:
The Chained Reaper

Burdened Harbinger of Death

Habitat: Any

The Chained Reaper is all that remains of a once-noble orc caretaker of the departed called Yorgrim. Having been corrupted by the mists of death known as the Shroud, the Chained Reaper is a being of hatred and bitterness, striving to cremate all living things in its balefire before binding them in chains of anguish.

Secret. The Chained Reaper carries a memorial stone upon its back. If one can read aloud the names inscribed there, their purity will burn away the reaper’s fury.

The Chained Reaper’s Lair

The Chained Reaper’s lair is a mausoleum holding its own empty grave and those of its former companions.

The region containing the Chained Reaper’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Chained Vitality. A creature that isn’t a Construct or Undead that finishes a long rest within 1 mile of the lair must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have its hit point maximum reduced by 5 (to a minimum of 1 HP) until it next finishes a long rest.

Falling Shroud. Thin mist arises within 1 mile of the lair. Undead with the Incorporeal Movement trait in that area have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

If the Chained Reaper dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The reaper makes one [[/item Balefire Scythe]] attack and one [[/item Chain]] attack, and it uses either Chain Slam or Fling.

Balefire Scythe.name: Balefire Scythe
Balefire Scythe.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target begins burning with balefire. Until a creature within 5 feet of the fire takes an action to douse the flames, the target takes 2 ([[/r 1d4]]) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns.

Chain.name: Chain
Chain.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is &Reference[Grappled apply=false] (escape DC 15) from one of four chains.

Chain Slam.name: Chain Slam
Chain Slam.description: The reaper slams creatures in its chains into each other or the environment. Each creature &Reference[Grappled apply=false] by the reaper must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 9 ([[/r 1d8 + 5]]) bludgeoning damage and is &Reference[Stunned apply=false] until the start of the reaper’s next turn. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage only.

Etherealness.name: Etherealness
Etherealness.description: The reaper casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.PQuEgKyCdovOvhqN], requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability. The reaper is visible on the Material Plane while on the Border Ethereal and vice versa, but it can’t affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

Fling.name: Fling
Fling.description: The reaper throws a Large or smaller creature &Reference[Grappled apply=false] by it to a space it can see within 30 feet of itself that isn’t in the air. The thrown creature and each creature in the destination space must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 9 ([[/r 2d8]]) bludgeoning damage and is knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false]. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The reaper can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The reaper regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Drift.name: Drift
Drift.description: The reaper moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

Lantern Flare.name: Lantern Flare
Lantern Flare.description: The reaper’s lantern flares with balefire. Each creature of the reaper’s choice within 20 feet of it must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

OHVlJAW5yCCg3sht.name: Balefire Scythe
OHVlJAW5yCCg3sht.description: The reaper makes one [[/item Balefire Scythe]] attack.

Lair Actions.description: The Chained Reaper’s lair is a mausoleum holding its own empty grave and those of its former companions. The region containing the Chained Reaper’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects: If the Chained Reaper dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Chained Vitality.name: Chained Vitality
Chained Vitality.description: A creature that isn’t a Construct or Undead that finishes a long rest within 1 mile of the lair must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have its hit point maximum reduced by 5 (to a minimum of 1 HP) until it next finishes a long rest.

Falling Shroud.name: Falling Shroud
Falling Shroud.description: Thin mist arises within 1 mile of the lair. Undead with the Incorporeal Movement trait in that area have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

Ancestral Shame.name: Ancestral Shame
Ancestral Shame.description: If a creature that can speak Orc within 30 feet of the reaper takes an action to read aloud the names carved in the stone on the reaper’s back, the reaper takes 20 radiant damage.

Ethereal Sight.name: Ethereal Sight
Ethereal Sight.description: The reaper can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The reaper can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the reaper fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Wrapped Chains.name: Wrapped Chains
Wrapped Chains.description: The reaper is wrapped in ghostly chains. It adds its Charisma modifier to its AC instead of Dexterity.

LdrqF10ZINeFS8Mf.name: Etherealness
LdrqF10ZINeFS8Mf.description:
You step into the border regions of the Ethereal Plane, in the area where it overlaps with your current plane. You remain in the Border Ethereal for the Duration or until you use your action to dismiss the spell. During this time, you can move in any direction. If you move up or down, every foot of Movement costs an extra foot. You can see and hear the plane you originated from, but everything there looks gray, and you can't see anything more than 60 feet away.

While on the Ethereal Plane, you can only affect and be affected by other creatures on that plane. Creatures that aren't on the Ethereal Plane can't perceive you and can't interact with you, unless a special ability or magic has given them the ability to do so.

You ignore all Objects and Effects that aren't on the Ethereal Plane, allowing you to move through objects you perceive on the plane you originated from.

When the spell ends, you immediately return to the plane you originated from in the spot you currently occupy. If you occupy the same spot as a solid object or creature when this happens, you are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space that you can occupy and take force damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved.

This spell has no effect if you cast it while you are on the Ethereal Plane or a plane that doesn't border it, such as one of the Outer Planes.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you can target up to three willing creatures (including you) for each slot level above 7th. The creatures must be within 10 feet of you when you cast the spell.
