Endless Vermin.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, centipedes, weasels, (including giant varieties of both), and pigeons (use the Raven stat block) are common nuisances. They steal Tiny objects and foul food.

Loyal Dwelling.name: Loyal Dwelling
Loyal Dwelling.description: The lair itself, including any greater structure or complex it resides within, rejects intruders. Ability checks to pick locks or find secret doors have disadvantage.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the abomination fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The abomination has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiple Heads.name: Multiple Heads
Multiple Heads.description: The abomination has three heads: a centipede hag’s, a pigeon hag’s, and a weasel hag’s. Whenever the abomination takes 50 damage or more on a single turn, one of its heads dies (determined randomly). The abomination dies if all its heads are dead. At the end of each of its turns, if it has at least 1 hit point and any of its heads are dead, the abomination regains 20 hit points and one of its dead heads returns to life.

Ketgrinn.name: Ketgrinn
Ketgrinn.description:
Ketgrinn

Voice-Stealing Trickster

Habitat: Forest, Hill, Planar (Fey), Urban

Ketgrinn are catlike Fey spirits who delight in puzzles, riddles, and bargains. They have large, bright eyes and too-wide grins that gleam starkly even in shadows. Ketgrinn are tricksters and spies, often sent by those they serve to steal the voices of a rival’s minions to sow chaos and confusion.

Secret. Ketgrinn can’t resist a puzzle or riddle, and a difficult one can send a ketgrinn’s mind spiraling.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The ketgrinn makes two [[/item Claw]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Consume Voice]].

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and if the target is a creature, it has disadvantage on the next saving throw the ketgrinn forces it to make before the end of the ketgrinn’s next turn.

Consume Voice.name: Consume Voice
Consume Voice.description: The ketgrinn leers menacingly at one creature within 5 feet of it. The target must make a DC 14 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 18 ([[/r 4d8]]) psychic damage, and the ketgrinn steals the target’s voice. The target can’t speak or make any verbal sound while its voice is stolen. The target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If it fails three of these saving throws, the loss is permanent, and its voice only returns when the ketgrinn dies. On a successful initial save, the target takes half as much damage only.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description: The ketgrinn casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.1N8dDMMgZ1h1YJ3B] on itself, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

Teleport.name: Teleport
Teleport.description: The ketgrinn teleports up to 40 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The ketgrinn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Mimicry.name: Mimicry
Mimicry.description: The ketgrinn can mimic any voice it has heard, or a voice it has stolen (see Consume Voice below). A creature that hears the voice can tell it’s an imitation with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Insight) check. The DC increases to 19 for a voice the ketgrinn has stolen.

Riddle Bound.name: Riddle Bound
Riddle Bound.description: As an action, a creature that poses a riddle to the ketgrinn and succeeds on a DC 16 Charisma (Deception) check incapacitates the ketgrinn until the start of the creature’s next turn. Each riddle posed increases the DC for future riddles by 1 for 24 hours.

Gf92xcJrGEEH6yrK.description:
Witchwoven

Helper Made of Twine and Twigs (Ruby wrapped in a wicker cage)

Habitat: Any

Witchwoven are little dolls or effigies made of sticks, twine, and other simple materials, then imbued with life. Some happen naturally in places suffused with old nature magic, but most are created to serve as familiars by spellcasters knowledgeable in the Old Ways.

Cursed Scratch.name: Cursed Scratch
Cursed Scratch.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and if the target is a creature, it has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of the witchwoven’s next turn.

Protective Bond.name: Protective Bond
Protective Bond.description: When a creature the witchwoven can see within 60 feet of it takes damage, the creature gains resistance to the triggering damage, and the witchwoven takes 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) force damage.

GvrWCFMLLKQvzgLt.name: Ravencraft
GvrWCFMLLKQvzgLt.description:
Ravencraft

Undead Avian Amalgamation (Silver wire)

Habitat: Any

Treasure: None

Ravencrafts are a grotesque fusion of feathers, sinew, and bone. Their tiny form is a contorted and twisted nightmare carelessly sewn together into the mockery of a bird. The mere presence of a ravencraft is an affront to natural death and can keep further death at bay, or they can chill the hearts of their foes with cries of torment from beyond the grave.

Beak.name: Beak
Beak.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Harbinger Of Doom.name: Harbinger Of Doom
Harbinger Of Doom.description:
The ravencraft lets out a wail of anguish commingling with the croaking of ravens.

Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 11, one creature within 60 feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Death Veil.name: Death Veil
Death Veil.description:
Trigger: A creature within 30 feet of the ravencraft makes a Death Saving Throw.

Response: The creature has Advantage on the save.

Undead Fortitude.name: Undead Fortitude
Undead Fortitude.description: If damage reduces the ravencraft to 0 Hit Points, it makes a Constitution saving throw (DC 5 plus the damage taken) unless the damage is Radiant or from a Critical Hit. On a successful save, the ravencraft drops to 1 Hit Point instead.

Swarm.name: Swarm

Vermin Familiar.name: Vermin Familiar
Vermin Familiar.description:
Vermin Familiar

Infesting Hag Companion

Habitat: Planar (Fey), Urban

Treasure: Any

Capricious Fey spirits incarnated into bodies reminiscent of normal pests, vermin familiars serve spellcasters and especially vermin hags. While they are most often drawn to serve wicked masters, they also delight in playing the part of dutiful servants to corrupt spellcasters who aren’t evil.

Secret. Vermin familiars are gripped by deep-seated fears shared by the vermin forms they inhabit, and as such, are terrified of dogs and other canines.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The familiar makes two [[/item Rend]] attacks.

Rend.name: Rend
Rend.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Incarnated Assault.name: Incarnated Assault
Incarnated Assault.description:
The familiar uses the option that matches its incarnation.

  • Confounding Scratch (Weasel Only). Charisma Saving Throw: DC 12, one creature the familiar can see within 5 feet.

    Failure: 21 ([[/r 6d6]]) Necrotic damage, and the target is affected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.9hQXdMSmerkTsHDe]{Confusion} spell until the start of the familiar’s next turn.

    Success: Half damage only.

  • Infectious Sting (Centipede Only). Constitution Saving Throw: DC 12, one creature the familiar can see within 5 feet.

    Failure: 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) Poison damage, and the target has the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of the familiar’s next turn. While Poisoned in this way, the target has the&reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition.

    Success: Half damage only.

  • Terrifying Flutter (Pigeon Only). Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 12, one creature the familiar can see within 5 feet.

    Failure: 21 ([[/r 6d6]]) Psychic damage, and the target has the &reference[frightened apply=false] condition until the end of the familiar’s next turn. The Frightened target uses its movement on its turn to get as far away as possible from the familiar, moving by the safest route.

    Success: Half damage only.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description: The familiar casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility} on itself, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

Disparate Incarnation.name: Disparate Incarnation
Disparate Incarnation.description: The familiar incarnates in a body similar to a pest: Centipede, Pigeon, or Weasel, which determines other traits and actions the familiar has.

Fear Of Canines.name: Fear Of Canines
Fear Of Canines.description: If the familiar can see a dog, wolf, or other canine at the start of its turn, it has the &reference[frightened apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn. While Frightened in this way, it has Disadvantage on saving throws.

Flyby (Pigeon Only).name: Flyby (Pigeon Only)
Flyby (Pigeon Only).description: The familiar doesn’t provoke an Opportunity Attack when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

Spider Climb (Centipede Only).name: Spider Climb (Centipede Only)
Spider Climb (Centipede Only).description: The familiar can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Vermin Telepathy.name: Vermin Telepathy
Vermin Telepathy.description: The familiar can magically control Beasts and swarms that match its incarnation (centipedes, pigeons, weasels, giant versions of each, as well as Boogleswarms*, Skitterswarms*, and Squabswarms*) within 120 feet of itself, using a special telepathy.

Festerhulk.name: Festerhulk
Festerhulk.description:
Festerhulk

Fungal Undead Giant

Habitat: Forest, Swamp, Underground

Treasure: None

Festerhulks are dead giants whose corpses are infested with fungus engorged by the magic of decay. This fungus has consumed and replaced much of the giant’s flesh and now animates the corpse. The heads of these giants are often completely overtaken by repulsive mushrooms and other fungal growths. The spores given off by their infestation can spread to victims killed by festerhulks, giving rise to further Undead.

Secret. Festerhulks shrink from sunlight, which harms the fungus that animates them.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The festerhulk makes two [[/item Fetid Slam]] attacks and uses Slime Mold if available.

Fetid Slam.name: Fetid Slam
Fetid Slam.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 10 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Slime Mold.name: Slime Mold
Slime Mold.description: The festerhulk disgorges a mass of ravenous slime mold into an unoccupied space within 20 feet. This mass uses the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.NwQpeeaMxAC3fRft]{Black Pudding} stat block except it is a Plant, and its size is Medium. The mass acts on the festerhulk’s Initiative. It, and any masses it Split into, dries up and dies in 1 hour.

Fungal Step.name: Fungal Step
Fungal Step.description: The festerhulk ignores Difficult Terrain caused by plants or fungi.

Spore Cloud.name: Spore Cloud
Spore Cloud.description: At the end of each of the festerhulk’s turns, each creature in a 5-foot Emanation originating from the festerhulk takes [[/damage average]] damage and has the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn. A Giant or Humanoid killed by this damage rises as a new creature 24 hours later: Festerhulk (if a Giant), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.NAISFPoNNgUCsEyW]{Zombie} (if a Humanoid).

Sunlight Hypersensitivity.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
Sunlight Hypersensitivity.description: The festerhulk takes 10 Radiant damage if it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

IIDfGarbTmbHcfAs.name: Hemonculus
IIDfGarbTmbHcfAs.description:
Hemonculus

Sanguine Servitor (Fresh blood and gem dust)

Habitat: Planar (Lower Planes)

Hemonculus are servitors created by a blood magic ritual that binds a fiendish spirit into a blood-formed body. For the cost of a small sacrifice in blood (the creator’s own or otherwise), the creatures serve as spies and assist in procuring further blood for magical use.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the hemonculus attaches to the target. While attached, the hemonculus automatically hits the target with its Claw attacks. The hemonculus can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. The target or a creature within 5 feet of it can detach the hemonculus as an action.

Exsanguinate.name: Exsanguinate
Exsanguinate.description: The hemonculus magically draws blood from nearby creatures. Each creature of the hemonculus’ choice within 15 feet of the hemonculus must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) necrotic damage, and it can’t regain hit points until the start of the hemonculus’s next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only. If the hemonculus is attached to a creature, the hemonculus regains hit points equal to the necrotic damage taken by that target.

Blood Sense.name: Blood Sense
Blood Sense.description: The hemonculus knows the location of any creature within 60 feet of it that has half its hit points or fewer, unless the creature is a Construct or Undead.

Flyby.name: Flyby
Flyby.description: The hemonculus doesn’t provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The hemonculus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Boogleswarm.name: Boogleswarm
Boogleswarm.description:
Boogleswarm

Tricksy Fey Weasels

Habitat: Forest, Planar (Fey), Urban

Boogleswarms are mischievous Fey spirits that take the form of weasels gathered into a slinking mob. These spirits covet and collect teeth of all kinds, but they favor the teeth of Humanoids most of all. Tales of tooth faeries might have their origin in boogleswarms, as they are known to enter into agreements to trade for teeth—such as those lost by children and tucked under a pillow—for rewards, favors, or safety.

Secret. Boogleswarms go wild for sugar, whether pure or in heavily-sweetened foods like candy, and are compelled to take and consume any they find.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The swarm makes two [[/item Bite]] attacks that must have different targets.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, or 5 ([[/r 2d4]]) piercing damage if the swarm has half its hit points or fewer. If the target is a creature that has teeth, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or lose one of its teeth. The swarm immediately implants the tooth into one of its mouths. A creature that has already lost a tooth to this attack automatically succeeds on the saving throw.

Mimicry.name: Mimicry
Mimicry.description: The swarm can speak in the voice of a creature whose tooth it has implanted (see the Bite action). Listeners must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom (Insight) check to discern the mimicry.

Swarm.name: Swarm
Swarm.description: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny weasel. The swarm can’t regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

Sweet Tooth.name: Sweet Tooth
Sweet Tooth.description: If the swarm can see or smell sugar at the start of its turn, it must use all its movement to move closer to the sugar. If it reaches the sugar, the swarm becomes &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] until the start of its next turn as it consumes the sugar, and this trait doesn’t function again until the swarm finishes a short or long rest.

The Tall Man.name: The Tall Man
The Tall Man.description:
The Tall Man

Murderous Archfey of the Dark Wood

Habitat: Forest, Planar (Fey)

The Tall Man is a mysterious entity that haunts an accursed forest. Once, he was an archfey who ruled a now-forgotten court, renowned for its dances that lasted for nights on end. Doomed now to walk his rotting forest, the Tall Man finds pleasure where he can by tempting travelers and forest denizens alike to play hide and seek with him—with deadly results.

Secret. Dancing forgotten steps once performed in the fey court that the Tall Man formerly ruled shreds his being.

The Tall Man’s Lair

The Tall Man’s lair is the dark forest he now haunts, where his forgotten Fey court once thrived. If encountered in his lair, the Tall Man has a challenge rating of 21 (33,000 XP).

The region containing the Tall Man’s lair is changed by his presence, creating the following effects:

Deepening Shadows. Within 1 mile of the lair, shadows stretch far beyond what they should. Creatures can find a sufficiently shadowy spot to hide in, even without cover, 50 percent of the time.

Too Quiet. Sounds are muffled within 1 mile of the lair, halving the distance at which sounds can be heard.

If the Tall Man dies or moves his lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The Tall Man makes two [[/item Claw]] attacks and uses [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast Vicious Mockery ([[/r 4d6]] psychic damage).

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is &Reference[Grappled apply=false] (escape DC 14) from one of two claws and &Reference[Restrained apply=false] until the grapple ends.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The Tall Man can take 3 legendary actions (4 in Lair), choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The Tall Man regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

Teleport.name: Teleport
Teleport.description: The Tall Man teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. When he teleports, he can force a creature he is grappling to succeed on a DC 18 Charisma saving throw or teleport with him, appearing in the closest unoccupied space to the Tall Man’s destination.

Strike.name: Strike
Strike.description: The Tall Man makes one [[/item Claw]] attack.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: The Tall Man’s lair is the dark forest he now haunts, where his forgotten Fey court once thrived. If encountered in his lair, the Tall Man has a challenge rating of 21 (33,000 XP). The region containing the Tall Man’s lair is changed by his presence, creating the following effects: If the Tall Man dies or moves his lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Deepening Shadows.name: Deepening Shadows
Deepening Shadows.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, shadows stretch far beyond what they should. Creatures can find a sufficiently shadowy spot to hide in, even without cover, 50 percent of the time.

Too Quiet.name: Too Quiet
Too Quiet.description: Sounds are muffled within 1 mile of the lair, halving the distance at which sounds can be heard.

Elusive Disguise.name: Elusive Disguise
Elusive Disguise.description: The Tall Man magically transforms into a Small or Medium Humanoid, or back to his true form. His statistics, other than his size, are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying changes to accommodate his new form. He can take on any features he chooses, but he is always unnaturally tall for whatever guise he takes. He returns to his true form if he dies.

Evasive Blink.name: Evasive Blink
Evasive Blink.description: When the Tall Man takes damage, he gains resistance to the triggering damage and teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the Tall Man fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The Tall Man has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Memory’s Dance.name: Memory’s Dance
Memory’s Dance.description: As a bonus action, a creature can perform some steps from a dance of the Tall Man’s court and make a DC 20 Charisma (Performance) check. On a success, the Tall Man takes 20 force damage and has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the start of the creature’s next turn.

RcNFXsC5dOf3CAKy.name: Spellcasting
RcNFXsC5dOf3CAKy.description:
Spellcasting. The Tall Man casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 19):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.1N8dDMMgZ1h1YJ3B]{Invisibility}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.oIzA2MEHwxhtQneU]{Minor Illusion}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.cdrYKaFi98YWaBMw]{Vicious Mockery} (4d6 psychic damage)

2/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.S7VbUetIfVT7B6Eq]{Darkness}

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description: The target becomes Invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is invisible as long as it is on the target's person. The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. The illusion also ends if you dismiss it as an action or cast this spell again.

If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it.

If a creature uses its action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Vicious Mockery (4d6 psychic damage).name: Vicious Mockery (4d6 psychic damage)
Vicious Mockery (4d6 psychic damage).description:
You unleash a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at a creature you can see within range. If the target can hear you (though it need not understand you), it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 1d4 psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

This spell's damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th level (2d4), 11th level (3d4), and 17th level (4d4).

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 15-foot-radius sphere for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

materials.value: Bat fur and a drop of pitch or piece of coal

Lurker in the Dark.name: Lurker in the Dark
Lurker in the Dark.description:
Lurker in the Dark

Thing That Goes Bump in the Night

Habitat: Planar (Shadow), Urban

Treasure: Any

Lurkers in the dark are wicked Fey creatures who prey upon the fearful, vulnerable, and alone. They resemble nightmarishly distorted people with gray skin, lank hair, and three-fingered, clawed hands. Their limbs move in impossible ways, allowing them to slip through and hide within spaces that seem far too small. They delight in stoking their victim’s fears by whispering from spaces a person couldn’t fit. When the terror crests, the lurkers strike, drag their victims into the dark, and vanish with them.

Secret. Frightened children know that lurkers in the dark can be held at bay by clutching a beloved stuffed animal.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The lurker makes two [[/item Claw]] attacks.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 10 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &reference[grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 14) from one of two claws. Until the grapple ends, the target has the &reference[restrained apply=false] condition.

Dark Teleport.name: Dark Teleport
Dark Teleport.description: While the lurker isn’t in Bright Light, it teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. If the destination space isn’t in Bright Light, the lurker doesn’t need to see it. A creature the lurker is grappling must succeed on a DC 13 Charisma saving throw or teleport with the lurker to an unoccupied space closest to the lurker’s destination.

Nightmarish Contortion.name: Nightmarish Contortion
Nightmarish Contortion.description: The lurker can fit into a space as small as a 1-foot Cube and can pass through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The lurker can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Ward Of Innocence.name: Ward Of Innocence
Ward Of Innocence.description: The lurker can’t attack or willingly move to a space within 10 feet of a creature holding a stuffed animal once owned by a child.

IY9xoFINnJsrOXll.name: Corvodaemon
IY9xoFINnJsrOXll.description:
Corvodaemon

Demon of Hunger and Secrets

Habitat: Grassland, Planar (Abyss)

Resembling a monstrous crow, the corvodaemon’s sleek and twisted form soars on elongated wings tipped with razor-sharp, finger-like claws, its six amber eyes constantly seeking for prey.

Insatiable hunger for both flesh and souls—along with their accumulated secrets—gnaws at these Fiends. Their mimicry lets them take on the voice of those known and trusted by their would-be meals, luring the hapless mortals to their doom.

Secret. Savvy demon hunters bar corvodaemons with warding lines of ash prepared from feathers.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The corvodaemon can use Feeding Frenzy if available. It then makes one [[/item Beak]] attack and one [[/item Claws]] attack.

Beak.name: Beak
Beak.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Claws.name: Claws
Claws.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Feeding Frenzy.name: Feeding Frenzy
Feeding Frenzy.description: The corvodaemon enters a voracious feeding frenzy, driven by its insatiable hunger for souls. Until the start of its next turn, the corvodaemon’s speed doubles, and when it damages a creature, it gains temporary hit points equal to half the damage taken.

Ashen Forbiddance.name: Ashen Forbiddance
Ashen Forbiddance.description: The corvodaemon can’t cross a line of ashes created by burning feathers sprinkled with Holy Water.

Demonic Restoration.name: Demonic Restoration
Demonic Restoration.description: If the corvodaemon dies outside the Abyss, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its hit points somewhere in the Abyss.

Devour Anima.name: Devour Anima
Devour Anima.description: A creature the corvodaemon reduced to 0 hit points is cursed until it regains any hit points. When the cursed creature fails a death saving throw at the start of its turn, it dies regardless of how many failures it has.

Mimicry.name: Mimicry
Mimicry.description: The corvodaemon can mimic the voice of any creature it has heard, or of a creature known to one of the creatures within range of its telepathy. A hearer can discern the voices are imitations with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Insight) check.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mafdXNIx6EIRujnK]] attacks.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=u64Kjp19EAOJoLeo]] [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=u64Kjp19EAOJoLeo]], it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=u64Kjp19EAOJoLeo]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

affects.special: that isn’t an Undead or elf

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

JFFdwlA7Yi8AEuNL.name: The Harvest Terror
JFFdwlA7Yi8AEuNL.description:
The Harvest Terror

Demon of Secrets and Despair

Habitat: Grassland, Planar (Abyss)

Once a jovial soul imbued into the body of a scarecrow called Ol’ Jericho Sticks, the Harvest Terror is now a nightmarish abomination. It is a mockery of demonic flesh molded in the shape of a crow-like scarecrow. Its twisted body is made of molding wicker with four tattered, black-feathered wings sprouting from its back. An oversized corvid head with amber eyes sits upon its broad shoulders, its dark beak a jagged mess, and it wields a chipped, wicked scythe covered in old blood. Forever hungry, the Harvest Terror feeds on secrets and those that keep them.

Secret. The soul of Ol’ Jericho Sticks still exists in the dark recesses of the Harvest Terror’s mind. Singing or playing Jericho’s favorite song tips the balance of control over Jericho’s stolen body.

The Harvest Terror’s Lair

The Harvest Terror’s lair is the extraplanar corn maze known as the Fields of the Crow.

The region containing the Harvest Terror’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Amber Eyes. Within 1 mile of the lair, amber-eyed crows watch everything. Enemies of the Harvest Terror have disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks in the region.

Spilled Secrets. Within 1 mile of the lair, creatures other than the Harvest Terror have disadvantage on Charisma (Deception) checks made to keep secrets.

If the Harvest Terror dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The terror makes one [[/item Claw]] attack and one [[/item Scythe]] attack.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Scythe.name: Scythe
Scythe.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 10 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Dirge Of Secrets.name: Dirge Of Secrets
Dirge Of Secrets.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature within a 30-foot Emanation originating from the terror.

Failure: The creature takes [[/damage average]] damage and has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls. At the end of each of its turns, it repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Success: Half damage only.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The terror can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The terror regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Averting Winds.name: Averting Winds
Averting Winds.description: The terror casts the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplWindWall00]{Wind Wall} spell (which can’t appear in a creature’s space), requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

Crow’s Swoop.name: Crow’s Swoop
Crow’s Swoop.description: The terror moves up to half its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

Devour Secrets.name: Devour Secrets
Devour Secrets.description:
The terror’s beak gapes and devours secrets.

Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature in a 20-foot Emanation originating from the terror (with Disadvantage if the target has given up one of its secrets to the terror).

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target’s Speed is 0 until the end of its next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Failure or Success: The terror can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: The Harvest Terror’s lair is the extraplanar corn maze known as the Fields of the Crow. The region containing the Harvest Terror’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects: If the Harvest Terror dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Amber Eyes.name: Amber Eyes
Amber Eyes.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, amber-eyed crows watch everything. Enemies of the Harvest Terror have disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks in the region.

Spilled Secrets.name: Spilled Secrets
Spilled Secrets.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, creatures other than the Harvest Terror have disadvantage on Charisma (Deception) checks made to keep secrets.

Demonic Mimicry.name: Demonic Mimicry
Demonic Mimicry.description: The terror can mimic voices and sounds it has heard. A listener can discern the mimicry for what it is with a successful DC 18 Wisdom (Insight) check.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the terror fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The terror has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Unraveling Song.name: Unraveling Song
Unraveling Song.description: As an Influence action, a creature can play or sing Jericho Sticks’ favorite song, “Coal-Eyed Birds,” to give the terror the &reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the end of the creature’s next turn. The condition ends early if the creature damages the terror or forces it to make a saving throw.

Wind Wall.name: Wind Wall
Wind Wall.description:
A wall of strong wind rises from the ground at a point you choose within range. You can make the wall up to 50 feet long, 15 feet high, and 1 foot thick. You can shape the wall in any way you choose so long as it makes one continuous path along the ground. The wall lasts for the Duration.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Strength saving throw. A creature takes 3d8 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The strong wind keeps fog, smoke, and other gases at bay. Small or smaller flying creatures or objects can't pass through the wall. Loose, lightweight materials brought into the wall fly upward. Arrows, bolts, and other ordinary projectiles launched at targets behind the wall are deflected upward and automatically miss. (Boulders hurled by Giants or siege engines, and similar projectiles, are unaffected.) Creatures in gaseous form can't pass through it.

materials.value: A tiny fan and a feather of exotic origin

8hjk52LQWGJYI53r.name: Wind Wall
8hjk52LQWGJYI53r.description:
A wall of strong wind rises from the ground at a point you choose within range. You can make the wall up to 50 feet long, 15 feet high, and 1 foot thick. You can shape the wall in any way you choose so long as it makes one continuous path along the ground. The wall lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature in its area makes a Strength saving throw, taking 4d8 Bludgeoning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

The strong wind keeps fog, smoke, and other gases at bay. Small or smaller flying creatures or objects can't pass through the wall. Loose, lightweight materials brought into the wall fly upward. Arrows, bolts, and other ordinary projectiles launched at targets behind the wall are deflected upward and miss automatically. Boulders hurled by Giants or siege engines, and similar projectiles, are unaffected. Creatures in gaseous form can't pass through it.

Ankheg.name: Ankheg
Ankheg.description: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+5 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) acid damage.

If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the ankheg can bite only the grappled creature and has advantage on attack rolls to do so.

Acid Spray.name: Acid Spray
Acid Spray.description:
The ankheg spits acid in a line that is 30 ft. long and 5 ft. wide, provided that it has no creature grappled.

Each creature in that line must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .jdOlqVzYs89JuqTB]] and [[/item .qhM3PIWgXdyRCeul]] in any combination.

Weasel Hag.name: Weasel Hag
Weasel Hag.description:
Weasel Hag

Hag of Soul Twisting and Terror

Habitat: Forest, Planar (Fey), Urban

Treasure: Any

Covetous and bedecked in stolen and gifted teeth, weasel hags are Fey creatures that sow nightmares and temptation to wickedness. They often surround themselves with weasels and boogleswarms, using them as spies, thieves to steal trinkets (especially lost teeth), and to spread their malign influence.

Secret. Weasel hags’ love of teeth goes beyond a mere quirk. They can’t refuse a tooth willingly given by its owner and can’t harm the owner for a time.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
Spellcasting. The hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBlindnessD]{Blindness/Deafness}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplRayofEnfee]{Ray of Enfeeblement}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplConfusion0]{Confusion}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDream00000]{Dream}

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The hag makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and uses [[/item Spellcasting]] (at will spells only).

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Waking Terrors.name: Waking Terrors
Waking Terrors.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 13, one creature the hag can see within 30 feet. If the hag has one of the target’s teeth, the target has Disadavantage on the save.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[frightened apply=false] condition. While Frightened in this way, the target perceives its allies as enemies born from its nightmares, but it isn’t compelled to act against or harm them. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Success: Half damage only.

Shape-shift.name: Shape-shift
Shape-shift.description: The hag shape-shifts to resemble a Tiny weasel (Speed 30 ft., Climb 30 ft.) or a Small or Medium Humanoid, or back into her true form. Her game statistics, other than her Speed as a weasel and her size, are the same in each form. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Biting Gift.name: Biting Gift
Biting Gift.description: If a creature willingly offers one of its teeth to the hag, the hag must accept it and has the &reference[charmed apply=false]condition for 24 hours, or until the creature or its allies deal damage to the hag or force it to make a saving throw.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The hag has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Coven Magic.name: Coven Magic
Coven Magic.description: While within 30 feet of at least two hag allies, the hag can cast one of the following spells, requiring no Material components, using the spell’s normal casting time, and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.4v2H3hHb3Ph9XLNd]{Augury}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.JGT5bNqu9REL7Fuz]{Find Familiar}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3OZnNhunvRtPOQmH]{Identify}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.SleYkHovQ8NagmeV]{Locate Object}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2024.tcm2024-player-options.Item.cp5KkAHN0XLDh5gc]{Lucky Charm}* (lasts until the hag casts it again, or chooses to end it with no action required), or Unseen Servant. The hag must finish a Long Rest before using this trait to cast that spell again.

Blindness/Deafness.name: Blindness/Deafness
Blindness/Deafness.description:
One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or it has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] or &Reference[Deafened apply=false] condition (your choice) for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Blindness.name: Blindness
Blindness.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Deafness.name: Deafness
Deafness.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Ray of Enfeeblement.name: Ray of Enfeeblement
Ray of Enfeeblement.description:
A beam of enervating energy shoots from you toward a creature within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes until the start of your next turn.

On a failed save, the target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests for the duration. During that time, it also subtracts 1d8 from all its damage rolls. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

Brief Enfeeblement.name: Brief Enfeeblement
Brief Enfeeblement.description: The target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes until the start of your next turn.

Enervated.name: Enervated
Enervated.description: The target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests for the duration. During that time, it also subtracts 1d8 from all its damage rolls. The target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

Confusion.name: Confusion
Confusion.description:
Each creature in a 10-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point you choose within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or that target can't take Bonus Actions or Reactions and must roll 1d10 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn, consulting the table below.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.phbsplConfusionB rollable cite=false classes="caption-top"]{Behavior for the Turn}

At the end of each of its turns, an affected target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Sphere's radius increases by 5 feet for each spell slot level above 4.

Confused.name: Confused
Confused.description:
The target can’t take Bonus Actions or Reactions and must roll 1d10 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn, consulting the table below.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.phbsplConfusionB rollable cite=false classes="caption-top"]{Behavior for the Turn}

At the end of each of its turns, an affected target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Dream.name: Dream
Dream.description:
You target a creature you know on the same plane of existence. You or a willing creature you touch enters a trance state to act as a dream messenger. While in the trance, the messenger is &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] and has a Speed of 0.

If the target is asleep, the messenger appears in the target's dreams and can converse with the target as long as it remains asleep, through the spell's duration. The messenger can also shape the dream's environment, creating landscapes, objects, and other images. The messenger can emerge from the trance at any time, ending the spell. The target recalls the dream perfectly upon waking.

If the target is awake when you cast the spell, the messenger knows it and can either end the trance (and the spell) or wait for the target to sleep, at which point the messenger enters its dreams.

You can make the messenger terrifying to the target. If you do so, the messenger can deliver a message of no more than ten words, and then the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains no benefit from its rest, and it takes 3d6 Psychic damage when it wakes up.

Trance State.name: Trance State
Trance State.description: While in the trance, the messenger is Incapacitated and has a Speed of 0.

Pumpkin Head.name: Pumpkin Head
Pumpkin Head.description:
Pumpkin Head

Fiendish Effigy of the Fields

Habitat: Any

Pumpkin heads are scarecrows of straw, sticks, and clothing topped with a carved pumpkin for a head and animated by a fiendish spirit. They are crafted by demons to resemble their Humanoid victims and returned to wherever the unfortunate souls had been snatched from.

These living effigies speak with the voice of whomever they replaced, often repeating phrases and behaviors that the missing person said or did in life while stalking and killing new prey.

Secret. Pumpkin heads hold a shred of memory from the people they replaced. The sight of a keepsake or memento from a pumpkin head’s victim confuses the creature.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The pumpkin head makes one [[/item Claw]] attack and one [[/item Pitchfork]] attack, and it can use Personality Consumption if available.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Pitchfork.name: Pitchfork
Pitchfork.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the pumpkin head can push or pull it 5 feet.

Personality Consumption.name: Personality Consumption
Personality Consumption.description: The pumpkin head consumes the memories of one creature the pumpkin head can see within 30 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Intelligence saving throw or it becomes &Reference[Stunned apply=false] until the end of its next turn, and its Intelligence score decreases by [[/r 1d4]]. The target dies if this reduces that score to 0. A Humanoid slain in this way is replaced by a pumpkin head 1d8 hours later unless its body is burned. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest.

Mimicry.name: Mimicry
Mimicry.description: The pumpkin head can mimic the voice of the person it replaced or someone it used Personality Consumption on. A creature that hears the voice can tell it’s an imitation only with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Insight) check.

Sorrowful Memento.name: Sorrowful Memento
Sorrowful Memento.description: If the pumpkin head can see a creature holding a possession of the person the pumpkin head replaced, it has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws.

Jl4mI8O0O6D9pLuV.name: The Barrow King
Jl4mI8O0O6D9pLuV.description:
The Barrow King

Undying Monarch of the Damned

Habitat: Any

The Barrow King is known only by the armies of Undead he commands, which all slumber in tombs and burial mounds. Wights and their zombie conscripts arise when trespassers violate the resting place of the king’s army, and tales speak of a tide of death that will sweep across the world if the king himself should awaken. Records of the king’s living exploits and identity are near nonexistent, but rumors abound, and the storm of stories and myths may conceal grains of truth.

Secret. The Barrow King’s only true weakness is his name, written in the runic form of his lost native language. A weapon inscribed with his runic name becomes his bane.

Barrow King’s Lair

The Barrow King’s lair is his burial mound and the surrounding region of resting places for his vast army. If encountered in his lair, the Barrow King has a challenge rating of 23 (50,000 XP).

The region containing the Barrow King’s lair is changed by his presence, creating the following effects:

Empire of Desecration. A Hallow spell cast within 1 mile of the lair fails, but any resources used to cast it aren’t wasted.

Necrotic Shroud. When a living creature within 1 mile of the lair regains hit points as part of finishing a long rest, it can only regain up to half its hit point maximum.

If the Barrow King dies or moves his lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The king makes three [[/item Soul Blade]] attacks. He can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Life Drain]].

Soul Blade.name: Soul Blade
Soul Blade.description:
Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. or range 40/80 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Hit or Miss: The blade magically returns to the king’s hand immediately after a ranged attack.

Life Drain.name: Life Drain
Life Drain.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC 22, one creature within 5 feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target’s Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

A Humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.Kmk996onHkRCnDRG]{Wight} under the king’s control, unless the Humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed.

Blade Storm.name: Blade Storm
Blade Storm.description:
The king’s blade flies in a deadly arc around him.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 22, each creature of the king’s choice in a 20-foot Emanation originating from him.

Failure: A creature takes [[/damage average]] damage and has the &reference[prone apply=false] condition.

Success: Half damage only.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: Legendary Action Uses: 3 (4 in Lair). Immediately after another creature’s turn, the king can expend a use to take one of the following actions. The king regains all expended uses at the start of each of his turns.

Death Grasp.name: Death Grasp
Death Grasp.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC 22, one creature the king can see within 100 feet.

Failure: A ghostly, skeletal arm pulls the target up to 40 feet closer to the king, and the target’s Speed is halved until the end of its next turn.

Grim Charge.name: Grim Charge
Grim Charge.description: The king moves up to his Speed (or commands his mount to move up to its Speed) and makes one [[/item Soul Blade]] attack.

Lord’s Call.name: Lord’s Call
Lord’s Call.description: The king magically summons two @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.Kmk996onHkRCnDRG]{Wights} into unoccupied spaces he can see within 30 feet of himself. The wights obey the king and take their turn immediately after him on the same Initiative count. A wight vanishes after 1 hour, when it or the king dies, or when the king uses this action again. A creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of a wight must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or have the &reference[frightened apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn. The king can’t use this action again until the start of his next turn.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description:
The Barrow King’s lair is his burial mound and the surrounding region of resting places for his vast army.

The region containing the Barrow King’s lair is changed by his presence, creating the following effects:

If the Barrow King dies or moves his lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Empire of Desecration.name: Empire of Desecration
Empire of Desecration.description: A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.SLxA9QhrggTz0taU]{Hallow} spell cast within 1 mile of the lair fails, but any resources used to cast it aren’t wasted.

Necrotic Shroud.name: Necrotic Shroud
Necrotic Shroud.description: When a living creature within 1 mile of the lair regains Hit Points as part of finishing a Long Rest, it can only regain up to half its Hit Point maximum.

Undying Mount.name: Undying Mount
Undying Mount.description: The king casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPhantomSte]{Phantom Steed}, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability. The conjured steed takes no damage from areas of effect. The spell ends early if the king casts it again.

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description:
Trigger: The king is hit by an attack roll while holding a weapon or shield.

Response: The king adds 7 to his AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

Plate Armor.name: Plate Armor
Plate Armor.description: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: (4/Day, or 5/Day in Lair). If the king fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The king has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Marshall Undead.name: Marshall Undead
Marshall Undead.description: Undead creatures of the king's choice (excluding himself) in a 60-foot Emanation originating from him have Advantage on attack rolls and saving throws. He can't use this trait if he has the &reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition.

Name Of Rest.name: Name Of Rest
Name Of Rest.description: The king has AC 10 against attack rolls made with a weapon inscribed with the runic form of his original name, and the king has disadvantage on attack rolls made against a creature holding such a weapon.

Phantom Steed.name: Phantom Steed
Phantom Steed.description:
A Large quasi-real, horselike creature appears on the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice within range. You decide the creature's appearance, but it is equipped with a saddle, bit, and bridle. Any of the equipment created by the spell vanishes in a puff of smoke if it is carried more than 10 feet away from the steed.

For the duration, you or a creature you choose can ride the steed. The creature uses the statistics for a riding horse, except it has a speed of 100 feet and can travel 10 miles in an hour, or 13 miles at a fast pace. When the spell ends, the steed gradually fades, giving the rider 1 minute to dismount. The spell ends if you use an action to dismiss it or if the steed takes any damage.

mcdrtEUAX4WHf4ti.name: Phantom Steed
mcdrtEUAX4WHf4ti.description:
A Large, quasi-real, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.phbsumPhantomSte]{horselike creature} appears on the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice within range. You decide the creature's appearance, and it is equipped with a saddle, bit, and bridle. Any of the equipment created by the spell vanishes in a puff of smoke if it is carried more than 10 feet away from the steed.

For the duration, you or a creature you choose can ride the steed. The steed uses the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmRidingHorse000]{Riding Horse} stat block (see appendix B), except it has a Speed of 100 feet and can travel 13 miles in an hour. When the spell ends, the steed gradually fades, giving the rider 1 minute to dismount. The spell ends early if the steed takes any damage.

Swarm.name: Swarm
Swarm.description: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny bat. The swarm can't regain Hit Points or gain Temporary Hit Points.

Pigeon Hag.name: Pigeon Hag
Pigeon Hag.description:
Pigeon Hag

Vermin Hag of Deception and Control

Habitat: Mountain, Planar (Fey), Urban

Treasure: Arcana

Pigeon hags are vain witches who place themselves above every other being. They seek to reinforce that belief by controlling and undermining the knowledge and relationships of others. Pigeon hags often insinuate themselves into a mortal settlement and walk among the people, usually in a position to hear and spread gossip that they can twist and manipulate to their own ends.

Secret. The vanity of a pigeon hag is so overwhelming that polishing its ego can leave it flustered and briefly unable to act.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 19):

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.hYCrN82dMJFuJODB], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.91Sw6vOIaO7U8DvM], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.fVbCxFRaORalHB20], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.76C0FdcxlU8F9Rl2] (lair as sanctuary)

Failure: A target takes [[/damage average]] damage and has the &reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition until the start of the hag’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Shape-shift.name: Shape-shift
Shape-shift.description: The hag shape-shifts into a Small or Medium Humanoid, or it returns to its true form. Other than its size, its game statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Disarming Vanity.name: Disarming Vanity
Disarming Vanity.description: As an Influence action, a creature that flatters the hag forces it to succeed on a DC 17 Charisma saving throw or have the &reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition until the end of the hag’s next turn.

Harrying Wings.name: Harrying Wings
Harrying Wings.description: When the hag rolls Initiative, it is surrounded by fey spirits in the form of angry pigeons. The hag’s enemies within a 10-foot Emanation originating from it have Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls. This trait doesn’t function if the hag has the &reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition.

Coven Magic.name: Coven Magic
Coven Magic.description: While within 30 feet of at least two hag allies, the hag can cast one of the following spells, requiring no Material components, using the spell’s normal casting time, and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.4v2H3hHb3Ph9XLNd]{Augury}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.JGT5bNqu9REL7Fuz]{Find Familiar}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3OZnNhunvRtPOQmH]{Identify}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.SleYkHovQ8NagmeV]{Locate Object}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2024.tcm2024-player-options.Item.cp5KkAHN0XLDh5gc]{Lucky Charm}* (lasts until the hag casts it again, or chooses to end it with no action required), or Unseen Servant. The hag must finish a Long Rest before using this trait to cast that spell again.

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. The spell has no effect if the target is undead, if it doesn't understand your language, or if your command is directly harmful to it.

Some typical commands and their effects follow. You might issue a command other than one described here. If you do so, the DM determines how the target behaves. If the target can't follow your command, the spell ends.

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target falls prone and then ends its turn.

Halt. The target doesn't move and takes no actions. A flying creature stays aloft, provided that it is able to do so. If it must move to stay aloft, it flies the minimum distance needed to remain in the air.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be &Reference[paralyzed] for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional humanoid for each slot level above 2nd. The humanoids must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

materials.value: A small, straight piece of iron

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description: The target is Paralyzed for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. The illusion also ends if you dismiss it as an action or cast this spell again.

If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it.

If a creature uses its action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Stinking Cloud.name: Stinking Cloud
Stinking Cloud.description:
You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of yellow, nauseating gas centered on a point within range. The cloud spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. The cloud lingers in the air for the duration.

Each creature that is completely within the cloud at the start of its turn must make a Constitution saving throw against poison. On a failed save, the creature spends its action that turn retching and reeling. Creatures that don't need to breathe or are immune to poison automatically succeed on this saving throw.

A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the cloud after 4 rounds. A strong wind (at least 20 miles per hour) disperses it after 1 round.

materials.value: A rotten egg or several skunk cabbage leaves

Feeblemind.name: Feeblemind
Feeblemind.description:
You blast the mind of a creature that you can see within range, attempting to shatter its intellect and personality. The target takes 4d6 psychic damage and must make an Intelligence saving throw.

On a failed save, the creature's Intelligence and Charisma scores become 1. The creature can't cast Spells, activate Magic Items, understand language, or communicate in any intelligible way. The creature can, however, identify its friends, follow them, and even protect them.

At the end of every 30 days, the creature can repeat its saving throw against this spell. If it succeeds on its saving throw, the spell ends.

The spell can also be ended by Greater Restoration, heal, or wish.

materials.value: A handful of clay, crystal, glass, or mineral spheres

Feeblemind.name: Feeblemind
Feeblemind.description: The creature's Intelligence and Charisma scores become 1. The creature can't cast Spells, activate Magic Items, understand language, or communicate in any intelligible way. The creature can, however, identify its friends, follow them, and even protect them.

Dominate Person.name: Dominate Person
Dominate Person.description:
You attempt to beguile a humanoid that you can see within range. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be &Reference[charmed] by you for the duration. If you or creatures that are friendly to you are fighting it, it has advantage on the saving throw.

While the target is charmed, you have a telepathic link with it as long as the two of you are on the same plane of existence. You can use this telepathic link to issue commands to the creature while you are conscious (no action required), which it does its best to obey. You can specify a simple and general course of action, such as "Attack that creature," "Run over there," or "Fetch that object." If the creature completes the order and doesn't receive further direction from you, it defends and preserves itself to the best of its ability.

You can use your action to take total and precise control of the target. Until the end of your next turn, the creature takes only the actions you choose, and doesn't do anything that you don't allow it to do. During this time you can also cause the creature to use a reaction, but this requires you to use your own reaction as well.

Each time the target takes damage, it makes a new Wisdom saving throw against the spell. If the saving throw succeeds, the spell ends.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a 6th-level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. When you use a 7th-level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 1 hour. When you use a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the duration is concentration, up to 8 hours.

Dominate Person.name: Dominate Person
Dominate Person.description: The target is Charmed and must do its best to obey any commands sent by the caster.

Scrying.name: Scrying
Scrying.description:
You can see and hear a particular creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. If a target knows you're casting this spell, it can fail the saving throw voluntarily if it wants to be observed.

Knowledge Save Modifier
Secondhand (you have heard of the target) +5
Firsthand (you have met the target) +0
Familiar (you know the target well) -5
Connection Save Modifier
Likeness or picture -2
Possession or garment -4
Body part, lock of hair, bit of nail, or the like -10

On a successful save, the target isn't affected, and you can't use this spell against it again for 24 hours.

On a failed save, the spell creates an Invisible sensor within 10 feet of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the Duration. A creature that can see Invisile Objects sees the sensor as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Instead of targeting a creature, you can choose a location you have seen before as the target of this spell. When you do, the sensor appears at that location and doesn't move.

materials.value: A focus worth at least 1,000 gp, such as a crystal ball, a silver mirror, or a font filled with holy water.

Word of Recall.name: Word of Recall
Word of Recall.description:
You and up to five willing creatures within 5 feet of you instantly teleport to a previously designated sanctuary. You and any creatures that teleport with you appear in the nearest unoccupied space to the spot you designated when you prepared your sanctuary (see below). If you cast this spell without first preparing a sanctuary, the spell has no effect.

You must designate a sanctuary by casting this spell within a location, such as a temple, dedicated to or strongly linked to your deity. If you attempt to cast the spell in this manner in an area that isn't dedicated to your deity, the spell has no effect.

Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the wight has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the wight's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The wight can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.
