Q5mBrxGLx4qANawC.name: Giant Crocodile
Q5mBrxGLx4qANawC.description: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Hold Breath.name: Hold Breath
Hold Breath.description: The crocodile can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The crocodile makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+8 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) piercing damage.

The target is grappled (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the crocodile can't bite another target.

Tail.name: Tail
Tail.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+8 to hit,, 10 ft., one target not grappled by the crocodile. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

QBOw7GpJwHvRCaSS.name: Crooked Man
QBOw7GpJwHvRCaSS.description:
Crooked Man

Broken Spirit of Betrayal

Habitat: Any

The crooked man is an Undead embodiment of broken trust and the twisting of purpose. Those who die having betrayed what they hold sacred, embracing their treachery to their core, might return in this broken, gnarled form of snapped bones with a crooked grin. The creature’s fingers end in curling claws that hook and hold, and the duplicity in its heart bleeds out to twist allies against one another. Despite the creature’s name, anyone can become this manifestation of betrayal.

Secret. The crooked man can’t abide self-sacrifice and withers in its presence.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The crooked man makes two [[/item Crooked Claw]] attacks, and he can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Snap Limb]]. He can also use Confusion if available.

Crooked Claw.name: Crooked Claw
Crooked Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is &Reference[Grappled apply=false] (escape DC 16) from one of two claws. Until the grapple ends, the target is &Reference[Restrained apply=false].

Snap Limb.name: Snap Limb
Snap Limb.description:
One creature the crooked man is grappling must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw. A creature without limbs that can break is immune to this effect. On a failed save, the target takes 35 ([[/r 10d6]]) force damage, and the bones (or equivalent) in one of its limbs (crooked man’s choice) breaks, causing an appropriate effect below. A broken limb heals in 40 days, or when the creature regains any hit points from magic or Regeneration. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

Broken Arm. Disadvantage on attack rolls. Can’t hold anything or manipulate objects with the limb.

Broken Leg. Speed halved. If the creature takes the Dash action, it must succeed on a [[/save DEX DC 15]] saving throw or be knocked &reference[prone].

Broken Wing. Flying speed reduced to 0.

Confusion.name: Confusion
Confusion.description: The crooked man casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.9hQXdMSmerkTsHDe], requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17).

Blinking Teleport.name: Blinking Teleport
Blinking Teleport.description: The crooked man becomes &Reference[Invisible apply=false] for 1 minute and teleports to an unoccupied space he can see within 60 feet. The condition ends immediately after the crooked man deals any damage.

Aversion To Self-sacrifice.name: Aversion To Self-sacrifice
Aversion To Self-sacrifice.description: The crooked man takes 20 necrotic damage if he can see a creature willingly take damage or gain a condition in place of someone else, or to someone else’s benefit.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The crooked man has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

HSa8booR4YOdeYi2.name: Confusion
HSa8booR4YOdeYi2.description:
This spell assaults and twists creatures' minds, spawning delusions and provoking uncontrolled action. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw when you cast this spell or be affected by it.

An affected target can't take reactions and must roll from the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.tables.RollTable.LHEts1oDaDwcehuj]{Confusion} table at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the radius of the sphere increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 4th.

Club.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Training.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has proficiency in one skill of the DM's choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

Divine Aid.name: Divine Aid
Divine Aid.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Magpie of Omens.name: Magpie of Omens
Magpie of Omens.description:
Magpie of Omens

Bird of Fate and Fortune (Crystal or gemstone shards)

Habitat: Forest, Grassland, Planar (Fey)

To those who respect the Old Ways, this bird of black and white brings tidings both fair and foul. Although the omens the magpie delivers can bring joy and grief in equal measure, they are always trustworthy.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The magpie makes two [[/item Beak]] attacks.

Beak.name: Beak
Beak.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Bonded Voice.name: Bonded Voice
Bonded Voice.description: The magpie can form or dissolve a magical bond with a willing creature within 5 feet. While the bond lasts, the bonded creature can speak through the magpie using the creature’s own voice and language, but with a birdlike lilt. The bond ends when the creature dies or if the magpie creates a new bond.

One For Sorrow.name: One For Sorrow
One For Sorrow.description: When a creature within 30 feet of the magpie makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw with advantage, the target rolls [[/r 1d6]] and subtracts it from the total.

Two For Joy.name: Two For Joy
Two For Joy.description: When the magpie or another creature within 30 feet of it makes an ability check or a saving throw, the target rolls [[/r 1d4]] and adds it to the total.

Flyby.name: Flyby
Flyby.description: The magpie doesn’t provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

Lark Wells.description:

QNPhgYXg0U9kpwHC.name: The Horned King
QNPhgYXg0U9kpwHC.description:
The Horned King

Sin Made Manifest

Habitat: Forest, Planar (Lower Planes)

Every sinful, selfish action in the world pours a fraction of itself into the Horned King, a being composed of every mortal who has surrendered to temptation. Fortunately, under normal circumstances, the Horned King exists as an ephemeral spirit with no physical presence. During times of upheaval, when a great many mortals give in to their selfish desires or when another power—such as a deity, demon lord, or archfey—interferes, the Horned King is made manifest, and with it comes the weight of sin flooding back into the world that created it.

The Horned King’s Lair

The Horned King’s lair is the forest clearing where a twisted tree focuses the malevolent will that gave rise to the king’s physical presence.

The region containing the Horned King’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Sweet Temptation. Within 1 mile of the lair, a creature that acts on a sinful impulse to the detriment of a friendly or indifferent creature increases its hit point maximum and current hit points by 10 until it finishes a long rest. Creatures are aware of this effect. This can’t occur again for that creature until it finishes a long rest.

Tenacious Curses. Within 1 mile of the lair, saving throws against curses have disadvantage.

If the Horned King dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The Horned King makes three [[/item Cursed Strike]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Terrorizing Breath]].

Cursed Strike.name: Cursed Strike
Cursed Strike.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit (against a cursed target, scores a critical hit on a 19 or 20 on the d20), reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 ([[/r 2d10 + 6]]) bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (Horned King’s choice) plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it is cursed until the end of the Horned King’s next turn. While cursed, it must subtract [[/r 1d4]] from ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws.

Breath Of Corruption.name: Breath Of Corruption
Breath Of Corruption.description: The Horned King breathes sweet-smelling shadow in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 21 ([[/r 6d6]]) necrotic damage plus 21 (6d6) psychic damage, and it gains 1 level of &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] that ends at the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

Terrorizing Breath.name: Terrorizing Breath
Terrorizing Breath.description: The Horned King breathes bitter shadow in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or become &Reference[Frightened apply=false] for 1 minute. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The Horned King can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The Horned King regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Taste of Wickedness.name: Taste of Wickedness
Taste of Wickedness.description: The Horned King’s snakelike tongue whips out hungrily at a cursed creature within 15 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 20 Charisma saving throw or take 16 ([[/r 3d10]]) psychic damage. The Horned King regains hit points equal to the damage taken, and one curse of the Horned King’s choice affecting the target ends.

Temptation.name: Temptation
Temptation.description: The Horned King speaks to a creature it can see within 120 feet and offers to either restore 20 of its hit points or grant it inspiration. If the creature accepts, it gains that benefit but is cursed for 1 minute. While cursed, the Horned King has resistance to all damage the target deals.

Trample.name: Trample
Trample.description: The Horned King moves up to half its speed, and it makes one [[/item Cursed Strike]] attack.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: The Horned King’s lair is the forest clearing where a twisted tree focuses the malevolent will that gave rise to the king’s physical presence. The region containing the Horned King’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects: If the Horned King dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Sweet Temptation.name: Sweet Temptation
Sweet Temptation.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, a creature that acts on a sinful impulse to the detriment of a friendly or indifferent creature increases its hit point maximum and current hit points by 10 until it finishes a long rest. Creatures are aware of this effect. This can’t occur again for that creature until it finishes a long rest.

Tenacious Curses.name: Tenacious Curses
Tenacious Curses.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, saving throws against curses have disadvantage.

Sense Desire.name: Sense Desire
Sense Desire.description: The Horned King casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ppWAAEul0QHtm4er], requiring no spell components and using Charisma for the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 20).

Enduring Restoration.name: Enduring Restoration
Enduring Restoration.description: If the Horned King dies, its body disappears in a cloud of ash. It becomes an intangible, &Reference[Invisible apply=false] spirit in its home forest, and it can’t reform a new physical body for [[/r 10d10]] years.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the Horned King fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The Horned King has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
For the duration, you can read the thoughts of certain creatures. When you cast the spell and as your action on each turn until the spell ends, you can focus your mind on any one creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. If the creature you choose has an Intelligence of 3 or lower or doesn't speak any language, the creature is unaffected.

You initially learn the surface thoughts of the creature—what is most on its mind in that moment. As an action, you can either shift your attention to another creature's thoughts or attempt to probe deeper into the same creature's mind. If you probe deeper, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, you gain insight into its reasoning (if any), its emotional state, and something that looms large in its mind (such as something it worries over, loves, or hates). If it succeeds, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and unless you shift your attention to another creature's thoughts, the creature can use its action on its turn to make an Intelligence check contested by your Intelligence check; if it succeeds, the spell ends.

Questions verbally directed at the target creature naturally shape the course of its thoughts, so this spell is particularly effective as part of an interrogation.

You can also use this spell to detect the presence of thinking creatures you can't see. When you cast the spell or as your action during the duration, you can search for thoughts within 30 feet of you. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 2 feet of rock, 2 inches of any metal other than lead, or a thin sheet of lead blocks you. You can't detect a creature with an Intelligence of 3 or lower or one that doesn't speak any language.

Once you detect the presence of a creature in this way, you can read its thoughts for the rest of the duration as described above, even if you can't see it, but it must still be within range.

Goatstealer

Hungry Livestock Snatcher (Incense and spoiled meat)

Habitat: Desert, Forest, Grassland, Hill

The hairless, reeking goatstealers are vicious predators and scavengers that earn their name from their habit of preying upon livestock. They latch onto prey with wicked, needle-like teeth, delivering lethal venom and devouring creatures far larger than its wiry frame would suggest is possible. Especially dangerous in packs, the carrion-yet-peaty stench of goatstealers is the stuff of legend.

On a successful save, the creature is immune to the Stench of all goatstealers for 1 hour.

Corn Dolly.name: Corn Dolly
Corn Dolly.description:
Corn Dolly

Grain Husk Companion (Curved blade plated in gold)

Habitat: Any

Treasure: None

Crafted from dried husks and bound with twine, corn dollies’ delicate forms are stitched together with rustic care. Their faces are ink-brushed with simple, childlike expressions—smiling mouths that curve a bit too wide and hollow eyes that seem to stare far beyond the physical world. The Constructs are spirits of deceased Humanoids drawn to the hollow corn husk shell, seeking refuge. These spirits retain faint traces of who they once were—a protective instinct entwined with a simmering fury. Once animated, the dolls reflect this dual nature: acting as silent guardians one moment and vengeful specters the next.

The Sweetheart.name: The Sweetheart
The Sweetheart.description:
Wayward Haint

Lost Soul Bound to Regret

Habitat: Any

Treasure: None

Wayward haints are restless spirits stuck between the realms of the living and the dead. Be it a curse or an unresolved conflict from their previous life, a haint can’t rest until their unfinished business is resolved.

Haints only show hints of who they were in life, taking on a more symbolic form related to the hurt or loss they can’t let go of. They tend to repeat their monotonous actions—often imitating those performed in life or reenacting their sorrow—over and over for eternity. When provoked, they can display a volatile temper and lash out with a crushing wave of the grief and indecision that binds their spirit.

Secret. Wayward haints can be trapped in empty bottles if they’re tricked or forced to pass over one.

Bottle Trap.name: Bottle Trap
Bottle Trap.description: A haint that enters the space of an upright, empty bottle must succeed on a DC 16 Charisma saving throw or be drawn into the bottle, and a cork or stopper appears to close the bottle. The trapped haint can see and hear through the bottle out to 10 feet, and any creature in that range can hear the haint. The haint is released if the bottle breaks or another creature opens it.

Draining Regret.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target gains 1 &reference[exhaustion apply=false] level. Ferryman.name: Ferryman
Ferryman.description:
Ferryman

Cursed Undead Boatman

Habitat: Coastal, Swamp

Treasure: Implements

Ferrymen are Undead created through the use of curses and jinxcraft and are doomed to ply the waters where they were raised. They pole through the bayous and rivers, and even across land on a wave of swamp water, in coffin boats. They can focus the malice of their curse through the light of their lantern poles, jinxing enemies or those who try to force a ride without payment.

Secret. Paying a ferryman 3 copper coins lifts any curse the creature placed on the payer, and it entitles one to a single unnerving but safe ride in the ferryman’s coffin boat.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The ferryman makes two [[/item Lantern Pole]] attacks and uses Hexed Lantern if available.

Lantern Pole.name: Lantern Pole
Lantern Pole.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 10 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &reference[prone apply=false] condition.

Hexed Lantern.name: Hexed Lantern
Hexed Lantern.description:

Failure: The creature is cursed for 1 minute and must subtract [[/r 1d4]] from D20 Tests.

Coffin Boat.name: Coffin Boat
Coffin Boat.description:
The ferryman rides an open coffin on a swell of swamp water, allowing it to travel with a Speed of 40 feet over any surface, including liquids, ignoring Difficult Terrain. The coffin can hold two other Medium creatures. Two Small creatures or four Tiny creatures count as one Medium creature.

While riding the coffin, the ferryman has Immunity to the Prone condition, and the coffin moves with the ferryman unless the ferryman has the Incapacitated condition. The coffin has AC 15; HP 25; Immunity to Necrotic, Poison, and Psychic damage.

If the coffin is destroyed, the ferryman can magically create a new one using a 10-minute ritual.

Payment.name: Payment
Payment.description: The ferryman must peacefully offer a ride in its boat to a creature that takes the Influence action to offer it 3 CP. If that creature is cursed by the ferryman, the curse ends. If the boat is full, the ferryman must return to offer the creature a ride once its current passengers leave the boat. If the creature or its allies damage the ferryman or force it to make a saving throw, this effect ends and the creature can't use that ferryman's Payment trait again.

Regeneration.name: Regeneration
Regeneration.description: The ferryman regains 10 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 Hit Point.

S5NNrWLkqfQKTs1h.name: Shrouded
S5NNrWLkqfQKTs1h.description:
Shrouded

Soul Corrupted by the Shroud

Habitat: Any

Shrouded are the spirits of the dead—devoid of any ability to reason and corrupted by the deathly mists known as the Shroud. They are raw emotional energy, unfettered and unleashed, manifested into being. The shrouded are constantly whispering about a victim’s incompetencies, weakness, foibles, and failings as they engulf their prey to drain the life from them, corrupting their soul.

Secret. Shrouded are bound by barriers and lines of iron, which is why cemeteries with iron fences keep them contained.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The shrouded makes two melee attacks.

Corrupting Touch.name: Corrupting Touch
Corrupting Touch.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Consuming Bite (Devourer Only).description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is &Reference[Grappled apply=false] (escape DC 13). At the start of a &Reference[Grappled apply=false] target’s turn, it takes 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) necrotic damage, and the shrouded regains hit points equal to that amount.

Scythe (Reaper Only).name: Scythe  (Reaper Only)
Scythe (Reaper Only).description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a creature, it can’t regain hit points until the start of the shrouded’s next turn.

Toxic Thoughts (Whisperer Only).name: Toxic Thoughts  (Whisperer Only)
Toxic Thoughts (Whisperer Only).description: The shrouded fills the area within 30 feet of it with mental anguish. Each creature that isn’t a Construct or Undead within that area must make a DC 13 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) psychic damage and is &Reference[Frightened apply=false] until the start of the shrouded’s next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

Mist Form.name: Mist Form
Mist Form.description: The shrouded can enter another creature’s space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

Corrupting Mist.name: Corrupting Mist
Corrupting Mist.description: A creature that starts its turn in the shrouded’s space must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The soul of a Humanoid that dies from this damage becomes a new shrouded at the start of the shrouded’s next turn and takes its turn on that initiative. The Humanoid can’t be returned to life until the new shrouded is destroyed.

Graveyard Warding.name: Graveyard Warding
Graveyard Warding.description: The shrouded can’t move through a space with a barrier or line of iron, such as a wrought iron fence or a line of iron filings. This impassible barrier rises to a height of 1 mile above the iron.

Variation.name: Variation
Variation.description: The shrouded has one of three variants, which determines a unique action option: Devourer, Reaper, or Whisperer.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Divine Aid.name: Divine Aid
Divine Aid.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Shortsword.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+4 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

Kackle.name: Kackle
Kackle.description:
Kackle

Laughing Lantern Bearer

Habitat: Any

 Treasure: Implements

Those who were particularly sadistic in life and died consumed by wicked mirth linger as Kackles—ghostly figures that drift above the ground, always flitting just out of sight. Adorned in tattered cloaks and concealing hoods or hats, their hollow laughter echoes through dark places, fading in and out to confuse and terrify their victims. Kackles always carry lanterns lit with ghostly flames, the color of which changes to reflect a kackle’s current cruelty of choice.

Secret. Kackles are bound to their lanterns, and smashing their lights can snuff out the spirits’ existence.

Lantern Flame.name: Lantern Flame
Lantern Flame.description:
Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. or range 90 ft. Hit: Varies by lantern color (kackle's choice):

  • Blue. 7 ([[/r 1d6 + 4]]) Cold damage, and the target has the &reference[restrained apply=false]condition until the end of its next turn.

  • Green. 20 ([[/r 3d10 + 4]]) Necrotic damage, and the target’s Speed is 0 until the end of its next turn.

  • Purple. 10 ([[/r 1d12 + 4]]) Psychic damage, and the target has the &reference[frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

  • Red. 15 ([[/r 2d10 + 4]]) Fire damage, and the target starts burning, taking 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) Fire damage instead of the regular burning damage.

Flickering Teleport.name: Flickering Teleport
Flickering Teleport.description:
The kackle teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. The kackle can then change its lantern color, and it can create the following—

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature in a 5-foot Emanation originating from the kackle’s destination space.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage of the same type as the current Lantern Flame color.

Success: Half damage.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The kackle can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. It takes [[/damage average]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Lantern Vulnerability.name: Lantern Vulnerability
Lantern Vulnerability.description: The kackle’s lantern has AC 15 and Immunity to Poison and Psychic damage. Any damage the lantern takes deals half that amount of Force damage to the kackle.

The Grinning Sinner.name: The Grinning Sinner
The Grinning Sinner.description:
The Grinning Sinner

Dealer of Jinxes

Habitat: Coastal, Swamp

Once the dashing pirate captain Briggsy Kratch, the crocodile-folk now known as the Grinning Sinner made a bargain for power with a spirit known as Snake Eye Jack. The sinner grew discontent with the power he was gifted and tricked Jack into a coffin before sealing him inside. Now the Grinning Sinner siphons his trapped patron’s cursed power and makes bargains of his own to snare the souls of the desperate and foolish.

Secret. The Grinning Sinner holds his prowess and reputation as a fearsome and successful pirate captain above all; causing him to doubt his renown can turn his hexed magic against him.

The Grinning Sinner’s Lair

The Grinning Sinner’s lair is the derelict riverboat casino, the Dead Man’s Hand.

The region containing the Grinning Sinner’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Fate’s Wheel. Within 1 mile of the lair, if the number rolled on a die to restore hit points is even, increase the number rolled by 1. If the number rolled is odd, reduce it by 1.

Run of Bad Luck. Within 1 mile of the lair, a creature that rolls a 1 on an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw must subtract 1d4 from its next roll that isn’t a damage roll.

If the Grinning Sinner dies or moves his lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Bane.name: Bane
Bane.description:
Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within range must make Charisma saving throws. Whenever a target that fails this saving throw makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

Bane.name: Bane
Bane.description: Whenever the target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw.

Bestow Curse.name: Bestow Curse
Bestow Curse.description:
You touch a creature, and that creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become cursed for the duration of the spell. When you cast this spell, choose the nature of the curse from the following options:

  • Choose one ability score. While cursed, the target has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with that ability score.
  • While cursed, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls against you.
  • While cursed, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw at the start of each of its turns. If it fails, it wastes its action that turn doing nothing.
  • While the target is cursed, your attacks and spells deal an extra 1d8 necrotic damage to the target.

A remove curse spell ends this effect. At the DM's option, you may choose an alternative curse effect, but it should be no more powerful than those described above. The DM has final say on such a curse's effect.

At Higher Levels. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. If you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration is 8 hours. If you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the duration is 24 hours. If you use a 9th level spell slot, the spell lasts until it is dispelled. Using a spell slot of 5th level or higher grants a duration that doesn't require concentration.

Major Image.name: Major Image
Major Image.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot cube. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems completely real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted. You can't create sufficient heat or cold to cause damage, a sound loud enough to deal thunder damage or deafen a creature, or a smell that might sicken a creature (like a troglodyte's stench).

As long as you are within range of the illusion, you can use your action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the illusion to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it. A creature that uses its action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring your concentration.

Remove Curse.name: Remove Curse
Remove Curse.description: At your touch, all curses affecting one creature or object end. If the object is a cursed magic item, its curse remains, but the spell breaks its owner's Attunement to the object so it can be removed or discarded.

Animate Dead.name: Animate Dead
Animate Dead.description:
This spell creates an undead servant. Choose a pile of bones or a corpse of a Medium or Small humanoid within range. Your spell imbues the target with a foul mimicry of life, raising it as an undead creature. The target becomes a skeleton if you chose bones or a zombie if you chose a corpse (the DM has the creature's game statistics).

On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 60 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.

The creature is under your control for 24 hours, after which it stops obeying any command you've given it. To maintain control of the creature for another 24 hours, you must cast this spell on the creature again before the current 24-hour period ends. This use of the spell reasserts your control over up to four creatures you have animated with this spell, rather than animating a new one.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you animate or reassert control over two additional undead creatures for each slot level above 3rd. Each of the creatures must come from a different corpse or pile of bones.

materials.value: A drop of blood, a piece of flesh, and a pinch of bone dust

Creation.name: Creation
Creation.description:
You pull wisps of shadow material from the Shadowfell to create a nonliving object of vegetable matter within 'range': soft goods, rope, wood, or something similar. You can also use this spell to create mineral objects such as stone, crystal, or metal. The object created must be no larger than a 5-foot cube, and the object must be of a form and material that you have seen before.

The duration depends on the object's material. If the object is composed of multiple materials, use the shortest duration.

  • Vegetable matter - 1 day
  • Stone or crystal - 12 hours
  • Precious metals - 1 hour
  • Gems - 10 minutes
  • Adamantine or mithral - 1 minute

Using any material created by this spell as another spell's material component causes that spell to fail.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the cube increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 5th.

materials.value: A tiny piece of matter of the same type of the item you plan to create.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 15-foot-radius sphere for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

materials.value: Bat fur and a drop of pitch or piece of coal

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The sinner casts one of the following spells using his Curse Bottle (and no other material components) and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.95K2aUhAGV9qXjnf], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.pO4zGe5LmFIYqJiL], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.nslx2nT3p4lNkmdp], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XZhdgVK3cLoxNCQl]

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.oyE5nVppa5mde5gT], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.lnaGnxMzpYnbw1uU], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.S7VbUetIfVT7B6Eq]

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The sinner makes two attacks, using [[/item Hex Grasp]] or [[/item Blunderbuss]] in any combination. He can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.95K2aUhAGV9qXjnf].

Hex Grasp.name: Hex Grasp
Hex Grasp.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a creature, it is cursed until the start of the sinner’s next turn, or until the sinner curses it in this way again. While cursed, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls and on ability checks that rely on an ability of the sinner’s choice.

Blunderbuss.name: Blunderbuss
Blunderbuss.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is pushed up to 10 feet straight away.

Curse Blast.name: Curse Blast
Curse Blast.description:
The sinner unleashes one of the following curses from his blunderbuss:

  • Jack’s Anguish. A magenta wave fires out with a deep, wailing moan. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 11 ([[/r 2d10]]) psychic damage and is &Reference[Frightened apply=false] for 1 minute. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only. A &Reference[Frightened apply=false] creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

  • Shadowy Friends. A wave of shadow coughs forth and wraps around foes in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or become &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] until the end of the sinner’s next turn. If a &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] target takes damage, the condition ends early.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The sinner can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The sinner regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

Barbed Curse.name: Barbed Curse
Barbed Curse.description: The sinner targets one creature cursed by him or affected by his Bane spell within 30 feet of himself. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or take 6 ([[/r 1d12]]) force damage.

Jinxed Ground.name: Jinxed Ground
Jinxed Ground.description: Cursed magenta symbols flash on the ground within 20 feet of the sinner. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 17 Charisma saving throw or be knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Grinning Grasp.name: Grinning Grasp
Grinning Grasp.description: The sinner teleports to an unoccupied space he can see within 30 feet. He makes one [[/item Hex Grasp]] attack before or after teleporting and can’t take this action again until the start of his next turn.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: The Grinning Sinner’s lair is the derelict riverboat casino, the Dead Man’s Hand. The region containing the Grinning Sinner’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects: If the Grinning Sinner dies or moves his lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Fate’s Wheel.name: Fate’s Wheel
Fate’s Wheel.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, if the number rolled on a die to restore hit points is even, increase the number rolled by 1. If the number rolled is odd, reduce it by 1.

Run of Bad Luck.name: Run of Bad Luck
Run of Bad Luck.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, a creature that rolls a 1 on an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw must subtract [[/r 1d4]] from its next roll that isn’t a damage roll.

Coffin Rider.name: Coffin Rider
Coffin Rider.description: The sinner has a magic coffin that has immunity to all damage. While standing on the coffin, the sinner rides it on a ghostly wave of swamp water with a speed of 60 feet and can move over liquids as if they were solid.

Curse Bottle.name: Curse Bottle
Curse Bottle.description: The sinner has a bottle that holds cursed magic. The bottle has AC 15, HP 25, and immunity to all damage except force. If the bottle is destroyed, the sinner can magically create a new one when he finishes a long rest.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the sinner fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

Overweening Pride.name: Overweening Pride
Overweening Pride.description: As a bonus action, a creature can insult the sinner’s skill and renown as a pirate captain. The sinner must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 10 psychic damage and have disadvantage on attack rolls against any target other than the creature.

TXYz5iHztVsWNjrM.name: Doctor Belkin
TXYz5iHztVsWNjrM.description:
Wormhost Surgeon

Parasitical Physician

Habitat: Any

Treasure: Implements

Alien parasitic worms that infest the brains of Humanoid bodies mutate their hosts into wormhost surgeons. These aberrant husks are obsessed with anatomical study and with finding new Humanoids to infest with larval worm slurry to propagate their kind. They can pass for ordinary people in most cases but must take care to hide their exposed brains and the wriggling worms within their flesh.

Secret. Wormhost surgeons are drawn to seek out and infest sapient victims, so intelligent creatures with veiled minds slip beneath the surgeons’ notice.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The surgeon makes two [[/item Bone Saw]] attacks.

Regeneration.name: Regeneration
Regeneration.description: The surgeon regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns. If it takes poison damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of its next turn. The surgeon dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

Veiled Ignorance.name: Veiled Ignorance
Veiled Ignorance.description: A creature whose mind can’t be read, or that is under the effect of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.bllEWfm9xfEKynhv]{Mind Blank} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.aU62xVUBYkAQWIHv]{Nondetection} spell, has the &reference[invisible apply=false] condition toward the surgeon (this ignores the surgeon's Blindsight).

Bone Saw.name: Bone Saw
Bone Saw.description:
Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Critical Hit: If the target is a creature, its Intelligence score decreases by [[/r 1d4]]. The target dies if this reduces that score to 0.

Infested Spray.name: Infested Spray
Infested Spray.description:
The surgeon unleashes a spray of worm-ridden cerebral fluid.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 14, each creature in a 20-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target is infested with larval parasitic worms. The target takes 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) Psychic damage at the end of each of its turns as the worms burrow toward its brain. The ongoing damage ends when the target takes Poison damage or is targeted by an effect that ends the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition.

Success: Half damage only.

Failure or Success: If the target is reduced to 0 Hit Points by this Psychic damage, the worms reach its brain and it dies. A Humanoid slain in this way rises 24 hours later as a wormhost surgeon.

Protective Parasite.name: Protective Parasite
Protective Parasite.description:
Trigger: The surgeon is reduced to 0 Hit Points.

Response: The parasite worm emerges from the surgeon’s exposed brain and spits acid—

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 14, each creature in a 20-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Club.name: Club
Club.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Training.name: Training
Training.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has proficiency in one skill of the DM's choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

Isolde, the Grim.name: Isolde, the Grim
Isolde, the Grim.description:
Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Ethereal Sight.name: Ethereal Sight
Ethereal Sight.description: The ghost can see 60 ft. into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description:
The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain.

It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Withering Touch.name: Withering Touch
Withering Touch.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+5 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) necrotic damage.

Etherealness.name: Etherealness
Etherealness.description: The ghost enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

Horrifying Visage.name: Horrifying Visage
Horrifying Visage.description:
Each non-undead creature within 60 ft. of the ghost that can see it must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. If the save fails by 5 or more, the target also ages 1d4 x 10 years.

A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the frightened condition on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this ghost's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours. The aging effect can be reversed with a greater restoration spell, but only within 24 hours of it occurring.

Possession.name: Possession
Possession.description:
One humanoid that the ghost can see within 5 ft. of it must succeed on a DC 13 Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the ghost; the ghost then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The ghost now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness.

The ghost can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the ghost ends it as a bonus action, or the ghost is turned or forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the ghost reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 ft. of the body. The target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

UKt4WVtAy5UBHZiv.name: Hospital Horror
UKt4WVtAy5UBHZiv.description:
Hospital Horror

Mutated Experiment

Habitat: Any

Treasure: None

Hospital horrors were once people, but now they are repulsive mockeries created through surgical and magical alteration. They have no memory of their past lives, existing only within a chemically induced rage. Often, they are conditioned by the use of specific command phrases that allow them to be controlled.

Secret. Hospital horrors have spent much of their existence being prodded with needles, so being pierced frays what few wits they retain.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The horror makes two [[/item Graft Blade]] attacks.

Graft Blade.name: Graft Blade
Graft Blade.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Stim Burst.name: Stim Burst
Stim Burst.description: The horror takes the Dash action and can jump up to 30 feet by spending 10 feet of movement.

Aversion To Needles.name: Aversion To Needles
Aversion To Needles.description: If the horror takes Piercing damage, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: The horror has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the horror’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn’t have the &reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition.

UTrFGVTOj3GuqKD8.name: Ulf Harga
UTrFGVTOj3GuqKD8.description:
Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Club.name: Club
Club.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+2 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

Amorphous.name: Amorphous
Amorphous.description: The shadow can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

Shadow Stealth.name: Shadow Stealth
Shadow Stealth.description: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

Sunlight Weakness.name: Sunlight Weakness
Sunlight Weakness.description: While in sunlight, the shadow has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

Strength Drain.name: Strength Drain
Strength Drain.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+4 to hit,, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) necrotic damage.

The target's Strength score is reduced by 1d4. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.If a non-evil humanoid dies from this attack, a new shadow rises from the corpse 1d4 hours later.

Alpengrendel.name: Alpengrendel
Alpengrendel.description:
Alpengrendel

Brute Born of Mountain Ice

Habitat: Arctic, Mountain

Treasure: Any (except Relics)

Alpengrendel are hulking creatures covered in bluish white fur, with great tusks and horns. They were born of the ice and darkness of their mountaintop homes, shaped by the unseen hands of a deity of cold stone and gloam. The bitter cold of the mountain peaks infuses both their touch and their breath.

Alpengrendel draw upon the timelessness of the mountains, healing from otherwise lethal wounds in the blink of an eye. They fear only the power of lightning, which can slay them, and the power of the gods, whom they bitterly resent.

Secret. Their disdain for deities runs so deep that alpengrendel are enraged and unnerved by the trappings of faith.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The alpengrendel makes one Claws attack and one Tusks attack.

Claws.name: Claws
Claws.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] Damage.

Tusks.name: Tusks
Tusks.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Frost Breath.name: Frost Breath
Frost Breath.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature in a 30-foot Cone.

Failure: 21 (6d6) Cold damage. Until the start of the alpengrendel’s next turn, the target’s Speed is halved, and it has Disadvantage on attack rolls.

Success: Half damage only.

Aversion To Faith.name: Aversion To Faith
Aversion To Faith.description: The alpengrendel has Disadvantage on attack rolls while in a consecrated area or on attack rolls against a creature holding or wearing a Holy Symbol.

Regeneration.name: Regeneration
Regeneration.description: The alpengrendel regains 10 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns. If the alpengrendel takes Acid or Lightning damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of its next turn. The alpengrendel dies only if it starts its turn with 0 Hit Points and doesn’t regenerate.

Uqns7xOPRurvz1TJ.name: Noble
Uqns7xOPRurvz1TJ.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbarmBreastplat]{Breastplate}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepRapier0000]{Rapier}

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description: Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is [[lookup @activation.condition activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]]. Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] adds [[lookup @roll.formula activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]] to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

Use.name: Use
Use.condition: hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon

The Dusk Mother.name: The Dusk Mother
The Dusk Mother.description:
The Dusk Mother

Shade of Motherly Anguish

Habitat: Any

The keening wail of a mother is unmistakable and haunting, and the legends that tell of the Dusk Mother barely scratch the surface of her terrifying existence. She carries a pair of oversized shears and a great bell she tolls to accompany her wailing. Her eternal torment stems from her children, who met their fate due to the Dusk Mother’s negligence—or perhaps her wrath. Now she cries in shame for that loss as she searches for her children, or for souls to claim and fashion into dolls in a futile attempt to fill the void in her doomed soul.

Secret. The Dusk Mother’s only true weakness or fear is the remnants of her children—some trinket or toy they played with in life or, more chillingly, their spirits, which also wander the world, but never in the same place as their mother’s shade.

The Dusk Mother’s Lair

The Dusk Mother’s lair is a home or other place in a settlement where tragedy struck, most often those involving children or families broken by loss. If encountered in her lair, the Dusk Mother has a challenge rating of 25 (75,000 XP).

The region containing the Dusk Mother’s lair is changed by her presence, creating the following effects:

Enduring Dirge. Within 1 mile of the lair, creatures with an Intelligence score higher than 4 who can speak at least one language absently sing nursery rhymes or funeral songs without intending to.

Thoughts of Loss. Whenever a living creature within 1 mile of the lair finishes a short rest, it must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or it gains no benefit from the rest.

If the Dusk Mother dies or moves her lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The mother makes three [[/item Shears]] attacks.

Shears.name: Shears
Shears.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a creature and is hit with two or more Shears attacks in the same turn, it gains 1 level of &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false].

Mournful Tolling.name: Mournful Tolling
Mournful Tolling.description: The mother focuses her wail into her bell. Each creature within 30 feet of the mother must make a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw. A Construct, an Undead, or a creature that has ever been raised from the dead is unaffected. On a failed save, a target takes 77 ([[/r 14d10]]) psychic damage that ignores damage resistance, and the target becomes &Reference[Stunned apply=false] until the end of the mother’s next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The mother can take 3 legendary actions (4 in Lair), choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The mother regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

Drift.name: Drift
Drift.description: The mother moves up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks. When she enters a creature’s space during this move, that creature takes 16 ([[/r 3d10]]) cold damage and has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn. A creature takes this damage only once per turn.

Snip.name: Snip
Snip.description: The mother makes one [[/item Shears]] attack. On a hit, the target takes an extra 4 ([[/r 1d8]]) necrotic damage.

Endless Keening.name: Endless Keening
Endless Keening.description: Each creature within 30 feet of the mother that can hear her must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw. A Construct, an Undead, or a creature that has ever been raised from the dead is unaffected. On a failed save, a target takes 28 ([[/r 8d6]]) necrotic damage that ignores damage resistance, if any. A target that fails by 5 or more is reduced to 0 hit points. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: The Dusk Mother’s lair is a home or other place in a settlement where tragedy struck, most often those involving children or families broken by loss. If encountered in her lair, the Dusk Mother has a challenge rating of 25 (75,000 XP). The region containing the Dusk Mother’s lair is changed by her presence, creating the following effects: If the Dusk Mother dies or moves her lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Enduring Dirge.name: Enduring Dirge
Enduring Dirge.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, creatures with an Intelligence score higher than 4 who can speak at least one language absently sing nursery rhymes or funeral songs without intending to.

Thoughts of Loss.name: Thoughts of Loss
Thoughts of Loss.description: Whenever a living creature within 1 mile of the lair finishes a short rest, it must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or it gains no benefit from the rest.

Soul Doll.name: Soul Doll
Soul Doll.description: The mother targets the corpse of a creature she killed within the last minute. The target’s soul is drawn out and transforms into a ceramic doll of the creature. The doll is a Tiny object with AC 15, HP equal to half the creature’s maximum hit points, vulnerability to thunder damage, and immunity to poison damage. The soul can dimly see and hear its surroundings, and creatures with telepathy can communicate with the soul. If the doll is destroyed, the soul arises from the doll as a Shadow under the mother’s control. The creature can’t be returned to life unless its soul is freed from the doll by a Wish spell, or by destroying the shadow it spawned.

Death’s Shroud.name: Death’s Shroud
Death’s Shroud.description: The mother is always &Reference[Invisible apply=false]. Blindsight, truesight, and other effects that allow a creature to see &Reference[Invisible apply=false] creatures don’t reveal the mother. A creature that has been reduced to 0 hit points at least once in its life can see her normally.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The mother can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. She takes 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) force damage if she ends her turn inside an object.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the mother fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The mother has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Steadfast Matron.name: Steadfast Matron
Steadfast Matron.description: Undead creatures of the mother’s choice within 60 feet of her (excluding herself) have advantage on saving throws. She can’t use this trait if she is &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false].

Undeniable Guilt.name: Undeniable Guilt
Undeniable Guilt.description: At the start of her turn, if the mother can see a possession once owned by her living children, or if she can see or hear the spirits of her children, she becomes &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] until the start of her next turn, and she must move as far from the object or spirits as possible.

UzPMKkoHuofBeXO2.name: Chimera
UzPMKkoHuofBeXO2.description: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+7 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

Claws.name: Claws
Claws.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+7 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

Fire Breath.name: Fire Breath
Fire Breath.description: The dragon head exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 (7d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The chimera makes three attacks: one with its bite, one with its horns, and one with its claws. When its fire breath is available, it can use the breath in place of its bite or horns.

Horns.name: Horns
Horns.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+7 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

Nurse Sarah Godlee.name: Nurse Sarah Godlee
Nurse Sarah Godlee.description:
Mutant Nurse

Caregiver Twisted by Mutation

Habitat: Any

Treasure: Arcana

Mutant nurses resemble the Humanoids they once were, though an alien mutation writhes within their bodies. They serve as caretakers of healing institutions, though they are fully beholden to whoever, or whatever, altered them to their current state. The nurses all wear a white porcelain mask made in the likeness of their original features, which grounds them to their sense of self and prevents them from losing their will fully to the aberrant influence that changed them.

Secret. Mutant nurses go berserk if their masks are destroyed or taken from them, or they become unresponsive if there are no other creatures nearby.

Anchoring Mask.name: Anchoring Mask
Anchoring Mask.description: The nurse has a porcelain mask (AC 15; HP 15; Immunity to Poison and Psychic damage). If the nurse starts its turn and isn’t wearing its mask, it must move as far as possible to retrieve its mask if possible, or to reach the closest creature it can see or hear, and it must attack that creature. If it can’t see or hear any other creatures, it either stands still and does nothing, or it destroys any objects in its vicinity (50 percent chance of either).

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The nurse makes two [[/item Stab]] attacks. If it hits a creature with a Stab attack, it can use Inject if available.

Stab.name: Stab
Stab.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Inject.name: Inject
Inject.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC 13, a creature the nurse hit with a Stab attack this turn.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 hour.

Failure by 5 or More: The &reference[poisoned apply=false] target also has the &reference[unconscious apply=false] condition until it takes damage or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to shake it awake.

Success: Half damage only.

Mutation.name: Mutation
Mutation.description:
The nurse has one of the following mutation action options:

  • Cerebral Graft. Part of a psionic creature’s brain is grafted to the nurse’s own.

    Intelligence Saving Throw: DC 13, one creature within 30 feet.

    Failure: 11 ([[/r 2d10]]) Psychic damage, and the target has the &reference[stunned apply=false]condition until the end of its next turn.

    Success: Half damage only.

  • Tentacle Lash. A tentacle writhes beneath the nurse’s skin or clothes.

    Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 13, each creature in a 30-foot Cone.

    Failure: 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the &reference[prone apply=false] condition.

    Success: Half damage only.

Catalyst.name: Catalyst
Catalyst.description: The nurse injects itself with a stimulant. Until the start of the nurse’s next turn, its Speed is doubled, it can make one extra Stab attack when it takes the Multiattack action, and it gains a +2 bonus to AC.

Necrolisk.name: Necrolisk
Necrolisk.description:
Necrolisk

Subterranean Spirit-Devouring Drake

Habitat: Planar (Shadow), Underground

Treasure: Individual, Relics

Necrolisks are subterranean dragons that feed on the essence of spirits. Tunneling through the ground in search of corpses, especially those buried in graveyards and crypts, they defile the graves and feed on the bodies in an effort to stir up restless spirits, which are then snared in the necrolisks’ ephemeral saliva and devoured. Creatures of flesh and blood that disturb the dragons might also find themselves as a less preferred, but passable, meal.

Secret. Necrolisks are severely allergic to a concoction of lavender, nightshade, and lilies, which causes them to vomit uncontrollably—a boon to anyone swallowed by the monsters.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The necrolisk makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and one [[/item Claws]] attack.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 15 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &reference[grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 16). Until the grapple ends, it has the &reference[restrained apply=false] condition.

Claws.name: Claws
Claws.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 10 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Ephemeral Spit.name: Ephemeral Spit
Ephemeral Spit.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 16, each creature in a 60-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[restrained apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Swallow.name: Swallow
Swallow.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 18, one Large or smaller creature &reference[grappled apply=false] by the necrolisk (the necrolisk can only have one creature swallowed at a time).

Failure: The necrolisk swallows the target, which is no longer Grappled. While swallowed, the creature has the &reference[blinded apply=false] and &reference[restrained apply=false] conditions, has Total Cover against attacks and other effects outside the necrolisk, and takes [[/damage average]]damage at the start of each of the necrolisk’s turns.

If the necrolisk takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the necrolisk must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls in a space within 10 feet of the necrolisk and has the &reference[prone apply=false] condition.

If the necrolisk dies, a swallowed creature is no longer Restrained and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting &reference[prone apply=false].

Entrapping Saliva.name: Entrapping Saliva
Entrapping Saliva.description: The necrolisk ignores Immunity to the &reference[grappled apply=false] and &reference[restrained apply=false] conditions of a creature with the Incorporeal Movement trait. Creatures swallowed by the necrolisk can’t pass through it using Incorporeal Movement or through the Ethereal Plane, and creatures can’t teleport out of its stomach.

Herb Allergy.name: Herb Allergy
Herb Allergy.description: If the necrolisk eats a specific concoction of herbs worth 25 GP (such as if a swallowed creature pours them into its stomach as a Utilize action), at the end of the turn, the necrolisk regurgitates anything in its stomach as if it failed the saving throw described in its Swallow Bonus Action.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The necrolisk can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Tunneler.name: Tunneler
Tunneler.description: The necrolisk can burrow through solid rock at half its Burrow Speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

Crocodile.name: Crocodile
Crocodile.description: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+4 to hit,, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

The target is grappled (escape DC 12). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the crocodile can't bite another target.

Hold Breath.name: Hold Breath
Hold Breath.description: The crocodile can hold its breath for 15 minutes.
