Dream eaters are horrors that feed on the dreams, sense of identity, and—some say—the very souls of other creatures. Dream eaters have the bodies and wings of great owls, while their beaks are filled with blunt, humanlike teeth and hide long snaking tongues. Their feathers are drab colors on the exterior, but their wings display a dazzling cascade of rainbow hues on the undersides when unfurled.

These colors flow and shift, mesmerizing the dream eater’s prey and leaving them helpless. A creature whose dreams are devoured is left in a listless, near-blank state. Without help, their victims waste away.

Secret. Dream eaters are confused by the intricate patterns on moth wings, and it disrupts their own colorful hypnosis.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The dream eater makes two [[/item Talons]] attacks and can use Devour Dreams.

Talons.name: Talons
Talons.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is &Reference[Grappled apply=false] (escape DC 14) from one of two talons, and it is &Reference[Restrained apply=false] until the grapple ends.

Devour Dreams.name: Devour Dreams
Devour Dreams.description: The dream eater unfurls its tongue and devours the dreams of a creature it is grappling, or an &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] creature within 5 feet of it. The target must make a DC 16 Charisma saving throw. &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] targets fail the save automatically. On a failed save, the target takes 18 ([[/r 4d8]]) psychic damage, and its Charisma score decreases by 1d6. A creature reduced to 0 Charisma by this effect becomes &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] until its mind is restored with a Greater Restoration, Heal, or Wish spell. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until it finishes a long rest. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

Hypnotic Wings.name: Hypnotic Wings
Hypnotic Wings.description: The dream eater’s wings shine with dazzling rainbow colors until the start of its next turn, emitting bright light in a 30-foot radius from the dream eater and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Each other creature within the bright light that can see the dream eater must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] until the start of the dream eater’s next turn. While &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] in this way, the target’s speed is reduced to 0.

Flyby.name: Flyby
Flyby.description: The dream eater doesn’t provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

Moth Ward.name: Moth Ward
Moth Ward.description: A creature holding a moth’s wing automatically succeeds on saving throws against the dream eater’s Hypnotic Wings.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The dream eater can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

nb9XWuiJS6wzHpqX.name: Keeper of the Blight
nb9XWuiJS6wzHpqX.description:
Keeper of the Blight

Druid Transformed by Blight

Habitat: Forest, Swamp, Underground

Treasure: Relics

Keepers of the blight arise from Fey beings that dwell in a natural region that becomes overtaken by a supernatural or spiritual rot. Where they once tended the balance and cycles of their home, keepers are consumed by the blight and channel their magic through fungus, mold, and rot, pushing the cycle of life toward death, decay, and the flourishing of things that thrive in gloom.

Secret. The fungus growing throughout keepers of the blight empowers and sustains them, and killing that growth diminishes their power.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
Spellcasting. The keeper casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDruidcraft]{Druidcraft}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplRayofSickn]{Ray of Sickness}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBlight0000]{Blight}

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The keeper makes two attacks, using [[/item Blight Staff]] or [[/item Spore Spray]] in any combination, and it uses Rotting Ritual.

Blight Staff.name: Blight Staff
Blight Staff.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Spore Spray.name: Spore Spray
Spore Spray.description: Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], range 60 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a creature, it has the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of the keeper’s next turn.

Rotting Ritual.name: Rotting Ritual
Rotting Ritual.description:
The keeper magically creates one of the following effects of its choice. It can’t use the same effect twice in a row.

  • Frenzying Spores. Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 16, a creature the keeper can see within 30 feet.

    Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target must immediately take a Reaction to make a melee or ranged attack against a creature of the keeper’s choice that is within reach or range of the attack.

    Success: Half damage only.

  • Blight Spawn. The keeper magically summons a Rotweaver (lacks a Hunting Horn) in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of itself. The rotweaver takes its turn immediately after the keeper on the same Initiative count, and it obeys the keeper. The rotweaver vanishes after 1 minute, or when it or the keeper dies.

  • Devouring Fungus. Life-sapping fungus sprouts from the ground in a 60-foot radius centered on the keeper. The area is Difficult Terrain, and a creature has the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition while within the area. The fungus remains for 1 minute, until the keeper uses this effect again, or until it dies.

Blight Dependent.name: Blight Dependent
Blight Dependent.description: If the keeper is targeted by an effect that ends the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition, it takes [[/damage average]] damage and has Disadvantage on D20 Tests until the end of its next turn.

Fungal Step.name: Fungal Step
Fungal Step.description: The keeper ignores Difficult Terrain caused by plants or fungi.

Druidcraft.name: Druidcraft
Druidcraft.description:
Whispering to the spirits of nature, you create one of the following effects within range.

Weather Sensor. You create a Tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden orb for clear skies, a cloud for rain, falling snowflakes for snow, and so on. This effect persists for 1 round.

Bloom. You instantly make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom.

Sensory Effect. You create a harmless sensory effect, such as falling leaves, spectral dancing fairies, a gentle breeze, the sound of an animal, or the faint odor of skunk. The effect must fit in a 5-foot Cube.

Fire Play. You light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a campfire.

Ray of Sickness.name: Ray of Sickness
Ray of Sickness.description:
You shoot a greenish ray at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 2d8 Poison damage and has the &Reference[poisoned] condition until the end of your next turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

Blight.name: Blight
Blight.description:
A creature that you can see within range makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 8d8 Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A Plant creature automatically fails the save.

Alternatively, target a nonmagical plant that isn't a creature, such as a tree or shrub. It doesn't make a save; it simply withers and dies.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 4.

Hypnovulfen.name: Hypnovulfen
Hypnovulfen.description:
Hypnovulfen

Hungry Hypnotizing Wolf

Habitat: Forest, Hill

Treasure: Individual

Hypnovulfen resemble massive wolves with unnaturally large orange eyes and wide, crooked maws. Despite their size, hypnovulfen are shockingly stealthy, able to stalk their prey and snare them with a hypnotic gaze from the shadows. The gaze beguiles victims into seeing a loved one beckoning them closer for a warm embrace. All the better for a hypnovulfen to feed and consume the unfortunate morsel’s memories.

Secret. Hypnovulfen have no power to mesmerize anyone holding a keepsake or memento received from a loved one, as it overpowers the false beckoning of the monster’s gaze.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The hypnovulfen makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and one [[/item Claw]] attack, and it can use Swallow.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &reference[grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 17), and it has the &reference[restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &reference[prone apply=false] condition.

Swallow.name: Swallow
Swallow.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC 20, one Medium or smaller creature &reference[grappled apply=false] by the hypnovulfen (the hypnovulfen can have only one creature swallowed at a time).

Failure: The hypnovulfen swallows the target, which is no longer Grappled. While swallowed, a creature has the &reference[blinded apply=false] and &reference[restrained apply=false] conditions, has Total Cover against attacks and other effects outside the hypnovulfen, and takes [[/damage average]] damage at the start of each of the hypnovulfen’s turns. If the creature dies from this damage, the hypnovulfen absorbs its memories and regains 25 Hit Points.

If the hypnovulfen takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the hypnovulfen must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls in a space within 10 feet of the hypnovulfen and has the &reference[prone apply=false] condition.

If the hypnovulfen dies, a swallowed creature is no longer Restrained and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting &reference[prone apply=false].

Hypnotic Gaze.name: Hypnotic Gaze
Hypnotic Gaze.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 19, each creature in a 30-foot Cone. A creature holding a keepsake from a loved one succeeds automatically.

Failure: The creature has the &reference[charmed apply=false] condition until it takes damage. While charmed, it has the Incapacitated condition and must move as close to the hypnovulfen as possible by the safest route. The creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The hypnovulfen has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

o30xGteMCeHNfXTF.name: The Vermintoll Abomination
o30xGteMCeHNfXTF.description:
The Vermintoll Abomination

Verminous Coven Amalgamation

Habitat: Forest, Planar (Fey), Mountain, Urban

The magic that binds hag covens together is far more powerful than many spellcasters can fully comprehend. Vermintoll abominations come about when the magics of a centipede hag, a pigeon hag, and a weasel hag enmesh and fuse the witches into one mass, bound to their cauldron.

The Vermintoll Abomination’s Lair

The Vermintoll Abomination’s lair is a decrepit hideaway, often hidden in plain sight such as an attic, basement, or a seized home.

The region containing the Vermintoll Abomination’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Endless Vermin. Within 1 mile of the lair, centipedes, weasels, (including giant varieties of both), and pigeons (use the Raven stat block) are common nuisances. They steal Tiny objects and foul food.

Loyal Dwelling. The lair itself, including any greater structure or complex it resides within, rejects intruders. Ability checks to pick locks or find secret doors have disadvantage.

If the Vermintoll Abomination dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The abomination casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18):

At will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHypnoticPa]{Hypnotic Pattern}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplContagion0]{Contagion}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDream00000]{Dream}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDominatePe]{Dominate Person}

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The abomination makes three attacks, using [[/item Cauldron Slam]] or [[/item Brew Spray]] in any combination.

Cauldron Slam.name: Cauldron Slam
Cauldron Slam.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Brew Spray.name: Brew Spray
Brew Spray.description: Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], range 90 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target takes a −2 penalty to AC until the end of the abomination’s next turn.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The abomination can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The abomination regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Corrosive Teleport.name: Corrosive Teleport
Corrosive Teleport.description:
The abomination teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 18, each creature in a 10-foot Emanation originating from the abomination at its destination space.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Hag’s Head.name: Hag’s Head
Hag’s Head.description:
The abomination uses one of the following options (if the necessary head is alive); it can’t use that option again until the start of its next turn:

Contagious Miasma (Centipede Hag Head).

  • Constitution Saving Throw: DC 18, one creature the abomination can see within 5 feet.

  • Failure: The target takes [[/damage 3d8 poison]]{13 (3d8) Poison} damage and has the &reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition. While Poisoned, it can’t regain Hit Points. The target repeats the saving throw when it finishes a Long Rest, ending the effect on itself on a success.

  • Success: Half damage only.

Overwhelming Doubt (Pigeon Hag Head).

  • Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 18, one creature the abomination can see within 30 feet.

  • Failure: [[/damage 3d6 psychic]]{10 (3d6) Psychic} damage, and the target has the &reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

  • Success: Half damage only.

Waking Nightmare (Weasel Hag Head).

  • Charisma Saving Throw: DC 18, one creature the abomination can see within 30 feet.

  • Failure: [[/damage 2d10 psychic]]{11 (2d10) Psychic} damage, and the target has the &reference[Frightened apply=false] condition. While Frightened, the target perceives its allies as enemies but isn’t compelled to act in a specific way. The target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

  • Success: Half damage only.

Crushing Leap.name: Crushing Leap
Crushing Leap.description:
The abomination jumps to a space within 30 feet that contains one or more Large or smaller creatures.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature in the abomination’s destination space.

Failure: [[/damage average]] Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the &reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Success: Half damage only, and the target is pushed 5 feet straight away from the abomination.

Failure or Success: The abomination can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: The Vermintoll Abomination’s lair is a decrepit hideaway, often hidden in plain sight such as an attic, basement, or a seized home. The region containing the Vermintoll Abomination’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects: If the Vermintoll Abomination dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Endless Vermin.name: Endless Vermin
Endless Vermin.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, centipedes, weasels, (including giant varieties of both), and pigeons (use the Raven stat block) are common nuisances. They steal Tiny objects and foul food.

Loyal Dwelling.name: Loyal Dwelling
Loyal Dwelling.description: The lair itself, including any greater structure or complex it resides within, rejects intruders. Ability checks to pick locks or find secret doors have disadvantage.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the abomination fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The abomination has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiple Heads.name: Multiple Heads
Multiple Heads.description: The abomination has three heads: a centipede hag’s, a pigeon hag’s, and a weasel hag’s. Whenever the abomination takes 50 damage or more on a single turn, one of its heads dies (determined randomly). The abomination dies if all its heads are dead. At the end of each of its turns, if it has at least 1 Hit Point and any of its heads are dead, the abomination regains 20 Hit Points and one of its dead heads returns to life.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Hypnotic Pattern.name: Hypnotic Pattern
Hypnotic Pattern.description:
You create a twisting pattern of colors in a 30-foot Cube within range. The pattern appears for a moment and vanishes. Each creature in the area who can see the pattern must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. While Charmed, the creature has the &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition and a Speed of 0.

The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

Hypnotized.name: Hypnotized
Hypnotized.description:
While &Reference[charmed apply=false], the creature has the &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition and a Speed of 0.

The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

Contagion.name: Contagion
Contagion.description:
Your touch inflicts a magical contagion. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 11d8 Necrotic damage and have the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition. Also, choose one ability when you cast the spell. While Poisoned, the target has Disadvantage on saving throws made with the chosen ability.

The target must repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns until it gets three successes or failures. If the target succeeds on three of these saves, the spell ends on the target. If the target fails three of the saves, the spell lasts for 7 days on it.

Whenever the Poisoned target receives an effect that would end the Poisoned condition, the target must succeed on a [[/save ability=con dc=@attributes.spell.dc format=long]], or the Poisoned condition doesn't end on it.

Infected (Strength).name: Infected (Strength)
Infected (Strength).description:
• While &Reference[Poisoned apply=false], the target has Disadvantage on saving throws made with the chosen ability.

  • The target must repeat the [[/save ability=con format=long]] at the end of each of its turns until it gets three successes or failures.

  • Whenever the target receives an effect that would end the Poisoned condition, the target must succeed on a [[/save ability=con format=long]], or the condition doesn’t end on it.

Infected (Dexterity).name: Infected (Dexterity)
Infected (Dexterity).description:
• While &Reference[Poisoned apply=false], the target has Disadvantage on saving throws made with the chosen ability.

  • The target must repeat the [[/save ability=con format=long]] at the end of each of its turns until it gets three successes or failures.

  • Whenever the target receives an effect that would end the Poisoned condition, the target must succeed on a [[/save ability=con format=long]], or the condition doesn’t end on it.

Infected (Constitution).name: Infected (Constitution)
Infected (Constitution).description:
• While &Reference[Poisoned apply=false], the target has Disadvantage on saving throws made with the chosen ability.

  • The target must repeat the [[/save ability=con format=long]] at the end of each of its turns until it gets three successes or failures.

  • Whenever the target receives an effect that would end the Poisoned condition, the target must succeed on a [[/save ability=con format=long]], or the condition doesn’t end on it.

Infected (Intelligence).name: Infected (Intelligence)
Infected (Intelligence).description:
• While &Reference[Poisoned apply=false], the target has Disadvantage on saving throws made with the chosen ability.

  • The target must repeat the [[/save ability=con format=long]] at the end of each of its turns until it gets three successes or failures.

  • Whenever the target receives an effect that would end the Poisoned condition, the target must succeed on a [[/save ability=con format=long]], or the condition doesn’t end on it.

Infected (Wisdom).name: Infected (Wisdom)
Infected (Wisdom).description:
• While &Reference[Poisoned apply=false], the target has Disadvantage on saving throws made with the chosen ability.

  • The target must repeat the [[/save ability=con format=long]] at the end of each of its turns until it gets three successes or failures.

  • Whenever the target receives an effect that would end the Poisoned condition, the target must succeed on a [[/save ability=con format=long]], or the condition doesn’t end on it.

Infected (Charisma).name: Infected (Charisma)
Infected (Charisma).description:
• While &Reference[Poisoned apply=false], the target has Disadvantage on saving throws made with the chosen ability.

  • The target must repeat the [[/save ability=con format=long]] at the end of each of its turns until it gets three successes or failures.

  • Whenever the target receives an effect that would end the Poisoned condition, the target must succeed on a [[/save ability=con format=long]], or the condition doesn’t end on it.

Dream.name: Dream
Dream.description:
You target a creature you know on the same plane of existence. You or a willing creature you touch enters a trance state to act as a dream messenger. While in the trance, the messenger is &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] and has a Speed of 0.

If the target is asleep, the messenger appears in the target's dreams and can converse with the target as long as it remains asleep, through the spell's duration. The messenger can also shape the dream's environment, creating landscapes, objects, and other images. The messenger can emerge from the trance at any time, ending the spell. The target recalls the dream perfectly upon waking.

If the target is awake when you cast the spell, the messenger knows it and can either end the trance (and the spell) or wait for the target to sleep, at which point the messenger enters its dreams.

You can make the messenger terrifying to the target. If you do so, the messenger can deliver a message of no more than ten words, and then the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains no benefit from its rest, and it takes 3d6 Psychic damage when it wakes up.

Trance State.name: Trance State
Trance State.description: While in the trance, the messenger is Incapacitated and has a Speed of 0.

Dominate Person.name: Dominate Person
Dominate Person.description:
One Humanoid you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. The target has Advantage on the save if you or your allies are fighting it. Whenever the target takes damage, it repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

You have a telepathic link with the Charmed target while the two of you are on the same plane of existence. On your turn, you can use this link to issue commands to the target (no action required), such as "Attack that creature," "Move over there," or "Fetch that object." The target does its best to obey on its turn. If it completes an order and doesn't receive further direction from you, it acts and moves as it likes, focusing on protecting itself.

You can command the target to take a Reaction but must take your own Reaction to do so.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. Your Concentration can last longer with a spell slot of level 6 (up to 10 minutes), 7 (up to 1 hour), or 8+ (up to 8 hours).

Dominated.name: Dominated
Dominated.description: Whenever the &Reference[charmed apply=false] target takes damage, it repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Nameless Thing.name: Nameless Thing
Nameless Thing.description:
Nameless Thing

Unknowable Lifeform from Beyond (Meteorite fragments)

Habitat: Any

Nameless things are alien minds bound into physical vessels, most often diminutive animals, objects, or pieces of monsters. These creatures can creep into the world when outer influence seeps into existence but are usually deliberately invited.

Psychic Strike.name: Psychic Strike
Psychic Strike.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and if the target is a creature, it is &Reference[Frightened apply=false] until the start of the nameless thing’s next turn.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description: The nameless thing casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.1N8dDMMgZ1h1YJ3B] on itself, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability. When it casts the spell, the nameless thing can extend the effect of the spell to a creature it is touching. The spell ends early if either creature breaks the spell on itself or if the nameless thing stops touching the other creature. Once the nameless thing extends the spell in this way, it can’t do so again until it finishes a long rest.

Flyby.name: Flyby
Flyby.description: The nameless thing doesn’t provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

lreOluzngLGVgfTI.name: Invisibility
lreOluzngLGVgfTI.description:
A creature you touch becomes invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is invisible as long as it is on the target's person. The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

materials.value: An eyelash encased in gum arabic

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description: The target becomes Invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is invisible as long as it is on the target's person. The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell.

Bandit Captain.name: Bandit Captain
Bandit Captain.description: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The captain makes three melee attacks: two with its scimitar and one with its dagger. Or the captain makes two ranged attacks with its daggers.

Scimitar.name: Scimitar
Scimitar.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+5 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

Dagger.name: Dagger
Dagger.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description: The captain adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the captain must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

Club.name: Club
Club.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Training.name: Training
Training.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has proficiency in one skill of the DM's choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

Hooves.name: Hooves
Hooves.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature and the horse moved 20+ feet straight toward it immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 5 (2d4) Bludgeoning damage and has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

pKn09bHD15MXTopk.name: Salmon of Knowledge
pKn09bHD15MXTopk.description:
Salmon of Knowledge

Elemental Font of Wisdom (Crushed opal)

Habitat: Coastal, Planar (Elemental Plane of Water), Underwater

Legends speak of the salmon of knowledge—shimmering fish said to embody the wisdom of the ages. Their scales gleam with an iridescent light, and they are forever enveloped in a sphere of gently flowing water that defies gravity. This magical orb is said to carry the essence of the sacred Current of Wisdom—where knowledge of all time and space flows through the rivers of the cosmos.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The salmon makes two [[/item Water Spray]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Prophetic Guidance]].

Water Spray.name: Water Spray
Water Spray.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Prophetic Guidance.name: Prophetic Guidance
Prophetic Guidance.description: A creature the salmon can see within 30 feet gains a flash of foresight. Once in the next minute, when the creature fails an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, it can roll [[/r 1d4]] and add it to the total, potentially turning the failure into a success.

Echo From The Current.name: Echo From The Current
Echo From The Current.description: When a creature within 5 feet of the salmon makes an Intelligence or Wisdom check, the creature can use the salmon’s Wisdom modifier (+4) in place of its own ability modifier for the check.

Orb Of Water.name: Orb Of Water
Orb Of Water.description: The salmon is surrounded by a sphere of flowing water that moves with it. While inside of the sphere, the salmon has resistance to fire damage. A creature that grapples the salmon can choose to pull it out of the orb of water. The orb of water moves up to 20 feet toward the salmon at the start of each of the salmon’s turns. If it enters the salmon’s space, the grapple ends on the salmon.

pPMyLBkOyyBLfWIa.name: Martha Langtree
pPMyLBkOyyBLfWIa.description:
Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Club.name: Club
Club.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+2 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

Bloodied Frenzy.name: Bloodied Frenzy
Bloodied Frenzy.description: While &Reference[Bloodied], the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on attack rolls and saving throws.

phL4pDn8A6V5RDN2.name: The Ghostlight Locomotive
phL4pDn8A6V5RDN2.description:
The Ghostlight Locomotive

Corrupted Ghost Train

Habitat: Any

The Ghostlight Locomotive is the engine of a phantom train that travels unseen between the realms of life and death, ferrying souls of the dead to their afterlife. During its normal operation, the locomotive burns doomed spirits for fuel and races along spectral, misty rails that appear as it travels, and it has little awareness beyond its crucial task.

Only a drastic event, such as the corruption of its soul-made fuel source, can turn the Ghostlight Locomotive from its endless duty, whereupon it stokes a consciousness of the innumerable souls it has burned and vents the fury of the damned upon any obstacles in its path. When pressed, the residue of wicked souls left from the burning of its corrupted fuel overwhelms the engine’s amoral nature, driving it to malevolent and hateful destruction.

The Ghostlight Locomotive’s Lair

The Ghostlight Locomotive’s lair is a 1-mile-radius shrouding mist originating from the locomotive. This mist doesn’t extend within the cars of the Ghostight Express that the locomotive pulls.

The region containing the Ghostlight Locomotive’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Ghastly Shroud. When a creature that isn’t Undead finishes a short or long rest within 1 mile of the locomotive, the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or any time it regains hit points, it only regains half the amount. This effect ends when the creature next finishes a long rest or receives a Lesser Restoration spell or similar magic.

Spirit Calling. Within 1 mile of the locomotive, hostile Shrouded* and Specters are abundant and drawn to any creature that attacks the Ghostlight Locomotive or that tries to keep pace with, climb, or enter the Ghostlight Express.

If the Ghostlight Locomotive dies, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack (Crooked Switch Only).name: Multiattack (Crooked Switch Only)
Multiattack (Crooked Switch Only).description: The locomotive makes two [[/item Rail Slam]] attacks.

Rail Slam.name: Rail Slam
Rail Slam.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target is pushed up to 10 feet straight away.

Spirit Exhaust.name: Spirit Exhaust
Spirit Exhaust.description: The locomotive spews spiritual smoke in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The locomotive can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The locomotive regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Ghostly Rails.name: Ghostly Rails
Ghostly Rails.description: The locomotive moves up to half its speed in a straight line without provoking opportunity attacks. A Large or smaller creature whose space it passes through is &Reference[Grappled apply=false] (escape DC 14) from the spectral rails.

Haunting Whistle.name: Haunting Whistle
Haunting Whistle.description: The locomotive blows its wailing steam whistle. One creature within 30 feet that can hear the whistle must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or take 4 ([[/r 1d8]]) psychic damage and be &Reference[Frightened apply=false] until the end of its next turn.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: The Ghostlight Locomotive’s lair is a 1-mile-radius shrouding mist originating from the locomotive. This mist doesn’t extend within the cars of the Ghostight Express that the locomotive pulls. The region containing the Ghostlight Locomotive’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects: If the Ghostlight Locomotive dies, these effects end immediately.

Ghastly Shroud.name: Ghastly Shroud
Ghastly Shroud.description: When a creature that isn’t Undead finishes a short or long rest within 1 mile of the locomotive, the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or any time it regains hit points, it only regains half the amount. This effect ends when the creature next finishes a long rest or receives a Lesser Restoration spell or similar magic.

Spirit Calling.name: Spirit Calling
Spirit Calling.description: Within 1 mile of the locomotive, hostile Shrouded* and Specters are abundant and drawn to any creature that attacks the Ghostlight Locomotive or that tries to keep pace with, climb, or enter the Ghostlight Express.

Crooked Switch.name: Crooked Switch
Crooked Switch.description: When the locomotive has half its hit points or fewer, it regains all expended uses of Legendary Resistance and enters a malevolent form for 12 hours. In this form, it is chaotic evil and can use its Multiattack action.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the locomotive fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Flesh Golem.name: Flesh Golem
Flesh Golem.description: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Berserk.name: Berserk
Berserk.description:
Whenever the golem starts its turn with 40 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see.

If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points. The golem's creator, if within 60 feet of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a DC 15 Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 40 hit points or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

Aversion of Fire.name: Aversion of Fire
Aversion of Fire.description: If the golem takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

Immutable Form.name: Immutable Form
Immutable Form.description: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The golem makes two slam attacks.

Slam.name: Slam
Slam.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+7 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

pudxHvSCpjwLixvd.name: The Lord of Fools
pudxHvSCpjwLixvd.description:
The Lord of Fools

Fiendish Master of Revels

Habitat: Planar (Lower Planes), Urban

The Lord of Fools is the embodiment of revelry, cherishing amusement at any cost. He most often leads a procession of revelers of song, revelers of stories, and heralds of fools, compelling townsfolk and travelers to join their celebration to the exclusion of all other concerns. Many of these celebrants dance, drink, and make merry until they drop—sometimes dead! The Lord of Fools laughs all the louder and longer at their demise.

Secret. The Lord of Fools thrives on laughter and amusement, so when someone doesn’t react accordingly to one of his japes, he becomes enraged at that creature to the exclusion of others.

The Lord of Fools’ Lair

The Lord of Fools’ lair is the Fool’s Revel carnival.

The region containing the Lord of Fools’ lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Empty Treats. Within 1 mile of the lair, carnival snack food is abundant even in unlikely places. The food is delicious but offers no sustenance. A creature that eats the food can’t feel the effects of starvation (though they still suffer the effects of going without food) for 24 hours.

Pratfalls. Within 1 mile of the lair, ability checks or saving throws made to avoid being knocked prone have disadvantage.

If the Lord of Fools dies or moves his lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The lord casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 19):

At Will: Hideous Laughter, Project Image (appears as a Small Humanoid jester), Vicious Mockery (4d6 Psychic damage)

1/Day Each: Irresistible Dance, Magnificent Mansion

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The lord makes two attacks, using [[/item Ribbon]] or [[/item Joy Buzzer]] in any combination. If the lord has cast Project Image, he can make melee [[/item Joy Buzzer]] attacks from the image’s space.

Ribbon.name: Ribbon
Ribbon.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 15 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 15) from one of six ribbons. It has the &reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Joy Buzzer.name: Joy Buzzer
Joy Buzzer.description:
The lord’s Infinite Jest illusion moves to a target within range.

Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target can’t take Reactions until the end of the lord’s next turn.

Hit or Miss: The jester vanishes and reappears in the lord’s space.

Exploding Pie.name: Exploding Pie
Exploding Pie.description:
The lord throws a massive pie that explodes in corrosive custard.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 18, each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point the lord can see within 100 feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[Blinded apply=false] condition until the end of the lord’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The lord can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The lord regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

Frolic.name: Frolic
Frolic.description: The lord moves up to half his Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks, during which he can move through other creature’s spaces without expending extra movement to do so. A creature whose space the lord enters takes [[/damage average]] damage. A creature takes this damage only once per turn.

Joke’s on You.name: Joke’s on You
Joke’s on You.description: The lord uses Spellcasting to cast either @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplOttosIrres]{Irresistible Dance} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplViciousMoc]{Vicious Mockery}.

Ribbon Dance.name: Ribbon Dance
Ribbon Dance.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC 18, each creature the lord is grappling.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Failure or Success: The lord can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: The Lord of Fools’ lair is the Fool’s Revel carnival. The region containing the Lord of Fools’ lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects: If the Lord of Fools dies or moves his lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Empty Treats.name: Empty Treats
Empty Treats.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, carnival snack food is abundant even in unlikely places. The food is delicious but offers no sustenance. A creature that eats the food can’t feel the effects of starvation (though they still suffer the effects of going without food) for 24 hours.

Pratfalls.name: Pratfalls
Pratfalls.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, ability checks or saving throws made to avoid being knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false] have disadvantage.

Ribbon Step.name: Ribbon Step
Ribbon Step.description: The lord vanishes in a burst of confetti and ribbons and teleports to an unoccupied space he can see within 30 feet.

Bitter Medicine.name: Bitter Medicine
Bitter Medicine.description: As a Bonus Action, a creature can dismiss or belittle the lord’s attempts at humor. If the creature succeeds on a DC 16 Charisma (Deception) check, the lord has Disadvantage on attack rolls against any target other than that creature until the start of the creature’s next turn.

Infinite Jest.name: Infinite Jest
Infinite Jest.description: The lord creates an illusion of a Small Humanoid jester in his space. While he doesn’t have the &reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition, the lord can move the image up to 60 feet during his turn (no action required). The lord can perceive and speak through this image as if he were in the image’s space. The image is insubstantial, but it can manipulate objects as if it has a Strength of 10.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the lord fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

Reactive.name: Reactive
Reactive.description: The lord can take one Reaction on every turn of combat.

Hideous Laughter.name: Hideous Laughter
Hideous Laughter.description:
One creature of your choice that you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it has the &Reference[prone apply=false] and &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] conditions for the duration. During that time, it laughs uncontrollably if it's capable of laughter, and it can't end the Prone condition on itself.

At the end of each of its turns and each time it takes damage, it makes another [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] saving throw. The target has Advantage on the save if the save is triggered by damage. On a successful save, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level about 1.

Uncontrollable Laughter.name: Uncontrollable Laughter
Uncontrollable Laughter.description:
has the &Reference[prone apply=false] and &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] conditions for the duration. During that time, it laughs uncontrollably if it’s capable of laughter, and it can’t end the Prone condition on itself.

At the end of each of its turns and each time it takes damage, it makes another [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] saving throw. The target has Advantage on the save if the save is triggered by damage. On a successful save, the spell ends.

Project Image.name: Project Image
Project Image.description:
You create an illusory copy of yourself that lasts for the duration. The copy can appear at any location within range that you have seen before, regardless of intervening obstacles. The illusion looks and sounds like you, but it is intangible. If the illusion takes any damage, it disappears, and the spell ends.

You can see through the illusion's eyes and hear through its ears as if you were in its space. As a Magic action, you can move it up to 60 feet and make it gesture, speak, and behave in whatever way you choose. It mimics your mannerisms perfectly.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be illusory, since things can pass through it. A creature that takes the Study action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and any noise it makes sounds hollow to the creature.

materials.value: a statuette of yourself worth 5+ GP

Vicious Mockery.name: Vicious Mockery
Vicious Mockery.description:
You unleash a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at one creature you can see or hear within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 1d6 Psychic damage and have Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d6 when you reach levels 5 (2d6), 11 (3d6), and 17 (4d6).

Mocked.name: Mocked
Mocked.description: The target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

Irresistible Dance.name: Irresistible Dance
Irresistible Dance.description:
One creature that you can see within range must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the target dances comically until the end of its next turn, during which it must spend all its movement to dance in place.

On a failed save, the target has the Charmed condition for the duration. While Charmed, the target dances comically, must use all its movement to dance in place, and has Disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws and attack rolls, and other creatures have Advantage on attack rolls against it. On each of its turns, the target can take an action to collect itself and repeat the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Irresistible Dance.name: Irresistible Dance
Irresistible Dance.description: While &Reference[Charmed apply=false], the target dances comically, must use all its movement to dance in place, and has Disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws and attack rolls, and other creatures have Advantage on attack rolls against it. On each of its turns, the target can take an action to collect itself and repeat the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Short Dance.name: Short Dance
Short Dance.description: The target dances comically until the end of its next turn, during which it must spend all its movement to dance in place.

Magnificent Mansion.name: Magnificent Mansion
Magnificent Mansion.description:
You conjure a shimmering door in range that lasts for the duration. The door leads to an extradimensional dwelling and is 5 feet wide and 10 feet tall. You and any creature you designate when you cast the spell can enter the extradimensional dwelling as long as the door remains open. You can open or close it (no action required) if you are within 30 feet of it. While closed, the door is imperceptible.

Beyond the door is a magnificent foyer with numerous chambers beyond. The dwelling's atmosphere is clean, fresh, and warm.

You can create any floor plan you like for the dwelling, but it can't exceed 50 contiguous 10-foot Cubes. The place is furnished and decorated as you choose. It contains sufficient food to serve a nine-course banquet for up to 100 people. Furnishings and other objects created by this spell dissipate into smoke if removed from it.

A staff of 100 near-transparent servants attends all who enter. You determine the appearance of these servants and their attire. They are invulnerable and obey your commands. Each servant can perform tasks that a human could perform, but they can't attack or take any action that would directly harm another creature. Thus the servants can fetch things, clean, mend, fold clothes, light fires, serve food, pour wine, and so on. The servants can't leave the dwelling.

When the spell ends, any creatures or objects left inside the extradimensional space are expelled into the unoccupied spaces nearest to the entrance.

Ram.name: Ram
Ram.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], or [[/damage average activity=kJRbpcMr4MaYs4JL]] damage if the goat moved 20+ feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit.

qU6bq3aePq1uwl9T.name: Necrolisk
qU6bq3aePq1uwl9T.description:
Necrolisk

Subterranean Spirit-Devouring Drake

Habitat: Planar (Shadow), Underground

Necrolisks are subterranean dragons that feed on the essence of spirits. Tunneling through the ground in search of corpses, especially those buried in graveyards and crypts, they defile the graves and feed on the bodies in an effort to stir up restless spirits, which are then snared in the necrolisks’ ephemeral saliva and devoured. Creatures of flesh and blood that disturb the dragons might also find themselves as a less preferred, but passable, meal.

Secret. Necrolisks are severely allergic to a concoction of lavender, nightshade, and lilies, which causes them to vomit uncontrollably—a boon to anyone swallowed by the monsters.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The necrolisk makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and one [[/item Claws]] attack.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is &Reference[Grappled apply=false] (escape DC 16). Until the grapple ends, it is &Reference[Restrained apply=false].

Claws.name: Claws
Claws.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Ephemeral Spit.name: Ephemeral Spit
Ephemeral Spit.description: The necrolisk sprays spectral saliva in a 60-foot-long, 5-foot-wide line. Each creature in the area must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 42 ([[/r 12d6]]) force damage and is &Reference[Restrained apply=false] until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

Swallow.name: Swallow
Swallow.description: The necrolisk makes one [[/item Bite]] attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Restrained apply=false], it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the necrolisk, and it takes 21 ([[/r 6d6]]) force damage at the start of each of the necrolisk’s turns. The necrolisk can only have one creature swallowed at a time. If the necrolisk takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the necrolisk must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls &Reference[Prone apply=false] in a space within 10 feet of the necrolisk. If the necrolisk dies, a swallowed creature is no longer &Reference[Restrained apply=false] by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting &Reference[Prone apply=false].Mutant Nurse Medium Aberration, Lawful Evil Armor Class 13 Hit Points 63 (14d8)

Entrapping Saliva.name: Entrapping Saliva
Entrapping Saliva.description: The necrolisk ignores immunity to the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] and &Reference[Restrained apply=false] conditions of a creature with the Incorporeal Movement trait. Creatures swallowed by the necrolisk can’t pass through it using Incorporeal Movement or through the Ethereal Plane, and creatures can’t teleport out of its stomach.

Herb Allergy.name: Herb Allergy
Herb Allergy.description: If the necrolisk eats a specific concoction of herbs worth 25 gp (such as if a swallowed creature pours them into its stomach as an action), at the end of the turn, the necrolisk regurgitates anything in its stomach as if it failed the saving throw described in its Swallow bonus action.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The necrolisk can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Tunneler.name: Tunneler
Tunneler.description: The necrolisk can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

qW1ISZTWxIFXukFA.name: Mori Shade
qW1ISZTWxIFXukFA.description:
Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
Leather Armor.description: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

Keen Hearing and Sight.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
Keen Hearing and Sight.description: The scout has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The scout makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

Shortsword.name: Shortsword
Shortsword.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+4 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

Longbow.name: Longbow
Longbow.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, ranged 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

Priest.name: Priest
Priest.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbarmChainShirt]{Chain Shirt}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepMace000000]{Mace}

Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .hRwqUlEyM9TjOmHy]] or [[/item .mmRadiantFlame00]] in any combination.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSpiritGuar]{Spirit Guardians}

Divine Aid.name: Divine Aid
Divine Aid.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

qetGBlnzBSQkWzbl.name: Gibbering Mouther
qetGBlnzBSQkWzbl.description: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Aberrant Ground.name: Aberrant Ground
Aberrant Ground.description:
The ground in a 10-foot radius around the mouther is doughlike difficult terrain.

Each creature that starts its turn in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn.

Gibbering.name: Gibbering
Gibbering.description:
The mouther babbles incoherently while it can see any creature and isn't incapacitated. Each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the mouther and can hear the gibbering must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn and rolls a d8 to determine what it does during its turn.

On a 1 to 4, the creature does nothing. On a 5 or 6, the creature takes no action or bonus action and uses all its movement to move in a randomly determined direction. On a 7 or 8, the creature makes a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach or does nothing if it can't make such an attack.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The gibbering mouther makes one bite attack and, if it can, uses its Blinding Spittle.

Bites.name: Bites
Bites.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+2 to hit,, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 17 (5d6) piercing damage.

If the target is Medium or smaller, it must succeed on a DC 10 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is killed by this damage, it is absorbed into the mouther.

Blinding Spittle.name: Blinding Spittle
Blinding Spittle.description:
The mouther spits a chemical glob at a point it can see within 15 feet of it. The glob explodes in a blinding flash of light on impact.

Each creature within 5 feet of the flash must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded until the end of the mouther's next turn.

qhogcHLQ0E322Qp6.name: Dingpot
qhogcHLQ0E322Qp6.description:
Dingpot

Jovial Cauldron Helper (Spices and rose quartz)

Habitat: Any

Treasure: None

Dingpots are animated objects created to assist in magical and alchemical research—or simply to help in the kitchen. Often cheerful, dingpots delight in serving up delicious meals, soothing tea, and the occasional magical draught.

Steam Spray.name: Steam Spray
Steam Spray.description: Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], range 60 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the start of the dingpot’s next turn. Being underwater doesn’t grant Resistance to this Fire damage.

Brew.name: Brew
Brew.description:
The dingpot produces a magical elixir within its vessel. The elixir remains potent for 24 hours. It can choose from the following brews:

  • Healing Draught. As a Bonus Action, a creature can drink the elixir to regain 4 ([[/r 1d6 + 1]]) Hit Points.

  • Lucky Draught. As a Bonus Action, a creature can drink the elixir to gain startling luck for 10 minutes. When the creature fails an ability check or a saving throw, it can reroll the d20 and use the new roll. Once this causes a roll to succeed, the effects of the elixir end early.

Lucky Draught.name: Lucky Draught
Lucky Draught.description: As a bonus action, a creature can drink the elixir to gain startling luck for 10 minutes. When the creature fails an ability check or a saving throw, it can reroll the d20 and use the new roll. Once this causes a roll to succeed, the effects of the elixir end early.

Boil And Bubble.name: Boil And Bubble
Boil And Bubble.description: While the dingpot doesn’t have the &reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition, it can provide enough heat to boil water within its vessel.

Otyugh.name: Otyugh
Otyugh.description: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Limited Telepathy.name: Limited Telepathy
Limited Telepathy.description: The otyugh can magically transmit simple messages and images to any creature within 120 ft. of it that can understand a language. This form of telepathy doesn't allow the receiving creature to telepathically respond.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+6 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage.

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw against disease or become poisoned until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the target must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by 5 (1d10) on a failure. The disease is cured on a success. The target dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0. This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until the disease is cured.

Tentacle.name: Tentacle
Tentacle.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+6 to hit,, 10 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) piercing damage.

If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 13) and restrained until the grapple ends. The otyugh has two tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

Tentacle Slam.name: Tentacle Slam
Tentacle Slam.description:
The otyugh slams creatures grappled by it into each other or a solid surface. Each creature must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage and be stunned until the end of the otyugh's next turn.

On a successful save, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't stunned.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The otyugh makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its tentacles.

rAQGFdLEjXhY6W0Y.name: Soulfire Stoker
rAQGFdLEjXhY6W0Y.description:
Soulfire Stoker

Engine-Born Spirit of Flame and Death

Habitat: Planar (Elemental Plane of Fire), Urban

Treasure: None

Soulfire stokers are Elemental spirits of fire who inhabit furnaces, engines, and boilers that burn bodies or souls. The resulting creature is composed of ghostly flames and steam, with swirling plates of phantom iron that resemble the engine or machine that gave it form. A crackling blend of fire and negative energy, soulfire stokers burn away souls as much as flesh.

Secret. Soulfire stokers are compelled to burn corpses they can see, so dead things can bait the spirits.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The stoker makes two [[/item Sear]] attacks.

Sear.name: Sear
Sear.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the start of the elemental’s next turn.

Spectral Steam.name: Spectral Steam
Spectral Steam.description:
The stoker unleashes a blast of glowing spectral steam.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 13, each creature in a 30-foot Cone.

Failure: For 1 minute, the target sheds Dim Light in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the &reference[invisible apply=false] condition.

Spectral Steam.name: Spectral Steam
Spectral Steam.description: The creature sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius for 1 minute, and for the duration, it can’t hide or benefit from being invisible.

Corpse Fuel.name: Corpse Fuel
Corpse Fuel.description: If the stoker can see a corpse at the start of its turn, it must move as far as possible to enter the corpse’s space and use its action to incinerate the corpse. Medium or smaller corpses are reduced to ash, and larger corpses are partially incinerated and decrease one size.

Fire Form.name: Fire Form
Fire Form.description: The stoker can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so, and it can enter a creature’s space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature’s space on a turn, that creature takes [[/damage average]] damage.

Illumination.name: Illumination
Illumination.description: The stoker sheds Dim Light in a 30-foot radius.

Soul Burn.name: Soul Burn
Soul Burn.description: At the end of each of the stoker's turns, each creature in a 5-foot Emanation originating from the stoker takes [[/damage average]] damage.

rFMEL5osbYoxsJEZ.name: Wayward Haint
rFMEL5osbYoxsJEZ.description:
Wayward Haint

Lost Soul Bound to Regret

Habitat: Any

Wayward haints are restless spirits stuck between the realms of the living and the dead. Be it a curse or an unresolved conflict from their previous life, a haint can’t rest until their unfinished business is resolved.

Haints only show hints of who they were in life, taking on a more symbolic form related to the hurt or loss they can’t let go of. They tend to repeat their monotonous actions—often imitating those performed in life or reenacting their sorrow—over and over for eternity. When provoked, they can display a volatile temper and lash out with a crushing wave of the grief and indecision that binds their spirit.

Secret. Wayward haints can be trapped in empty bottles if they’re tricked or forced to pass over one.

Draining Regret.name: Draining Regret
Draining Regret.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target gains 1 level of &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false]. This can’t raise the target’s &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level above 5, and all levels of &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] gained from this action end when the target finishes a short or long rest, or if it receives a Lesser Restoration spell or similar magic.

Bottle Trap.name: Bottle Trap
Bottle Trap.description: A haint that enters the space of an upright, empty bottle must succeed on a DC 16 Charisma saving throw or be drawn into the bottle, and a cork or stopper appears to close the bottle. The trapped haint can see and hear through the bottle out to 10 feet, and any creature in that range can hear the haint. The haint is released if the bottle breaks or another creature opens it.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The haint can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) force damage if it ends its turn inside a solid object.

The Weeping Widow.name: The Weeping Widow
The Weeping Widow.description:
The Weeping Widow

Matron of Malevolent Medicine

Habitat: Underground, Urban

Once a priestess committed to healing the sick through divine rites, the Weeping Widow abandoned the gods after a personal tragedy and turned to sinister science. Believing she knows how to best treat the suffering and make them stronger, she employs a harrowing regimen of alchemical and medical experimentation to wipe minds and alter bodies, whether the patient wants the treatment or not.

Secret. The only way to force the Weeping Widow to live up to her moniker is to remind her of the family she lost, such as her husband’s sword or portrait, which forces her to confront what she has become.

The Weeping Widow’s Lair

The Weeping Widow’s lair is the sanitorium where she conducts her horrific experiments.

The region containing the Weeping Widow’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Dulled Memories. Within 1 mile of the lair, creatures have disadvantage on Intelligence checks made to recall information related to painful or emotional memories.

Faded Dreams. Within 1 mile of the lair, creatures who sleep or trance have only vague impressions of dreams and recall no details.

If the Weeping Widow dies or moves her lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The widow makes two [[/item Injection]] attacks.

Injection.name: Injection
Injection.description:
Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a creature, it’s &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] until the end of its next turn. While &Reference[Poisoned apply=false], the target suffers one of the following effects of the widow’s choice (each option can only be used once per turn):

  • Hyperphobic Stimulant. The target becomes &Reference[Frightened apply=false]. At the start of its turn, the target must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or take the Dash action and move away from the widow by the safest and shortest available route, unless there is nowhere to move.

  • Soporific Infusion. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or its speed is halved, and on its turn, it can take either an action or a bonus action, but not both, and it can make only one attack if it takes the Attack action. A target that fails the save by 5 or more falls &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] for 1 minute, until it takes damage, or until a creature takes an action to shake it awake.

  • Thaumaturgic Inhibitor. If the target casts a spell, it must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or the spell fails, but a spell slot used to cast the spell isn’t expended.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The widow can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The widow regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

Alacrity.name: Alacrity
Alacrity.description: The widow or a creature she is riding moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

Hypertrophic Injections.name: Hypertrophic Injections
Hypertrophic Injections.description:
The widow targets herself or an ally within 5 feet and grants the target one of the following effects of her choice; she can’t target the same ally again until the start of her next turn:

  • Aggression. The target has advantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

  • Fortitude. One of the following conditions of the widow’s choice ends on the target: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, poisoned, restrained, stunned.

  • Vigor. The target regains 10 hit points.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: The Weeping Widow’s lair is the sanitorium where she conducts her horrific experiments. The region containing the Weeping Widow’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects: If the Weeping Widow dies or moves her lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Dulled Memories.name: Dulled Memories
Dulled Memories.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, creatures have disadvantage on Intelligence checks made to recall information related to painful or emotional memories.

Faded Dreams.name: Faded Dreams
Faded Dreams.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, creatures who sleep or trance have only vague impressions of dreams and recall no details.

Calculating Defense.name: Calculating Defense
Calculating Defense.description: The widow adds her Intelligence modifier to AC instead of Dexterity.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the widow fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

Reopened Memories.name: Reopened Memories
Reopened Memories.description: At the start of her turn, if the widow can see a memento of her husband or some other reminder that forces her to realize what she’s lost, she has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws and can only expend 2 uses of her Legendary Actions until the start of her next turn.

rpVeW1GIxe9pyN64.name: Reveler of Song
rpVeW1GIxe9pyN64.description:
Reveler of Song

Fiend of Music and Dance

Habitat: Planar (Lower Planes), Urban

Revelers of song are Fiends of music and abandon who turn their art against their foes in destructive reverberation. The revelers dance and play at nearly all times and are known to fly into a murderous rage if their invitations to join the celebration are spurned. A variety of revelers of song exist, depending on the type of instrument a given reveler plays. Drone revelers play the hurdy gurdy and are surrounded by an accompanying swarm of bees. Drum revelers play drums or cymbals, and the world shakes to their beat. Bell revelers play some variety of bell, chime, or gong, and the ringing overtakes all other sounds.

Secret. Revelers of song can’t accept that any creature is more skilled at an instrument than they are and so can’t refuse a musical challenge.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The reveler makes two [[/item Instrumental Blast]] attacks.

Instrumental Blast.name: Instrumental Blast
Instrumental Blast.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 90 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Infectious Rhythm (Drum Only).name: Infectious Rhythm (Drum Only)
Infectious Rhythm (Drum Only).description: The reveler plays a thrilling beat. Up to two creatures of the reveler’s choice that it can see within 30 feet must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 18 ([[/r 4d8]]) psychic damage and is affected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.TfRzwEgBHHkCc6Ql]{Irresistible Dance} spell (no &Reference[Concentration] required to maintain the spell). On a failed save, a target takes half as much damage only.

Stunning Clangor (Bell Only).name: Stunning Clangor  (Bell Only)
Stunning Clangor (Bell Only).description: The reveler rings its bell. One creature of the reveler’s choice that the reveler can see within 60 feet of itself must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 40 ([[/r 9d8]]) thunder damage and is &Reference[Stunned apply=false] until the end of the reveler’s next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

Compelled Contest.name: Compelled Contest
Compelled Contest.description: The reveler can’t refuse a contest of skill with musical instruments. As an action, a creature can make a Charisma (Performance) check using a musical instrument. The reveler must succeed on a Charisma saving throw with a DC equal to the check’s total or take 20 psychic damage and be &Reference[Stunned apply=false] until the end of the creature’s next turn.

Dancing Step.name: Dancing Step
Dancing Step.description: The reveler doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks when it leaves an enemy’s reach.

Ensemble Form.name: Ensemble Form
Ensemble Form.description: The reveler takes on a specific form: Drone, Drum, or Bell. The form determines certain traits and actions, as well as the instrument the reveler plays (hurdy gurdy, frame drum, or handbells, respectively).

Droning Swarm (Drone Only).name: Droning Swarm  (Drone Only)
