Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
Leather Armor.description: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

Dark Devotion.name: Dark Devotion
Dark Devotion.description: The fanatic has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The fanatic is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spell casting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 11, +3 to hit with spell attacks).

The fanatic has the following cleric spells prepared:

Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy

1st level (4 slots): command, inflict wounds, shield of faith

2nd level (3 slots): hold person, spiritual weapon

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The fanatic makes two melee attacks.

Dagger.name: Dagger
Dagger.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. Until the spell ends, the object sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like. Completely covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it as an action.

If you target an object held or worn by a hostile creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the spell.

Sacred Flame.name: Sacred Flame
Sacred Flame.description:
Flame-like radiance descends on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw.

The spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You create one of the following magical effects within range:

  • Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute.
  • You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.
  • You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.
  • You create a sound that originates from a point of your choice within range.
  • You cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.
  • You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. The spell has no effect if the target is undead, if it doesn't understand your language, or if your command is directly harmful to it.

Some typical commands and their effects follow. You might issue a command other than one described here. If you do so, the DM determines how the target behaves. If the target can't follow your command, the spell ends.

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target falls prone and then ends its turn.

Halt. The target doesn't move and takes no actions. A flying creature stays aloft, provided that it is able to do so. If it must move to stay aloft, it flies the minimum distance needed to remain in the air.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Inflict Wounds.name: Inflict Wounds
Inflict Wounds.description:
Make a melee spell Attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes 3d10 necrotic damage.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.

Shield of Faith.name: Shield of Faith
Shield of Faith.description: A shimmering field appears and surrounds a creature of your choice within range, granting it a +2 bonus to AC for the duration.

materials.value: A small parchment with a bit of holy text written on it.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be paralyzed for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional humanoid for each slot level above 2nd. The humanoids must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

materials.value: A small, straight piece of iron

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description:
You create a floating, spectral weapon within range that lasts for the duration or until you cast this spell again. When you cast the spell, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the weapon. On a hit, the target takes force damage equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the weapon up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

The weapon can take whatever form you choose. Clerics of deities who are associated with a particular weapon (as St. Cuthbert is known for his mace and Thor for his hammer) make this spell's effect resemble that weapon.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for every two slot levels above the 2nd.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and two [[/item Tentacle]] attacks.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition. Whenever the Poisoned target finishes a Long Rest, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.formula activity=tKShuY4vDM7tn9aC]].

Failure: The target's Hit Point maximum decreases by [[/damage 1d10 average]] and doesn't return to normal until the Poisoned condition ends on the target.

Success: The Poisoned condition ends.

save.condition: Whenever the Poisoned target finishes a Long Rest

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition. Whenever the Poisoned target finishes a Long Rest, it must make a Constitution Saving Throw or have its Hit Point maximum reduced by [[/damage 1d10 average]] until the Poisoned condition ends.

Tentacle.name: Tentacle
Tentacle.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]) from one of two tentacles.

Grappled.name: Grappled
Grappled.description:

Tentacle Slam.description:

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Stunned apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Stunned.name: Stunned
Stunned.description: The target has the &Reference[Stunned apply=false] condition until the start of the attacking creature's next turn.

vNrY5gd1iiqGtzbK.name: Gloomwood
vNrY5gd1iiqGtzbK.description:
Gloomwood

Blighted Treant

Habitat: Forest, Swamp

Gloomwoods were once treants in service to an archfey, but they were corrupted by a supernatural fungal blight. The growth bores through their trunks and into their souls, making the gloomwoods cruel and vicious, interested only in spreading more decay. Fungal spores drift from their trunks and branches, rotting any flesh and digging into the ground around them to spread the blight.

Secret. Carving the Sylvan name of the forest the gloomwood once called home into the creature’s trunk quells its aggression.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The gloomwood makes two attacks, using [[/item Slam]] or [[/item Fungal Fling]] in any combination.

Slam.name: Slam
Slam.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is &Reference[Grappled apply=false] (escape DC 16) from one of two branches. Until the grapple ends, the target is &Reference[Restrained apply=false].

Fungal Fling.name: Fungal Fling
Fungal Fling.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Spore Stomp.name: Spore Stomp
Spore Stomp.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. Hit or Miss: Each creature within a 20-foot sphere centered on the target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 36 ([[/r 8d8]]) poison damage and is &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

Blighted Aura.name: Blighted Aura
Blighted Aura.description: The ground within 20 feet of the gloomwood is difficult terrain from mushrooms and fungus that grow in the area. A creature that ends its turn in the area takes 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) necrotic damage.

Carved Past.name: Carved Past
Carved Past.description: As an action, a creature can use a dagger or woodcarver’s tools to carve the name in Sylvan of the ancient home of the gloomwoods into the gloomwood’s trunk. Until the gloomwood finishes a long rest, it can’t use its Fungal Fling or Spore Stomp actions.

Fungal Step.name: Fungal Step
Fungal Step.description: The gloomwood ignores difficult terrain caused by plants or fungi.

Ominous Rend.name: Ominous Rend
Ominous Rend.description: Melee Weapon Attack: your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/r 1d6 + 3]] plus your Wisdom modifier necrotic damage, and if the target is a creature, it is &Reference[Frightened apply=false] until the start of your next turn.

Baleful Howl.name: Baleful Howl
Baleful Howl.description: When a creature moves out of the grim’s reach, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or its speed is 0 until the end of the turn.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The grim can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. The grim takes [[/r 1d10]] force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Shared Fate.name: Shared Fate
Shared Fate.description: Add your proficiency bonus to any ability check or saving throw the grim makes.

Zombie.description:
Zombies

Undead Fortitude.name: Undead Fortitude
Undead Fortitude.description: If damage reduces the [[lookup @name lowercase]] to 0 Hit Points, it makes a Constitution saving throw (DC 5 plus the damage taken) unless the damage is Radiant or from a Critical Hit. On a successful save, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] drops to 1 Hit Point instead.

vZTvzdrNT55h7MSl.name: Lake Dredger
vZTvzdrNT55h7MSl.description:
Lake Dredger

Undead Aquatic Monster

Habitat: Coastal, Swamp, Underwater

Lake dredgers are Undead water behemoths, such as whales, giant fish, or dinosaurs. These creatures are reanimated through the deep, primal fear of the unknown horrors that lurk in the murky depths. They dwell in the beds of lakes, rivers, or oceans, dredging up the detritus to replenish their ever-rotting mass.

They also add to their decaying bulk by feeding on living creatures, especially drawn to those who exhibit fear of the deep. Once prey is devoured, it is impaled on its cracked ribs until the waterlogged flesh becomes one with the beast’s.

Secret. Lake dredgers exist because of the fear of the unknown, and their essence is undone in the presence of a captured or crafted depiction of themselves, such as a drawing or carving.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The lake dredger makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and one [[/item Tail]] attack.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is &Reference[Grappled apply=false] (escape DC 16), and it is &Reference[Restrained apply=false] until the grapple ends.

Tail.name: Tail
Tail.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Swallow.name: Swallow
Swallow.description: The lake dredger makes one [[/item Bite]] attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is &Reference[Restrained apply=false], it has three-quarters cover against attacks and other effects outside the lake dredger, and it takes 21 ([[/r 6d6]]) necrotic damage at the start of each of the lake dredger’s turns. The lake dredger can only have one creature swallowed at a time. As an action, the swallowed creature can escape through the lake dredger’s ribcage. The creature takes 11 (2d10) piercing damage and emerges in a space within 5 feet of the lake dredger. If the lake dredger dies, a swallowed creature is no longer &Reference[Restrained apply=false] by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Depicted Demise.name: Depicted Demise
Depicted Demise.description: The lake dredger takes 20 force damage at the start of its turn if it can see a creature holding a created depiction (such as a drawing, painting, or carving) of the lake dredger.

Silt Stealth.name: Silt Stealth
Silt Stealth.description: The lake dredger has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made when in an area with aquatic plants or seaweed.

w5HSV6sJhUTWI5sr.name: Crooked Effigy
w5HSV6sJhUTWI5sr.description:
Crooked Effigy

Splinter of Crooked Power

Habitat: Forest, Planar (Fey)

Treasure: None

Crooked effigies are servants of a twisted archfey known as the Crooked Queen. They are made of gnarled wood and show some bipedal and feminine features in their queen’s image. Crooked effigies impale their enemies with their branch-like arms and drag foes in close, where the thorns on their bodies carry the sting of a victim’s own corruption.

Secret. Crooked effigies are bound to the Old Ways, and they recoil from the tools of forging and tinkering—symbols of a growing civilization.

Impale.name: Impale
Impale.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &reference[grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 13) from one of two branch arms. Until the grapple ends, the target has the &reference[restrained apply=false] condition.

Crooked Thorns.name: Crooked Thorns
Crooked Thorns.description: At the start of each of its turns, the effigy deals [[/damage average]] damage to any creature it is grappling or any creature grappling it.

Old Bindings.name: Old Bindings
Old Bindings.description: The effigy takes an extra [[/damage average]] damage if it’s hit by an attack roll using @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.KndVe2insuctjIaj]{Smith's Tools} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.0d08g1i5WXnNrCNA]{Tinker's Tools} (treat as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.nfIRTECQIG81CvM4]{Club} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.XVK6TOL4sGItssAE]{Light Hammer}).

w7YbVNu3LnyLzfFF.name: Ghost Crawler
w7YbVNu3LnyLzfFF.description:
Ghost Crawler

Spirit Spider (Silk threads soaked in wine)

Habitat: Forest, Swamp, Underground

Treasure: None

Silent and nearly invisible, ghost crawlers skitter between the darkest corners, hiding and watching. Their diminutive, ghostly, spider-like bodies are ill-defined and as translucent as a wisp of smoke, while their legs are long, uneven, and jarringly solid. The webs they spin are ephemeral and ghastly, allowing the crawlers to sense through them regardless of the distance.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The crawler makes two [[/item Bite]] attacks.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and if the target is a creature, it has the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the crawler’s next turn.

Ether Webs.name: Ether Webs
Ether Webs.description: The crawler fills a 5-foot Cube with Invisible, ephemeral webs for 8 hours. If the web isn’t anchored between two solid masses (such as walls or trees) or layered across a floor, wall, or ceiling, the web collapses on itself and vanishes. When a creature touches the webbing, the crawler knows the location of the creature as long as they are on the same plane of existence.

Ephemeral Body.name: Ephemeral Body
Ephemeral Body.description: The crawler can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

Seer’s Strand.name: Seer’s Strand
Seer’s Strand.description: The crawler can see and hear through the space of its Ether Webs as if it were in that space.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The crawler can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Web Walker.name: Web Walker
Web Walker.description: The crawler ignores movement restrictions caused by webs, and the crawler knows the location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. It takes [[/damage 1d10 average type=force]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Life Drain.name: Life Drain
Life Drain.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature, its Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

wFyFNkclwWYWu3DX.name: The Harlequin
wFyFNkclwWYWu3DX.description:
Wayward Haint

Lost Soul Bound to Regret

Habitat: Any

Treasure: None

Wayward haints are restless spirits stuck between the realms of the living and the dead. Be it a curse or an unresolved conflict from their previous life, a haint can’t rest until their unfinished business is resolved.

Haints only show hints of who they were in life, taking on a more symbolic form related to the hurt or loss they can’t let go of. They tend to repeat their monotonous actions—often imitating those performed in life or reenacting their sorrow—over and over for eternity. When provoked, they can display a volatile temper and lash out with a crushing wave of the grief and indecision that binds their spirit.

Secret. Wayward haints can be trapped in empty bottles if they’re tricked or forced to pass over one.

Bottle Trap.name: Bottle Trap
Bottle Trap.description: A haint that enters the space of an upright, empty bottle must succeed on a DC 16 Charisma saving throw or be drawn into the bottle, and a cork or stopper appears to close the bottle. The trapped haint can see and hear through the bottle out to 10 feet, and any creature in that range can hear the haint. The haint is released if the bottle breaks or another creature opens it.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The haint can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. It takes [[/damage average]] damage if it ends its turn inside a solid object.

Draining Regret.name: Draining Regret
Draining Regret.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target gains 1 &reference[exhaustion apply=false] level. This can’t raise the target’s Exhaustion level above 5, and all Exhaustion levels gained from this action end when the target finishes a Short or Long Rest, or if it receives a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.F0GsG0SJzsIOacwV]{Lesser Restoration} spell or similar magic

wGUuSIkSqT1dYZC8.name: Violet Fungus
wGUuSIkSqT1dYZC8.description: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Rotting Touch.name: Rotting Touch
Rotting Touch.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+2 to hit,, 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d8) necrotic damage.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The fungus makes 1d4 Rotting Touch attacks.

False Appearance.name: False Appearance
False Appearance.description: While the violet fungus remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary fungus.

wPch5z2x4VlD7Kd5.name: Wildpyre
wPch5z2x4VlD7Kd5.description:
Wildpyre

Spectral Blazing Beast

Habitat: Any

When animals perish in flames, their escaping spirits can cling to the fire that took their lives and arise as wildpyres. These Undead resemble the kind of animal they were in life, though made of ghostly flames. They lash out at anything in their vicinity, fanning the flames that consumed them.

Secret. Water can extinguish the undying flames of wildpyres, despite their ephemeral existence.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The wildpyre makes two [[/item Blazing Rend]] attacks and uses Flame Bind if available.

Blazing Rend.name: Blazing Rend
Blazing Rend.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature within 5 feet of the target takes an action to douse the flames, the target takes 2 ([[/r 1d4]]) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. If the target is a creature no larger than the wildpyre, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Flame Bind.name: Flame Bind
Flame Bind.description: The wildpyre creates a ring of ghostly flame around a creature it can see within 60 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or become &Reference[Restrained apply=false]. At the end of each of the target’s turns, it repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. During the target’s turn, it can choose to end the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition by taking 6 ([[/r 1d12]]) fire damage plus 6 (1d12) necrotic damage.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The wildpyre can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Quenching Water.name: Quenching Water
Quenching Water.description: Any water affects the wildpyre as if it were holy water.

wQmCU77SNKfNPufu.name: Sister Rain
wQmCU77SNKfNPufu.description:

Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
Chain Shirt.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:

Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy

1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, guiding bolt, sanctuary

2nd level (3 slots): lesser restoration, spiritual weapon

3rd level (2 slots): dispel magic, spirit guardians

Divine Eminence.name: Divine Eminence
Divine Eminence.description:
As a bonus action, the priest can expend a spell slot to cause its melee weapon attacks to magically deal an extra 10 (3d6) radiant damage to a target on a hit.

This benefit lasts until the end of the turn. If the priest expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by 1d6 for each level above 1st.

Mace.name: Mace
Mace.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+2 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage.

Sacred Flame.name: Sacred Flame
Sacred Flame.description:
Flame-like radiance descends on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw.

The spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You create one of the following magical effects within range:

  • Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute.
  • You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.
  • You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.
  • You create a sound that originates from a point of your choice within range.
  • You cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.
  • You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

Guiding Bolt.name: Guiding Bolt
Guiding Bolt.description:
A flash of light streaks toward a creature of your choice within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 4d6 radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against this target before the end of your next turn has advantage, thanks to the mystical dim light glittering on the target until then.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

Sanctuary.name: Sanctuary
Sanctuary.description:
You ward a creature within range against attack. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn't protect the warded creature from area effects, such as the explosion of a Fireball.

If the warded creature makes an attack or casts a spell that affects an enemy creature, this spell ends.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and can end either one disease or one condition afflicting it. The condition can be blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description:
You create a floating, spectral weapon within range that lasts for the duration or until you cast this spell again. When you cast the spell, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the weapon. On a hit, the target takes force damage equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the weapon up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

The weapon can take whatever form you choose. Clerics of deities who are associated with a particular weapon (as St. Cuthbert is known for his mace and Thor for his hammer) make this spell's effect resemble that weapon.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for every two slot levels above the 2nd.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 4th level or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

Spirit Guardians.name: Spirit Guardians
Spirit Guardians.description:
You call forth spirits to protect you. They flit around you to a distance of 15 feet for the duration. If you are good or neutral, their spectral form appears angelic or fey (your choice). If you are evil, they appear fiendish.

When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it. An affected creature's speed is halved in the area, and when the creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 3d8 radiant damage (if you are good or neutral) or 3d8 necrotic damage (if you are evil). On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. Until the spell ends, the object sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like. Completely covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it as an action.

If you target an object held or worn by a hostile creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the spell.

Cure Wounds.name: Cure Wounds
Cure Wounds.description:
A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

wTFFZ0NBnE3NKN4e.name: Skitterswarm
wTFFZ0NBnE3NKN4e.description:
Skitterswarm

Fetid Fey Centipedes

Habitat: Planar (Fey), Underground, Urban

Disgusting Fey who delight in warping flesh and spreading sickness can gather into squirming masses of centipedes known as skitterswarms. These swarms lurk in places where foulness accumulates and often serve centipede hags.

Secret. Skitterswarms can’t resist dead bodies and are drawn to the corpses of Humanoids.

Infesting Bite.name: Infesting Bite
Infesting Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, or 3 ([[/r 1d6]]) piercing damage if the swarm has half its hit points or fewer. If the target is a creature, a centipede infests its body. While infested, the target takes 3 (1d6) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. The infestation ends when the target regains hit points or is targeted by an effect that ends the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition.

Body Burrowing.name: Body Burrowing
Body Burrowing.description: If the swarm can see the corpse of a Humanoid at the start of its turn, it must move up to its speed toward the corpse. Once it enters the corpse’s space, it must remain there for 1 hour, after which time the corpse’s flesh putrefies.

Swarm.name: Swarm
Swarm.description: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny centipede. The swarm can’t regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

Vile Vermin.name: Vile Vermin
Vile Vermin.description: Any creature that starts its turn in the swarm’s space must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or contract a wasting affliction. While afflicted, the target can’t regain hit points, and it repeats the save when it finishes a long rest or when targeted by an effect that ends the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition, recovering from the affliction on a success. A creature that succeeds on the initial saving throw is immune to the Vile Vermin trait of all skitterswarms for 24 hours.

Mutant Nurse.name: Mutant Nurse
Mutant Nurse.description:
Mutant Nurse

Caregiver Twisted by Mutation

Habitat: Any

Mutant nurses resemble the Humanoids they once were, though an alien mutation writhes within their bodies. They serve as caretakers of healing institutions, though they are fully beholden to whoever, or whatever, altered them to their current state. The nurses all wear a white porcelain mask made in the likeness of their original features, which grounds them to their sense of self and prevents them from losing their will fully to the aberrant influence that changed them.

Secret. Mutant nurses go berserk if their masks are destroyed or taken from them, or they become unresponsive if there are no other creatures nearby.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The nurse makes two [[/item Stab]] attacks. If it hits a creature with a Stab attack, it can use Inject if available.

Stab.name: Stab
Stab.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Inject.name: Inject
Inject.description: A creature the nurse hit with a Stab attack this turn must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) psychic damage and is &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target also falls &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] while &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] in this way, until it takes damage, or until a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to shake it awake. On a successful save the target takes half as much damage only.

Mutation.name: Mutation
Mutation.description:
The nurse has one of the following mutation action options:

  • Cerebral Graft. Part of a psionic creature’s brain is grafted to the nurse’s own, and emits psychic pain. One creature within 30 feet of the nurse must make a DC 13 Intelligence saving throw, taking 11 ([[/r 2d10]]) psychic damage and is &Reference[Stunned apply=false] until the end of its next turn on a failure, or half as much damage on a success.

  • Tentacle Lash. A tentacle writhes beneath the nurse’s skin or clothes, and can lash out in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) bludgeoning damage and the target is knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false] on a failure, or half as much damage only on a success.

Catalyst.name: Catalyst
Catalyst.description: The nurse injects itself with a stimulant. Until the start of the nurse’s next turn, its speed is doubled, it can make one extra Stab attack when it takes the Multiattack action, and it gains a +2 bonus to AC.

Anchoring Mask.name: Anchoring Mask
Anchoring Mask.description: The nurse has a porcelain mask (AC 15; HP 15; immunity to poison and psychic damage). If the nurse starts its turn and isn’t wearing its mask, it must move as far as possible to retrieve its mask if possible, or to reach the closest creature it can see or hear, and it must attack that creature. If it can’t see or hear any other creatures, it either stands still and does nothing, or it destroys any objects in its vicinity (50 percent chance of either).

Parry.description: Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is [[lookup @activation.condition activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]]. Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] adds [[lookup @roll.formula activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]] to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

Use.condition: hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon

x7jTLaZHCNcnhqEE.name: Vermin Infestation
x7jTLaZHCNcnhqEE.description:
Vermin Infestation

Swarm of Verminous Familiars

Habitat: Planar (Fey), Urban

A nightmarish amalgamation of centipedes, pigeons, and weasels, vermin infestations are thankfully rare. These swarms of Fey roil and scratch and rend with individual pigeons streaking out to tear at distant foes, becoming a frenzied mass that throws all subtlety and coordination to the wind. At times, the constituent vermin-like Fey seem to be at each other’s throats as much as any victims of the swarm.

Secret. The Fey spirits that make up a vermin infestation loathe one another and can be tricked into fighting among themselves by a clever suggestion.

Shred.name: Shred
Shred.description:
Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, or 9 ([[/r 2d4 + 4]]) piercing damage if the swarm has half its hit points or fewer. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature in the swarm’s space, the target is &Reference[Grappled apply=false] (escape DC 14). The swarm can have one creature &Reference[Grappled apply=false] at a time.

At the start of each of the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] target’s turns, roll [[/r 1d6]] to see which of the following effects it suffers:

1–2: Centipede Sting. The target takes 4 ([[/r 1d8]]) poison damage and is &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] until the start of its next turn.

3–4: Pigeon Cry. The target takes 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) psychic damage.

5–6: Weasel Drain. The target takes 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) necrotic damage, and its hit point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken until it finishes a long rest.

Infighting.name: Infighting
Infighting.description: As an action, a creature that insinuates that the components of the swarm are conspiring against each other and succeeds on a DC 15 Charisma (Deception) check deals 10 necrotic damage to the swarm.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The swarm can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Swarm.name: Swarm
Swarm.description: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can fit through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. The swarm can’t regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

xA6qV8U9Cte3eGkC.name: Shadow
xA6qV8U9Cte3eGkC.description:

Amorphous.name: Amorphous
Amorphous.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

Sunlight Weakness.name: Sunlight Weakness
Sunlight Weakness.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on D20 Tests.

Draining Swipe.name: Draining Swipe
Draining Swipe.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target's Strength score decreases by [[/r 1d4]]. The target dies if this reduces that score to 0. If a Humanoid is slain by this attack, a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmShadow00000000]{Shadow} rises from the corpse [[/r 1d4]] hours later.

Foundry Note

This feature also provides an Active Effect (AE) to modify the target's Strength Score. When the target roll's their d4 to determine the loss, you can apply the respective AE to the target's sheet.

attack.chatFlavor: On Hit: Target's STR score decreases

Shadow Stealth.name: Shadow Stealth
Shadow Stealth.description: While in Dim Light or Darkness, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes the &Reference[Hide] action.

xEyi5sVvYiQ7I677.name: Dire Wolf
xEyi5sVvYiQ7I677.description: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Keen Hearing and Smell.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
Keen Hearing and Smell.description: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+5 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage.

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

xcfItWQMdjf5MK2k.name: The Grinning Sinner
xcfItWQMdjf5MK2k.description:
The Grinning Sinner

Dealer of Jinxes

Habitat: Coastal, Swamp

Once the dashing pirate captain Briggsy Kratch, the crocodile-folk now known as the Grinning Sinner made a bargain for power with a spirit known as Snake Eye Jack. The sinner grew discontent with the power he was gifted and tricked Jack into a coffin before sealing him inside. Now the Grinning Sinner siphons his trapped patron’s cursed power and makes bargains of his own to snare the souls of the desperate and foolish.

Secret. The Grinning Sinner holds his prowess and reputation as a fearsome and successful pirate captain above all; causing him to doubt his renown can turn his hexed magic against him.

The Grinning Sinner’s Lair

The Grinning Sinner’s lair is the derelict riverboat casino, the Dead Man’s Hand.

The region containing the Grinning Sinner’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Fate’s Wheel. Within 1 mile of the lair, if the number rolled on a die to restore hit points is even, increase the number rolled by 1. If the number rolled is odd, reduce it by 1.

Run of Bad Luck. Within 1 mile of the lair, a creature that rolls a 1 on an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw must subtract 1d4 from its next roll that isn’t a damage roll.

If the Grinning Sinner dies or moves his lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Spellcasting (Requires Curse Bottle).name: Spellcasting  (Requires Curse Bottle)
Spellcasting (Requires Curse Bottle).description:
The sinner casts one of the following spells using his Curse Bottle (and no other material components) and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBane000000]{Bane}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBestowCurs]{Bestow Curse}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMajorImage]{Major Image}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplRemoveCurs]{Remove Curse}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplAnimateDea]{Animate Dead}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCreation00]{Creation}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDarkness00]{Darkness}

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The sinner makes two attacks, using [[/item Hex Grasp]] or [[/item Blunderbuss]] in any combination. He can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.95K2aUhAGV9qXjnf].

Hex Grasp.name: Hex Grasp
Hex Grasp.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a creature, it is cursed until the start of the sinner’s next turn, or until the sinner curses it in this way again. While cursed, the target has Disadvantage on attack rolls and on ability checks that rely on an ability of the sinner’s choice.

Blunderbuss.name: Blunderbuss
Blunderbuss.description: Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], range 30/90 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is pushed up to 10 feet straight away.

Curse Blast.name: Curse Blast
Curse Blast.description:
The sinner unleashes one of the following curses from his blunderbuss:

Jack’s Anguish. A magenta wave fires out with a deep, wailing moan.

  • Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature in a 30-foot Cone.

  • Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[Frightened apply=false] condition. The target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it automatically succeeds.

  • Success: Half damage only.

Shadowy Friends. A wave of shadow coughs forth and wraps around foes.

  • Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature in a 15-foot Cone.

  • Failure: The target has the &reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition until the end of the sinner’s next turn. If a Paralyzed target takes damage, the condition ends early.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: The sinner can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The sinner regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

Barbed Curse.name: Barbed Curse
Barbed Curse.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 17, one creature cursed by the sinner or affected by his @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBane000000]{Bane} spell within 30 feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Jinxed Ground.name: Jinxed Ground
Jinxed Ground.description:
Charisma Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature within a 20-foot Emanation originating from the sinner.

Failure: The target has the &reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Failure or Success: The sinner can’t take this action again until the start of his next turn.

Grinning Grasp.name: Grinning Grasp
Grinning Grasp.description: The sinner teleports to an unoccupied space he can see within 30 feet. He makes one [[/item Hex Grasp]] attack before or after teleporting and can’t take this action again until the start of his next turn.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description: The Grinning Sinner’s lair is the derelict riverboat casino, the Dead Man’s Hand. The region containing the Grinning Sinner’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects: If the Grinning Sinner dies or moves his lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Fate’s Wheel.name: Fate’s Wheel
Fate’s Wheel.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, if the number rolled on a die to restore hit points is even, increase the number rolled by 1. If the number rolled is odd, reduce it by 1.

Run of Bad Luck.name: Run of Bad Luck
Run of Bad Luck.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, a creature that rolls a 1 on an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw must subtract [[/r 1d4]] from its next roll that isn’t a damage roll.

Coffin Rider.name: Coffin Rider
Coffin Rider.description: The sinner has a magic coffin that has Immunity to all damage. While standing on the coffin, the sinner rides it on a ghostly wave of swamp water with a Speed of 60 feet and can move over liquids as if they were solid.

Curse Bottle.name: Curse Bottle
Curse Bottle.description: The sinner has a bottle that holds cursed magic. The bottle has AC 15, HP 25, and Immunity to all damage except Force. If the bottle is destroyed, the sinner can magically create a new one when he finishes a Long Rest.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If the sinner fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

Overweening Pride.name: Overweening Pride
Overweening Pride.description: As a Bonus Action, a creature can insult the sinner’s skill and renown as a pirate captain. The sinner must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take [[/damage average]] damage and have Disadvantage on attack rolls against any target other than the creature.

Bane.name: Bane
Bane.description:
Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within range must each make a Charisma saving throw. Whenever a target that fails this save makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target must subtract 1d4 from the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Bane.name: Bane
Bane.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target must subtract 1d4 from the attack roll or save.

Bestow Curse.name: Bestow Curse
Bestow Curse.description:
You touch a creature, which must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become cursed for the duration. Until the curse ends, the target suffers one of the following effects of your choice:

  • Choose one ability. The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with that ability (Curse Ability activity).
  • The target has Disadvantage on attack rolls against you (Curse Attacks activity).
  • In combat, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw at the start of each of its turns or be forced to take the &Reference[Dodge] action on that turn (Curse Actions activity).
  • If you deal damage to the target with an attack roll or a spell, the target takes an extra 1d8 Necrotic damage (Curse Resilience activity).

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. If you cast this spell using a level 4 spell slot, you can maintain Concentration on it for up to 10 minutes. If you use a level 5+ spell slot, the spell doesn't require Concentration, and the duration becomes 8 hours (level 5–6 slot) or 24 hours (level 7–8 slot). If you use a level 9 spell slot, the spell lasts until dispelled.

Cursed Charisma.name: Cursed Charisma
Cursed Charisma.description: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with the chosen ability.

Cursed Constitution.name: Cursed Constitution
Cursed Constitution.description: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with the chosen ability.

Cursed Dexterity.name: Cursed Dexterity
Cursed Dexterity.description: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with the chosen ability.

Cursed Intelligence.name: Cursed Intelligence
Cursed Intelligence.description: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with the chosen ability.

Cursed Strength.name: Cursed Strength
Cursed Strength.description: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with the chosen ability.

Cursed Wisdom.name: Cursed Wisdom
Cursed Wisdom.description: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with the chosen ability.

Cursed Attacks.name: Cursed Attacks
Cursed Attacks.description: The target has Disadvantage on attack rolls against you.

Cursed Actions.name: Cursed Actions
Cursed Actions.description: In combat, the target must succeed on a [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc format=long]] at the start of each of its turns or be forced to take the &Reference[Dodge] action on that turn.

Cursed Resilience.name: Cursed Resilience
Cursed Resilience.description: If you deal damage to the target with an attack roll or a spell, the target takes an extra [[/damage 1d8 type=necrotic]] damage.

Major Image.name: Major Image
Major Image.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot Cube. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted, but it can't deal damage or cause conditions.

If you are within range of the illusion, you can take a Magic action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the illusion to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, for things can pass through it. A creature that takes a Study action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring Concentration, if cast with a level 4+ spell slot.

Remove Curse.name: Remove Curse
Remove Curse.description: At your touch, all curses affecting one creature or object end. If the object is a cursed magic item, its curse remains, but the spell breaks its owner's Attunement to the object so it can be removed or discarded.

Animate Dead.name: Animate Dead
Animate Dead.description:
Choose a pile of bones or a corpse of a Medium or Small Humanoid within range. The target becomes an Undead creature: a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmSkeleton000000]{Skeleton} if you chose bones or a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmZombie00000000]{Zombie} if you chose a corpse.

On each of your turns, you can take a Bonus Action to mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 60 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move on its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature takes the Dodge action and moves only to avoid harm. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.

The creature is under your control for 24 hours, after which it stops obeying any command you've given it. To maintain control of the creature for another 24 hours, you must cast this spell on the creature again before the current 24-hour period ends. This use of the spell reasserts your control over up to four creatures you have animated with this spell rather than animating a new creature.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You animate or reassert control over two additional Undead creatures for each spell slot level above 3. Each of the creatures must come from a different corpse or pile of bones.

materials.value: a drop of blood, a piece of flesh, and a pinch of bone dust

Creation.name: Creation
Creation.description:
You pull wisps of shadow material from the Shadowfell to create an object within range. It is either an object of vegetable matter (soft goods, rope, wood, and the like) or mineral matter (stone, crystal, metal, and the like). The object must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube, and the object must be of a form and material that you have seen.

The spell's duration depends on the object's material, as shown in the Materials table. If the object is composed of multiple materials, use the shortest duration. Using any object created by this spell as another spell's Material component causes the other spell to fail.

MaterialDuration
Vegetable matter24 hours
Stone or crystal12 hours
Precious metals1 hour
Gems10 minutes
Adamantine or mithral1 minute

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Cube increases by 5 feet for each spell slot level above 5.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

xn8fdH3xobiXuf10.name: Mutant Nurse
xn8fdH3xobiXuf10.description:
Mutant Nurse

Caregiver Twisted by Mutation

Habitat: Any

Treasure: Arcana

Mutant nurses resemble the Humanoids they once were, though an alien mutation writhes within their bodies. They serve as caretakers of healing institutions, though they are fully beholden to whoever, or whatever, altered them to their current state. The nurses all wear a white porcelain mask made in the likeness of their original features, which grounds them to their sense of self and prevents them from losing their will fully to the aberrant influence that changed them.

Secret. Mutant nurses go berserk if their masks are destroyed or taken from them, or they become unresponsive if there are no other creatures nearby.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The nurse makes two [[/item Stab]] attacks. If it hits a creature with a Stab attack, it can use Inject if available.

Stab.name: Stab
Stab.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Inject.name: Inject
Inject.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC 13, a creature the nurse hit with a Stab attack this turn.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 hour.

Failure by 5 or More: The &reference[poisoned apply=false] target also has the &reference[unconscious apply=false] condition until it takes damage or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to shake it awake.

Success: Half damage only.

Mutation.name: Mutation
Mutation.description:
The nurse has one of the following mutation action options:

  • Cerebral Graft. Part of a psionic creature’s brain is grafted to the nurse’s own.

    Intelligence Saving Throw: DC 13, one creature within 30 feet.

    Failure: 11 ([[/r 2d10]]) Psychic damage, and the target has the &reference[stunned apply=false]condition until the end of its next turn.

    Success: Half damage only.

  • Tentacle Lash. A tentacle writhes beneath the nurse’s skin or clothes.

    Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 13, each creature in a 30-foot Cone.

    Failure: 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the &reference[prone apply=false] condition.

    Success: Half damage only.

Catalyst.name: Catalyst
Catalyst.description: The nurse injects itself with a stimulant. Until the start of the nurse’s next turn, its Speed is doubled, it can make one extra Stab attack when it takes the Multiattack action, and it gains a +2 bonus to AC.

Anchoring Mask.name: Anchoring Mask
Anchoring Mask.description: The nurse has a porcelain mask (AC 15; HP 15; Immunity to Poison and Psychic damage). If the nurse starts its turn and isn’t wearing its mask, it must move as far as possible to retrieve its mask if possible, or to reach the closest creature it can see or hear, and it must attack that creature. If it can’t see or hear any other creatures, it either stands still and does nothing, or it destroys any objects in its vicinity (50 percent chance of either).

yKZvLtArVPgaAXlW.name: Crooked Hare
yKZvLtArVPgaAXlW.description:
Crooked Hare

Crooked Trickster (Anything stolen or gained by trickery)

Habitat: Forest, Hill, Planar (Fey)

Crooked hares look like rabbits at first glance, but their true nature is given away by the antlers and wings they grow and the cunning gleam in their eyes. They are mischievous tricksters that delight in stealing things from unsuspecting travelers and hiding them in amusing, slightly dangerous, or just unlikely places. If roused to anger or cornered, crooked hares deliver a bite that carries an unsettling—if minor—curse. Despite their troublesome nature, crooked hares might serve as companions for woods-crafty folk who have a good sense of humor.

Twisting Bite.name: Twisting Bite
Twisting Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 11 Charisma saving throw or become cursed for 24 hours. The cursed creature’s limbs sporadically twist and move in unnatural ways, giving the creature disadvantage on attack rolls and on ability checks that rely on Charisma.

Trackless Step.name: Trackless Step
Trackless Step.description: The crooked hare leaves no tracks, or it leaves the tracks of a Large or smaller creature of its choice. If it isn’t &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false], it can share the effects of this trait with another creature within 5 feet of itself (no action required).

yaraw6vTECCDLCmd.name: Moonshine
yaraw6vTECCDLCmd.description:
Moonshine

Lingering Soul Guide (Broken glass and powdered onyx)

Habitat: Any

When a person dies with unfinished business, their soul can remain shackled to the living world as an Undead spirit. Usually such spirits rest and move on when their business is concluded, but some remain as companions, guides, and helpers for the living. Moonshines are spirits who resolved their emotional tethers but have chosen to linger on. They often take a liking to a living person and choose to help them through their life’s journey.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The moonshine makes two [[/item Gloomy Touch]] attacks.

Gloomy Touch.name: Gloomy Touch
Gloomy Touch.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Siphon Life.name: Siphon Life
Siphon Life.description: The moonshine magically targets a creature that isn’t a Construct or Undead that it can see within 5 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be &Reference[Stunned apply=false] until the end of the moonshine’s next turn, and the moonshine or a creature of its choice within 30 feet of it regains 3 ([[/r 1d6]]) hit points.

Detect Life.name: Detect Life
Detect Life.description: The moonshine magically senses the direction of creatures up to 60 feet away that aren’t Constructs or Undead.

Ephemeral.name: Ephemeral
Ephemeral.description: The moonshine can’t wear or carry anything.

Illumination.name: Illumination
Illumination.description: The moonshine sheds bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The moonshine can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]], +4 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

2/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCommand000]{Command}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHoldPerson]{Hold Person}

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Command.name: Command
Command.description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. Choose the command from these options:

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target has the Prone condition and then ends its turn.

Halt. On its turn, the target doesn't move and takes no action or Bonus Action.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can affect one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSpiritualW]{Spiritual Weapon} spell, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

R4vGCo9yAhjK05ka.name: Spiritual Weapon
R4vGCo9yAhjK05ka.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.
